original: bsrung ba dang sba ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bsrung ba dang sba ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show the difference between protection and concealment, he says:

original: 'di gnyis ni tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: These two are not different.

original: gdul ba nye bar 'ongs ba dag la de'i sgra bsgrub cing phan gdags pa'i phyir gnyi ga gsungs so //
analyzed: gdul ba nye bar 'ongs ba dag la de'i sgra bsgrub cing phan gdags pa'i phyir gnyi ga gsungs so //
translated: For those who are close to being disciplined, the word of that is established and beneficial, so both are taught.

original: yang na sdig pa la 'jug pa ngag bzlog pa ni bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sdig pa la 'jug pa ngag bzlog pa ni bsrung ba'o //
translated: Or, the prevention of engagement in evil is protection.

original: dge ba la 'jug pa dag ni sba ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba la 'jug pa dag ni sba ba'o //
translated: The concealment of engagement in virtue is concealment.

original: phyir rol gyi gnod pa dag las bsrung ba dang / nang dag tu sba ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: phyir rol gyi gnod pa dag las bsrung ba dang / nang dag tu sba ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Because of the protection from external harm and the concealment within, and so on.

original: bdag nyid sdug par byed pa mi shes pa de dag la bdag nyid sdug par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pas de la gzhug pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid sdug par byed pa mi shes pa de dag la bdag nyid sdug par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pas de la gzhug pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: For those who do not know how to make themselves attractive, by teaching the nature of making oneself attractive, this is taught in order to engage them in that.

original: bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba'am sba bar ni su zhig gis nus zhes pa dang / gang mi 'tshe ba zhes smos te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan bsrung ba'am sba bar ni su zhig gis nus zhes pa dang / gang mi 'tshe ba zhes smos te /
translated: Who is able to protect or conceal oneself and others?

original: su zhig mi 'tshe ba @149a * //
analyzed: su zhig mi 'tshe ba @149a * //
translated: And who is not harmful?

original: la stod par byed ces pa la bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: la stod par byed ces pa la bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to show that, he says:🔽Who praises the harmless one?

original: phyogs rnams kun na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyogs rnams kun na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says in all directions and so on.🔽When Queen Mālikā invited the Blessed One, she dug her own grave and stirred up the kitchen.

original: gang gi tshe btsun mo phreng ldan mas bcom ldan 'das spyan drangs pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyi lag btsugs shing tshang mang du g-yos bya ba las rgyal po 'di'i chung ma 'gran zla zhig yod pas 'di'i don byed cing 'di la dga' bo zhes phra ma byas
analyzed: gang gi tshe btsun mo phreng ldan mas bcom ldan 'das spyan drangs pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyi lag btsugs shing tshang mang du g-yos bya ba las rgyal po 'di'i chung ma 'gran zla zhig yod pas 'di'i don byed cing 'di la dga' bo zhes phra ma byas
translated: The king's wife was jealous and slandered her, saying, She is doing this for her own sake and out of love for her.

original: so // de nas rgyal po de 'khrugs nas /
analyzed: so // de nas rgyal po de 'khrugs nas /
translated: Then the king became angry.

original: ral gyi rnon bo shubs nas phyung ste btsun mo phreng ldan ma la bsdigs nas 'jig rten na khyod la ches sdug pa gang yin smros shig ces byas so //
analyzed: ral gyi rnon bo shubs nas phyung ste btsun mo phreng ldan ma la bsdigs nas 'jig rten na khyod la ches sdug pa gang yin smros shig ces byas so //
translated: He drew his sharp sword from its scabbard, threatened Queen Mālikā, and said, Speak! Who in the world do you love more than me?

original: de bag tsha ba med par bdag nyid yin no zhes smras so//
analyzed: de bag tsha ba med par bdag nyid yin no zhes smras so//
translated: She fearlessly said, Myself.

original: de lta bu'i gnas skabs las bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas skabs las bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One spoke two verses about such a situation.

original: gzhan dag ni drug sdes dge slong rnams la rgyun du rnam par 'tshe ba byas pas de'i dbang du mdzad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni drug sdes dge slong rnams la rgyun du rnam par 'tshe ba byas pas de'i dbang du mdzad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the six disciples were the basis for the Buddha’s statement because they constantly harassed the monks.

original: phyogs rnams kun du zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi dbye ba ma lus pa ste phyogs mtha' dag go //
analyzed: phyogs rnams kun du zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi dbye ba ma lus pa ste phyogs mtha' dag go //
translated: “In all directions” means in all the divisions of space, in all directions.

original: yongs brtags kyang zhes bya ba ni brtags shing btsal kyang ngo //
analyzed: yongs brtags kyang zhes bya ba ni brtags shing btsal kyang ngo //
translated: “Even though thoroughly examined” means even though examined and sought.

original: sems zhes bya ba ni blos so //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni blos so //
translated: “Mind” means by the intellect.

original: kyang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba dang / rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni nges par gzung ba dang / rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba'o //
translated: The word “even” is used to indicate certainty and to connect the verse to a different topic.

original: ma mthong na zhes bya ba ni de nyid ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma mthong na zhes bya ba ni de nyid ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Not seen” means not perceived.

original: ches sdug ces bya ba ni ches 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ches sdug ces bya ba ni ches 'dod pa'o //
translated: “More lovely” means more desirable.

original: ga las she na /🔽bdag las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ga las she na / bdag las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why?🔽The text says, “than oneself.”

original: bdag nyid las te /
analyzed: bdag nyid las te /
translated: Than oneself.

original: bdag dang mnyam par sdug pa ni med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: bdag dang mnyam par sdug pa ni med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: There is no one more lovely than oneself.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de bzhin no //
translated: “Thus” means in that way.

original: ji ltar sems can gcig bdag nyid la dga' ba ltar ni gzhan la ches dga' ba gang yang cung zad med do //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can gcig bdag nyid la dga' ba ltar ni gzhan la ches dga' ba gang yang cung zad med do //
translated: There is not the slightest reason to love others more than oneself, as one does oneself.

original: de bzhin du bdag dang gzhan dag bdag la so sor sdug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang gzhan dag bdag la so sor sdug pa nyid do //
translated: In the same way, oneself and others are equally dear to oneself.

original: so so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: so so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba ste /
translated: The word each refers to the various kinds of beings.

original: skye ba dang phyogs dang skye gnas so //
analyzed: skye ba dang phyogs dang skye gnas so //
translated: It refers to birth, place, and womb.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba srog chags gzhan dag kyang bdag nyid bzhin du sdug pa yin no zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba srog chags gzhan dag kyang bdag nyid bzhin du sdug pa yin no zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: The word others refers to other living beings, who are to be understood as being dear in the same way as oneself.

original: ji skad du //🔽bde ba la gnas shing sdug bsngal bral ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad du // bde ba la gnas shing sdug bsngal bral ba ni /
translated: As it is said:🔽Having understood that all beings are equal,

original: sems can mnyam par sems par rtogs byas te //
analyzed: sems can mnyam par sems par rtogs byas te //
translated: one should abide in happiness and be free from suffering.

original: de bas bdag ni 'dod pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: de bas bdag ni 'dod pa gang yin pa //
translated: Therefore, whatever I desire,

original: de ni gzhan dag la yang spyad mi bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni gzhan dag la yang spyad mi bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: I should not do to others.

original: de'i phyir gnod mi bya zhes bya ba ni 'tshe ba mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod mi bya zhes bya ba ni 'tshe ba mi bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, do not harm means do not injure.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan no //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan no //
translated: The word others refers to other living beings.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what means?

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The verse says I.

original: @149b bdag la phan par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: @149b bdag la phan par 'dod pa ste /
translated: It is the one who desires to benefit himself,

original: gang bdag la sdug par byed par 'dod pa des ni gzhan la gnod par mi bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: gang bdag la sdug par byed par 'dod pa des ni gzhan la gnod par mi bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: who desires to do what is agreeable to himself, who should not harm another.

original: tshigs su bcad pa snga ma'i don de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa snga ma'i don de gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to make clear the meaning of the previous verse, he says:

original: thams cad la yang srog 'di sdug / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽thams cad chad pas 'jigs pas na ;
analyzed: thams cad la yang srog 'di sdug / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / thams cad chad pas 'jigs pas na ;
translated: All are afraid of being killed, etc.🔽All are afraid of being killed, etc.

original: / zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad 'jigs shing bag tsha bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad 'jigs shing bag tsha bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: means that all sentient beings are afraid and anxious.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: chad pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chad pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From being killed, etc.

original: gang gi phyir sems dang ldan pa su zhig gnod pas mi 'jigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems dang ldan pa su zhig gnod pas mi 'jigs par 'gyur /
translated: What sentient being who has a mind would not be afraid of being killed, etc.?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?🔽 Because all have a desire to live, etc.

original: 'di ltar / thams cad la yang srog 'di sdug / ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar / thams cad la yang srog 'di sdug / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Because all living beings desire and do not abandon life.🔽

original: gang gi phyir srog chags thams cad ni tshe 'di 'dod cing yongs su mi gtong ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog chags thams cad ni tshe 'di 'dod cing yongs su mi gtong ba yin te /
translated: All are desirous of happiness means that all sentient beings desire and do not abandon happiness.

original: de bas na thams cad srog la gnod par byed pa'i chad pa nyid kyis 'jigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad srog la gnod par byed pa'i chad pa nyid kyis 'jigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all are afraid of punishment that threatens their life.

original: des na de'i phyir smras pa /🔽rang gi nyams las dpag byas te //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir smras pa / rang gi nyams las dpag byas te //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽“One should infer from one’s own experience.

original: zhes bya ba bdag rang nyid las dper bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bdag rang nyid las dper bya ba'o //
translated: ” One should take oneself as an example.

original: brdeg par mi bya zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis gnod cing 'tshe ba mi bya ba'o //🔽gsad mi bya zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lag gis kyang /
analyzed: brdeg par mi bya zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis gnod cing 'tshe ba mi bya ba'o // gsad mi bya zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lag gis kyang /
translated: “One should not strike” means that one should not harm or injure oneself or others.

original: gzhan bsad pa la nan tan mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan bsad pa la nan tan mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not kill” means that one should not persist in killing others, even at the hands of others.

original: yang bshad pa /🔽ji ltar ha la ha la'i dug / rang ngam yang na gzhan gyis kyang //
analyzed: yang bshad pa / ji ltar ha la ha la'i dug / rang ngam yang na gzhan gyis kyang //
translated: Moreover, it is said:🔽Just as the poison halahala

original: byin nas 'chi bar 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: byin nas 'chi bar 'gyur ba ni //
translated: is fatal whether it is taken by oneself or given by others,🔽so too is the poison of anger.

original: bye brag dag ni med par 'gyur //
analyzed: bye brag dag ni med par 'gyur //
translated: There is no difference.

original: zhes ba'o ; / chad pas 'jigs pas ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes ba'o ; / chad pas 'jigs pas ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa ste /
translated: One harms others out of fear of punishment.

original: srog 'gag par byed cing gsod par byed pa dang / brdeg par mi bya ba chad pa la sogs pas 'tshe bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog 'gag par byed cing gsod par byed pa dang / brdeg par mi bya ba chad pa la sogs pas 'tshe bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not kill or cause others to kill, nor should one harm or cause others to harm with punishment, etc.

original: 'byung po rnams la gsad par mi bya zhing gtse bar mi bya zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams la gsad par mi bya zhing gtse bar mi bya zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say: “One should not kill or harm the bhūtas.”

original: bdag la dga' ba rnams 'tshe ba las bzlog pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag la dga' ba rnams 'tshe ba las bzlog pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to turn away those who delight in harming others.

original: bdag la dga' ba rnams gzhan la gang gis kyang mi 'tshe ba de la bsod nams dpag tu med pa 'byung bar mkhas pa rnams kyis bshad cing /
analyzed: bdag la dga' ba rnams gzhan la gang gis kyang mi 'tshe ba de la bsod nams dpag tu med pa 'byung bar mkhas pa rnams kyis bshad cing /
translated: The wise explain that there is immeasurable merit in not harming others in any way.

original: 'tshe ba med pas mi 'tshe ba nyid ni don dam par bsod nams de nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pas mi 'tshe ba nyid ni don dam par bsod nams de nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that non-harming is the ultimate merit,

original: dge la lha rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi smos so //
analyzed: dge la lha rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi smos so //
translated: four verses beginning with “The gods praise virtue” are stated.

original: mnyan yod kyi gnas chen po zhig na nor chen po dang ldan pa'i khyim bdag cig shi ba'i dus byas pa las /
analyzed: mnyan yod kyi gnas chen po zhig na nor chen po dang ldan pa'i khyim bdag cig shi ba'i dus byas pa las /
translated: In a great place in Śrāvastī, a certain householder who possessed great wealth died.

original: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis nye bar phyin te /
analyzed: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis nye bar phyin te /
translated: King Prasenajit approached him.

original: skyes bu dam pa chen po rgyal po chen pos longs spyod rgya chen po thob pa ni /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa chen po rgyal po chen pos longs spyod rgya chen po thob pa ni /
translated: “O great holy being, the great king obtained vast enjoyments.

original: bdag @150a * //
analyzed: bdag @150a * //
translated: Self🔽

original: nyid kyis yang dag par bde bas dga' ba med do zhes rgya cher sngon gyi sbyor ba ta ga ra shi khi zhes bya ba'i rangs sangs rgyas la gus par byas te /
analyzed: nyid kyis yang dag par bde bas dga' ba med do zhes rgya cher sngon gyi sbyor ba ta ga ra shi khi zhes bya ba'i rangs sangs rgyas la gus par byas te /
translated: Having thus paid homage to the Buddha,

original: bsod snyoms cig sbyin pa byas nas /
analyzed: bsod snyoms cig sbyin pa byas nas /
translated: he gave him a single alms-offering,

original: dmyal ba du 'bod chen po'i skye ba'i chos bshad de zhes rgya cher ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba du 'bod chen po'i skye ba'i chos bshad de zhes rgya cher ro //
translated: and the Buddha explained to him the Dharma of rebirth in the great Saṃjīva hell.

original: ji tsam na rgyal po gsal rgyal mchi ma phyung ste /
analyzed: ji tsam na rgyal po gsal rgyal mchi ma phyung ste /
translated: At that time, King Prasenajit shed tears,

original: gos kyi mtha' mas phyi zhing bcom ldan 'das la nor dang 'bru dang sa le sbram la sogs pas ni bgyi ba ci yang ma mchis so zhes zhus so //
analyzed: gos kyi mtha' mas phyi zhing bcom ldan 'das la nor dang 'bru dang sa le sbram la sogs pas ni bgyi ba ci yang ma mchis so zhes zhus so //
translated: wiping his eyes with the edge of his garment, and said to the Blessed One, I have nothing at all of wealth, grain, or gold to offer.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gnyi gar yang bsod nams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi gar yang bsod nams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Both of you have merit... and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni kun dga' bos ci btsun pa drang srong smra ba dag tu lha la sogs pa cung zad 'jig rten gnyi gar yang phan par byed pa yin no zhes zhus pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni kun dga' bos ci btsun pa drang srong smra ba dag tu lha la sogs pa cung zad 'jig rten gnyi gar yang phan par byed pa yin no zhes zhus pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: This is stated from the perspective of Ananda’s question, “Venerable! Are gods and so on in the world of Brahma and so on of any benefit to the two worlds?”

original: dge ba ni lus la sogs pa'i legs par spyad pa spyod pa'i skyes bus rigs pas 'ongs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni de'i nges pa'i tshig gi //
analyzed: dge ba ni lus la sogs pa'i legs par spyad pa spyod pa'i skyes bus rigs pas 'ongs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni de'i nges pa'i tshig gi //
translated: Virtue is the excellent conduct of body and so on.

original: lha rnams stod par byed pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i lha rnams dge ba nyid la bsngags pa brjod pa yin te /🔽ba ri dza ta ka'i mdo las dge slong dag tshes brgyad dang / zla ba phyed ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lha rnams stod par byed pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i lha rnams dge ba nyid la bsngags pa brjod pa yin te / ba ri dza ta ka'i mdo las dge slong dag tshes brgyad dang / zla ba phyed ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dir brjod par bya'o //
translated: The praise of gods is the praise of the virtue of gods who enjoy desire and form.🔽This should be explained in the sutra of Vasistha, which states:

original: gang zhig legs spyad spyod byed pa'i //
analyzed: gang zhig legs spyad spyod byed pa'i //
translated: Monks, on the eighth and fifteenth days of the month,

original: zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ;
translated: and so on.

original: gang zhig ni gang zag go //
analyzed: gang zhig ni gang zag go //
translated: Here, “whoever” refers to a person.

original: legs spyod ces bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshul lhag par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: legs spyod ces bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshul lhag par spyod pa ste /
translated: “Good conduct” is the superior practice of the way of merit.

original: dge ba byed pa de la gzhan yang bsngags pa smra ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba byed pa de la gzhan yang bsngags pa smra ba yin no //
translated: He is one who praises others for their virtuous actions.

original: de ltar na mi rnams kyi phar 'dzin pa dang / mar 'dzin pa dang / ji srid du lha'i lus mngon par bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de ltar na mi rnams kyi phar 'dzin pa dang / mar 'dzin pa dang / ji srid du lha'i lus mngon par bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: Thus, he is one who holds the human race in esteem, who holds the divine race in esteem, and so on, up to “who holds the divine race in esteem in order to generate a divine body.”

original: yang na dge ba ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams kyis legs par spyad pa ni thun mong du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dge ba ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams kyis legs par spyad pa ni thun mong du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, “virtue” is the good conduct of householders and monastics, which is common to both.

original: 'dir bsod snyoms kyi 'bras bu legs par spyod pa byed pa nyi tshe tsam du ma zad de /
analyzed: 'dir bsod snyoms kyi 'bras bu legs par spyod pa byed pa nyi tshe tsam du ma zad de /
translated: Here, the result of the act of giving alms is not just good conduct.

original: yang 'di na'ang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la'o //
analyzed: yang 'di na'ang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos nyid la'o //
translated: “Here, too” means in this very life.

original: smad par mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni dga' zhing rangs pa rgya che ba skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: smad par mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni dga' zhing rangs pa rgya che ba skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “He is not despised” means that he generates a great deal of joy and delight.

original: skye bo thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dang / skye bo dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa'i phyir dang / 'khor bar mi 'khor ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dang / skye bo dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa'i phyir dang / 'khor bar mi 'khor ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Because it delights all people, because it is praised by holy people, and because it possesses the special quality of not turning in cyclic existence, and so on.

original: yang na smad par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mi rnams su'o //
analyzed: yang na smad par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mi rnams su'o //
translated: Or, “not to be despised” means among humans.

original: mtho ris su yang dga' ba 'thob /
analyzed: mtho ris su yang dga' ba 'thob /
translated: “One obtains delight in the heavens”

original: ces @150b bya ba ni shi nas 'jig rten pha rol te /
analyzed: ces @150b bya ba ni shi nas 'jig rten pha rol te /
translated: means after death, in the next world.

original: bde 'gro dag tu yang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde 'gro dag tu yang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “One becomes happy” means in the happy realms.

original: yang gi sgra ni bsod nams byed pa rnams 'di dang / pha rol gnyi gar yang bde ba dang 'brel ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni bsod nams byed pa rnams 'di dang / pha rol gnyi gar yang bde ba dang 'brel ba nyid du ston to //
translated: The word “also” shows that those who make merit are connected with happiness in both this life and the next.

original: ji ltar bsod nams byed pa 'jig rten pha rol du dga' bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsod nams byed pa 'jig rten pha rol du dga' bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do those who make merit become happy in the next world?🔽The text says:

original: rgyang thag bcad par spyugs pa'i mi //
analyzed: rgyang thag bcad par spyugs pa'i mi //
translated: “A person who is exiled to a distant land”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: yun ring po'i dus su bskrad pa'i tshul 'di la yod pa ni rgyang thag chad par spyugs pa ste yul phyogs gzhan dag tu'o //
analyzed: yun ring po'i dus su bskrad pa'i tshul 'di la yod pa ni rgyang thag chad par spyugs pa ste yul phyogs gzhan dag tu'o //
translated: The manner of banishing for a long time is to banish to a distant place, to another country.

original: mi ni bu la sogs pa'i tshul gyi sems can no //
analyzed: mi ni bu la sogs pa'i tshul gyi sems can no //
translated: The person is a sentient being, in the manner of a son, etc.

original: ring nas zhes bya ba ni yul thag ring ba nas so //
analyzed: ring nas zhes bya ba ni yul thag ring ba nas so //
translated: From a distance means from a far country.

original: nye zho med 'ongs na zhes bya ba ni bde bar bsngogs pa dang bcas par de 'ongs bar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: nye zho med 'ongs na zhes bya ba ni bde bar bsngogs pa dang bcas par de 'ongs bar mthong ba'o //
translated: When he comes back safe and sound, he is seen to have returned safely and with his retinue.

original: gnyen ni pha dang ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen ni pha dang ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The relatives are the father, mother, etc.

original: bshes ni chung ma dang bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bshes ni chung ma dang bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The friends are the wife, son, etc.

original: mdza' bo ni grogs po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdza' bo ni grogs po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The loved ones are the friends, etc.

original: mngon par dga' zhes bya ba ni lhag par mgu ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' zhes bya ba ni lhag par mgu ba'o //
translated: They are delighted with him, they are especially pleased with him.

original: ji ltar mngon par dga' ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par dga' ba yin zhe na /
translated: How are they delighted?

original: aa la la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: aa la la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They say, Ah!

original: aa la la ni dga' ba'am yang na ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: aa la la ni dga' ba'am yang na ngo mtshar to //
translated: Ah! is a cry of delight or of wonder.

original: ae ma'o bya ba shin tu bzang zhing che ba grub par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ae ma'o bya ba shin tu bzang zhing che ba grub par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Ah! means Excellent! or Wonderful! or How good it is! or How great it is! or How well it is done!

original: dpe bstan nas des bsgrub par bya ba'i don smras pa /🔽de bzhin bsod nams byas pa'i mi //
analyzed: dpe bstan nas des bsgrub par bya ba'i don smras pa / de bzhin bsod nams byas pa'i mi //
translated: Having taught the example, he states the meaning to be established by it:

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the same way, a person who has created merit🔽.

original: gang zag gang gis bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag par bsags shing lhag par stsogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gang gis bsod nams kyi tshogs yang dag par bsags shing lhag par stsogs pa'o //
translated: The person who has accumulated and increased the collection of merit.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten 'di nas zhes bya ba 'di ltar ris mthun pa las so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten 'di nas zhes bya ba 'di ltar ris mthun pa las so //
translated: In the same way, from this world, from this class of beings.

original: pha rol phyin tshe zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gzhan 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol phyin tshe zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gzhan 'thob pa'o //
translated: At the time of death, at the time of attaining another world.

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: Who?

original: bsod nams bsags pa de dag ste /
analyzed: bsod nams bsags pa de dag ste /
translated: Those who have accumulated merit.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i legs par spyad pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i legs par spyad pa'o //
translated: The good conduct of generosity and so on.

original: mngon par dga' bar byed ces bya ba ni mngon par dga' ba la sbyor bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar byed ces bya ba ni mngon par dga' ba la sbyor bar byed pa ste /
translated: They make him happy, they cause him to engage in happiness.

original: de la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: they engage him for the sake of benefiting him.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / gnyen bzhin 'ongs nas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: smras pa / gnyen bzhin 'ongs nas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Having come like a friend.

original: gnyen sdug pa'i skye bo dag 'ongs pa bzhin du ste /
analyzed: gnyen sdug pa'i skye bo dag 'ongs pa bzhin du ste /
translated: Like a friend, a dear person, having come.

original: gnyen gzhan dag gis mthong na mngon par dga' bar byed pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyen gzhan dag gis mthong na mngon par dga' bar byed pa de bzhin no //
translated: Just so, when the other relatives see him, they are delighted.

original: 'dir dpe rgya cher sngar bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir dpe rgya cher sngar bshad mod kyi /
translated: Here, the example is given in detail above.

original: phyis 'ongs pa dang mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i gdul bya dag rjes su gzung ba'i phyir mdor bsdus te yang bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyis 'ongs pa dang mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i gdul bya dag rjes su gzung ba'i phyir mdor bsdus te yang bstan pa'o //
translated: But later, in order to guide those disciples who like a concise presentation, it is taught concisely.

original: yang na snga mas ni mngon par dga' ba'i dpe bstan to //🔽'dis ni phan 'dogs pa'i @151a * //
analyzed: yang na snga mas ni mngon par dga' ba'i dpe bstan to // 'dis ni phan 'dogs pa'i @151a * //
translated: Or, the former teaches the example of delight.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod do //🔽gang gi phyir de ltar bsod nams ni khyad par du mthu che ba yin te /
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod do // gang gi phyir de ltar bsod nams ni khyad par du mthu che ba yin te /
translated: This teaches the example of the activity of benefit.

original: de bas na 'di nyid la gzhug pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid la gzhug pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Because merit is especially powerful in this way, it is said in order to engage in this:

original: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, and so on.

original: des na de'i phyir bskyed pa dang bsags pa gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir bskyed pa dang bsags pa gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, for that reason, generate and accumulate.

original: ci zhig ce na /🔽bsod nams bsags pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na / bsod nams bsags pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What?🔽Accumulation of merit.

original: legs par spyad pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa'i tshogs so //
translated: The collection of good conduct.

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol te /
translated: “For the sake of the next world” means for the sake of the next life.

original: skye ba phyi ma'i ched du'o //🔽der 'byung ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi ste /
analyzed: skye ba phyi ma'i ched du'o // der 'byung ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi ste /
translated: It is for the sake of future lives.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: “For the sake of what arises in the next world” means for the sake of what is beneficial in the next world.

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol gyi ched du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol gyi ched du zhe na /
translated: Why is it for the sake of the next world?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar bsod nams 'jig rten pha rol gyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar bsod nams 'jig rten pha rol gyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said: “Because merit is for the next world.”

original: gang gi phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa'i legs par spyod pa dag rgyud la yongs su bsags pas 'jig rten pha rol du sems can srog chags rnams kyi gnas dang rten du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa'i legs par spyod pa dag rgyud la yongs su bsags pas 'jig rten pha rol du sems can srog chags rnams kyi gnas dang rten du 'gyur te /
translated: Because the good conduct of generosity, etc. is fully accumulated in the mind, it becomes the support and basis for sentient beings, for living beings, in the next world.

original: ji skad du bshad pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'khor ba nyam nga ba dag tu skye zhing 'khor ba na 'jig rten pa rnams kyi gnas kyi mchog ni bsod nams yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba nyam nga ba dag tu skye zhing 'khor ba na 'jig rten pa rnams kyi gnas kyi mchog ni bsod nams yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: “In the terrible cycle of birth and death, merit is the best support for worldly people who are born and die.”

original: bde ba 'dod pa rnams bsod nams bya ba la bag med pa dag la de bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba 'dod pa rnams bsod nams bya ba la bag med pa dag la de bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis gsungs so //
translated: For the sake of those who desire happiness but are heedless in the performance of merit, these two verses were spoken.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid bsod nams mchog tu byed pa la yang skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid bsod nams mchog tu byed pa la yang skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, even in the performance of the highest merit, all beings delight in the self.

original: de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid smras pa /
translated: This is what was said.

original: chos gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽de nas sun da ri ka zhes bya ba'i rgyal po'i bu bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin te /
analyzed: chos gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // de nas sun da ri ka zhes bya ba'i rgyal po'i bu bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin te /
translated: The verse beginning with who abide by the Dharma.

original: btsun pa skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis ci zhig byas na skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa dang / rigs kyi bu 'di la chos kyis 'tsho ba brtag par bya'i chos ma yin pas ni ma yin no zhes rgya cher 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis ci zhig byas na skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa dang / rigs kyi bu 'di la chos kyis 'tsho ba brtag par bya'i chos ma yin pas ni ma yin no zhes rgya cher 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the king's son named Sundarika went before the Blessed One and asked, Venerable One, what is it that holy beings do to delight all beings? The Blessed One replied, Son of noble family, in this regard, one should examine the livelihood based on the Dharma, not on what is not Dharma. Thus it was extensively spoken.

original: chos gnas zhas bya ba la /
analyzed: chos gnas zhas bya ba la /
translated: Who abide by the Dharma.

original: chos ni snying rje ste 'tshe ba med pa ni chos kyi mchog yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: chos ni snying rje ste 'tshe ba med pa ni chos kyi mchog yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: Dharma refers to compassion. Non-violence is the highest Dharma is the meaning of the verse.

original: 'tshe ba med pa yang g-yo la sogs pa gzhan gnod pa byed pa la snying rjes lta bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa yang g-yo la sogs pa gzhan gnod pa byed pa la snying rjes lta bar byed pa'o //
translated: Non-violence is the compassionate regard for others who are engaged in harming others through deceit and so forth.

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is stated:

original: bdag ni sems can la brtse ba //
analyzed: bdag ni sems can la brtse ba //
translated: I am compassionate to sentient beings,

original: rgyal po chos ni mdor bsdus yin //
analyzed: rgyal po chos ni mdor bsdus yin //
translated: and the king is the Dharma in brief.

original: zhes so // de la gnas pa ni chos gnas te /
analyzed: zhes so // de la gnas pa ni chos gnas te /
translated: Here, “abiding in the Dharma” means abiding in the Dharma.

original: de snying rje dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de snying rje dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is endowed with compassion.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Perfect morality” means

original: tshul khrims kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa @151b ste ;
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa @151b ste ;
translated: he is endowed with the good conduct of morality,

original: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: and it is complete in every way.

original: ji skad du tshul khrims 'chal ba'i de'i rgyu spong ba ni de'i gnyen po bsten pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du tshul khrims 'chal ba'i de'i rgyu spong ba ni de'i gnyen po bsten pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: As it is said, “The cause of immorality is the avoidance of its antidotes.”

original: de dang ldan pa ni 'di'i phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni 'di'i phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Endowed with that, it is his perfection.

original: tshul khrims ma tshang ba med pa dang ldan pa de ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'o ;
analyzed: tshul khrims ma tshang ba med pa dang ldan pa de ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'o ;
translated: Endowed with complete morality, he is one of perfect morality.

original: / ngo tsha shes shing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / ngo tsha shes shing zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Having a sense of shame” means

original: yon tan dang yon tan can dag la gus pa ni ngo tsha'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang yon tan can dag la gus pa ni ngo tsha'o //
translated: Respect for virtues and the virtuous is conscience.

original: yang na bdag nyid la mngon par brtags nas nyes pa rnams kyis 'dzem pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid la mngon par brtags nas nyes pa rnams kyis 'dzem pa ste /
translated: Or else, having examined oneself, one is ashamed of one’s faults.

original: de ni ngo tsha zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de ni ngo tsha zhes brjod de /
translated: That is called conscience.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
translated: One who has that is conscientious.

original: bden par smra zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa spangs pas dben par smra ba ste /
analyzed: bden par smra zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa spangs pas dben par smra ba ste /
translated: Speaking the truth means speaking in a way that is free from the harm of self and others.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'i skabs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'i skabs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: These four are the occasions for going to a good rebirth.

original: rang gi bya ba byed pa la //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba byed pa la //
translated: One should always do what is beneficial for oneself.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi phan pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi phan pa byed pa'o //
translated: This means one should do what is beneficial for oneself.

original: dam pa ni dge ba ste gang gi phyir dge ba rnams ni sngar bstan pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas rtag tu bdag la phan pas legs par spyod pa ste ;
analyzed: dam pa ni dge ba ste gang gi phyir dge ba rnams ni sngar bstan pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas rtag tu bdag la phan pas legs par spyod pa ste ;
translated: The good are the virtuous, because the virtuous always do what is beneficial for oneself, since they possess the qualities taught above.

original: de la ni dgra bo dag kyang dga' zhing yid du 'ong bar byed na /
analyzed: de la ni dgra bo dag kyang dga' zhing yid du 'ong bar byed na /
translated: If even enemies are pleased and become favorable toward one who is good,

original: tha mal pa dang grogs bshes lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: tha mal pa dang grogs bshes lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to mention ordinary people and friends?

original: de nyid du bshad ma thag pa bstan pa de khyad par du 'phags pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid du bshad ma thag pa bstan pa de khyad par du 'phags pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the teaching just explained is especially exalted, he says:

original: dga' 'gyur zhing zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dga' 'gyur zhing zhes bya ste /
translated: They are delighted and...

original: gang gi phyir snying rje la sogs pa'i yon tan bzhi bsten pa de ni sdug cing phangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying rje la sogs pa'i yon tan bzhi bsten pa de ni sdug cing phangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he cultivates the four qualities of compassion, etc. , he becomes dear and pleasing.

original: gang dag la zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag la zhe na /
translated: To whom?

original: smras pa / gzhan rnams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan rnams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He says: to others.

original: lha dang mi rnams so //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams so //
translated: To gods and humans.

original: ji skad du gzhung gi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du gzhung gi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la lha bdun brgya rgya che ba'i tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang nas nye bar phyin to zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la lha bdun brgya rgya che ba'i tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang nas nye bar phyin to zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “There, seven hundred gods approached the vast Brahma palace.”

original: yang na gzhan rnams zhes bya ba ni gzhan sgra rnams kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na gzhan rnams zhes bya ba ni gzhan sgra rnams kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, “to others” means “to other sounds.”

original: rang gi don ni byed pa la //
analyzed: rang gi don ni byed pa la //
translated: He generates the benefit for himself

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / bdag la phan 'dogs pa skyed par byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / bdag la phan 'dogs pa skyed par byed pa yang yin te /
translated: He generates the delight of all and the benefit for himself.

original: 'jig rten ni las bdag gir byed ces pa'i tshig gis so //🔽mthong ba'i chos la bsngags pa dang // /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni las bdag gir byed ces pa'i tshig gis so // mthong ba'i chos la bsngags pa dang // /
translated: The world is the owner of its karma, as the verse says.🔽He is praised in the present life

original: zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la thams cad du stod par byed pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la thams cad du stod par byed pa'ang yin no //
translated: He is praised in the present life in every way.🔽And in the next world

original: pha rol du yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol du yang ngo //
analyzed: pha rol du yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol du yang ngo //
translated: In the next world as well.🔽He goes to a happy rebirth

original: bde 'gror 'gro 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dam par 'gro bar skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa de ni de lta bu'o //🔽chos la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa re res 'dir mthong ba dang / ma @152a * //
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dam par 'gro bar skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa de ni de lta bu'o // chos la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa re res 'dir mthong ba dang / ma @152a * //
translated: He takes up a happy rebirth.🔽He is established in the Dharma

original: mthong ba'i phan yon brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i phan yon brjod par bya ste /
translated: and so on. Each of these should be explained here as the benefit of seeing and not seeing.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: In order,

original: gzhan dag ni yon tan bzhi'i phan yon bzhi ni 'dir brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni yon tan bzhi'i phan yon bzhi ni 'dir brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the four benefits of the four qualities should be explained here.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa'i khyad par 'dod pa rnams de'i thabs la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa'i khyad par 'dod pa rnams de'i thabs la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was said in order to introduce those who desire the distinctions of joy and so on to the means for that.

original: 'o na bdag nyid legs par spyod pa mchog tu byed par gyur kyang gzhan la yang nas yang du bya ba ma yin pa las zlog par byed pa la dga' bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bdag nyid legs par spyod pa mchog tu byed par gyur kyang gzhan la yang nas yang du bya ba ma yin pa las zlog par byed pa la dga' bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if one is himself a practitioner of the highest good, he will take pleasure in turning others away from what should not be done.

original: gtams na gnang ba'i tshig smra dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gtams na gnang ba'i tshig smra dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The verse says, “When he is asked, he speaks words of instruction.”

original: bcom ldan 'das bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling on Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: bco lnga ba'i gso sbyong de cung zad lus pa dang / sdig pa spang ba dang yon tan las brtsams pa'i chos kyi gtam ston to //
analyzed: bco lnga ba'i gso sbyong de cung zad lus pa dang / sdig pa spang ba dang yon tan las brtsams pa'i chos kyi gtam ston to //
translated: He was teaching the Dharma discourse on the topic of abandoning evil and good qualities, which was a little more than half of the Poṣadha for the fifteenth day.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang 'di lta ste brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang bag yod pa dang / bka' blo bde ba dang / rgya cher ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang 'di lta ste brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang bag yod pa dang / bka' blo bde ba dang / rgya cher ro //
translated: In the same way, he also taught the other topics, such as the practice of effort, heedfulness, and being easy to admonish, and the extensive.

original: gang dge slong 'di dag des yon tan dang ldan pa dang / de yid dga' ba dang mgu bar gyur to //
analyzed: gang dge slong 'di dag des yon tan dang ldan pa dang / de yid dga' ba dang mgu bar gyur to //
translated: Those monks who possessed those good qualities were delighted and pleased.

original: lha sbyin 'khor dang bcas pa sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bas stan las langs te /
analyzed: lha sbyin 'khor dang bcas pa sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bas stan las langs te /
translated: Devadatta and his retinue rose from their seats, unhappy and displeased.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: and left the presence of the Lord.

original: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then at that time the Lord uttered these two verses:

original: gtams na zhes bya ba ni rang nyid tshul khrims la sogs pa'i khyad par la gnas shing gzhan dag kyang de nyid la 'dzud pa ni gtams pa ste /🔽'di dag ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtams na zhes bya ba ni rang nyid tshul khrims la sogs pa'i khyad par la gnas shing gzhan dag kyang de nyid la 'dzud pa ni gtams pa ste / 'di dag ni bya ba'o //
translated: To encourage means to establish oneself in the special qualities of morality, etc., and to introduce others to just those.

original: 'di dag ni bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes rjes su mthun pa'i tshul du ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes rjes su mthun pa'i tshul du ston pa'o //
translated: These are to be done, these are not to be done means to teach in a manner that is in accordance with that.

original: gnang ba'i tshig smra dang zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i rim pa'i thabs ston cing yid la byed pa bskyed pa'i thabs ston pa ni gnang ba'i tshig smra ba'o //
analyzed: gnang ba'i tshig smra dang zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i rim pa'i thabs ston cing yid la byed pa bskyed pa'i thabs ston pa ni gnang ba'i tshig smra ba'o //
translated: To speak words of permission means to teach the method of the stage of generating concentration and to teach the method of generating mental attention.

original: mi rigs spyod las zhes bya ba ni tshogs par rung ba'i tshig ni bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs spyod las zhes bya ba ni tshogs par rung ba'i tshig ni bsngags pa'o //
translated: From conduct that is not proper means that words that are suitable for an assembly are praiseworthy.

original: de las bzlog pa tshogs par mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa tshogs par mi rung ba ste /
translated: The opposite of that is unsuitable for an assembly.

original: mi rigs pas byas pa'i las so //
analyzed: mi rigs pas byas pa'i las so //
translated: It is an action done improperly.

original: ji skad du gang ma brtags pa brten pa de ni bcol kyang nan tan du mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gang ma brtags pa brten pa de ni bcol kyang nan tan du mi bya'o //
translated: As it is said: “What is not examined should not be relied upon, even if it is well known.

original: de bas na de las bzlog par bya ste grags pa ma yin pa la sogs pa skyed par byed pas /
analyzed: de bas na de las bzlog par bya ste grags pa ma yin pa la sogs pa skyed par byed pas /
translated: Therefore, one should do the opposite, since it produces disrepute, etc.

original: 'di ni yang skye bar mi 'gyur bar nam yang mi 'bad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: 'di ni yang skye bar mi 'gyur bar nam yang mi 'bad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: One should never be negligent in order that this not arise again.”

original: de ltar gyur pa ni skyes bu dam pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ni skyes bu dam pa'o //
translated: One who is like this is a holy person.

original: @152b dam pa ma yin dga' mi 'gyur //
analyzed: @152b dam pa ma yin dga' mi 'gyur //
translated: The non-holy do not delight in it.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdig pa byed pa rnams zhe sdang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdig pa byed pa rnams zhe sdang bar 'gyur te /
translated: The non-holy, i.e., the evildoers, are displeased with it,

original: nye du dag 'chi ltas byung ba lta bu dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mig la gnod pa lta bu'o //🔽dam pa rnams ni dga' bar byed //
analyzed: nye du dag 'chi ltas byung ba lta bu dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mig la gnod pa lta bu'o // dam pa rnams ni dga' bar byed //
translated: like relatives at the appearance of an inauspicious sign, or like the eyes at the appearance of the sun’s rays.🔽The holy delight in it.

original: ces bya ba ni gang yang dam pa ni mkhas pa dag ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang yang dam pa ni mkhas pa dag ste /
translated: The holy are the wise ones.

original: bdag la phan par 'dod pa de rnams ni gtams na gnang ba'i tshig smra ba'i pha rol po la bla ma bzhin du khyad par du dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'dod pa de rnams ni gtams na gnang ba'i tshig smra ba'i pha rol po la bla ma bzhin du khyad par du dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who wish to benefit themselves, when instructed, will be especially pleased with the instructor, as if he were a guru.

original: ston ka'i zla ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: ston ka'i zla ba lta bu'am /
translated: They are like the autumn moon,

original: lus nad kyis gdung zhing 'dug pa la glo bur du grub pa'i sman pa nye bar 'ongs pa lta bu'o //🔽'di ltar gang gi phyir dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa yang dag par nye bar bstan pas dga' ba dang mi dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: lus nad kyis gdung zhing 'dug pa la glo bur du grub pa'i sman pa nye bar 'ongs pa lta bu'o // 'di ltar gang gi phyir dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa yang dag par nye bar bstan pas dga' ba dang mi dga' ba yin te /
translated: or like a person whose body is tormented by illness, who suddenly encounters a skilled physician.🔽Thus, because the good and the bad are properly revealed, there is pleasure and displeasure.🔽Therefore, in order to show the benefits and the faults,

original: de bas na de'i phan yon dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de'i phan yon dang nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says, Therefore, the good and the bad🔽are respectively called

original: de bas mchog dang mchog min la //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de bas mchog dang mchog min la // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the supreme and the not supreme.

original: gang gi phyir mchog ma yin pa ni phan pa bstan pa la rmongs pa'i phyir mi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mchog ma yin pa ni phan pa bstan pa la rmongs pa'i phyir mi dga' ba'o //
translated: Because the bad are displeased, since they are confused about the instruction in what is beneficial,

original: mchog ni khyad par shes pa des dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mchog ni khyad par shes pa des dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: and the good are pleased, since they know the distinction.

original: rgyu de'i phyir 'di las gnyi ga 'chi ba'i chos la ni bye brag med kyang pha rol tu ni khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir 'di las gnyi ga 'chi ba'i chos la ni bye brag med kyang pha rol tu ni khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: For this reason, although there is no difference in the Dharma of death for both, there is a difference in the afterlife.

original: shi 'phos bral bar gyur pa na //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shi 'phos bral bar gyur pa na // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Death is the separation of the mind and body.

original: shi 'phos pa ni shi ba'o //
analyzed: shi 'phos pa ni shi ba'o //
translated: Death is the separation of the mind and body.

original: de rtogs pa'i tshul gang la yod pa de nyid ni 'chi bar rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i tshul gang la yod pa de nyid ni 'chi bar rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which has the mode of realization of that is called “going to death.”

original: gnyi ga yang 'chi ba'i chos la yang bye brag med do zhes sgrub pa'i phyir dang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang 'chi ba'i chos la yang bye brag med do zhes sgrub pa'i phyir dang gi sgra'o //
translated: The word “and” is used to prove that there is no difference in the Dharma of death for both.

original: ji ltar 'di dag 'chi ba la bye brag med pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag 'chi ba la bye brag med pa de bzhin du //
translated: Just as there is no difference in death for both,

original: ji ltar skyed par gyur pa na yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar skyed par gyur pa na yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: is there no difference in birth for both?

original: ma yin te smras pa /
analyzed: ma yin te smras pa /
translated: No, it is said:

original: 'di ltar / dam pa ma yin dmyal bar 'gro//🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar / dam pa ma yin dmyal bar 'gro// zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The non-noble go to hell.

original: gang bla ma rnams kyi gdams ngag la rjes su mi 'jug pa de ni dmyal ba la sogs par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang bla ma rnams kyi gdams ngag la rjes su mi 'jug pa de ni dmyal ba la sogs par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not follow the instructions of the gurus are born in hell and so forth.

original: dam pa mtho ris 'gro bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dam pa mtho ris 'gro bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The holy one goes to the higher realms.

original: mtho ris ni lha'i gnas te /
analyzed: mtho ris ni lha'i gnas te /
translated: Here, the higher realms are the divine abodes.

original: der 'gro zhing rab tu gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: der 'gro zhing rab tu gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which goes there and abides is called the holy one.

original: dam pa ni bde 'gror 'gro zhing 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dam pa ni bde 'gror 'gro zhing 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the holy one goes to and comes forth in the happy realms.

original: sdug pa'i tshoms kyi rnam par 'grel pa ste lnga pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sdug pa'i tshoms kyi rnam par 'grel pa ste lnga pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the Chapter on the Beautiful is completed.

original: // /'gro ba sdug pa dang mi sdug pa yongs su spangs na ni /
analyzed: // /'gro ba sdug pa dang mi sdug pa yongs su spangs na ni /
translated: If one abandons the beautiful and the ugly,

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: one’s morality will be purified.

original: de'i rjes thogs la tshul khrims kyi tshoms bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs la tshul khrims kyi tshoms bstan pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach this, immediately following that, the Chapter on Morality is taught.

original: @153a * // sdug pa dang mi sdug ba dang lhan cig gnas pa rnams ni nam yang tshul khrims rnam par dag par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: @153a * // sdug pa dang mi sdug ba dang lhan cig gnas pa rnams ni nam yang tshul khrims rnam par dag par mi 'dod do //
translated: Those who live together with the beautiful and the ugly never desire pure morality.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i sems can dam pa yang gang zhig dang po dmigs shing gang la gnas pas dam pa rdzogs pa 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i sems can dam pa yang gang zhig dang po dmigs shing gang la gnas pas dam pa rdzogs pa 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the holy being who is just explained? What is the first object of observation? On what is one established so that one attains the perfection of the holy?

original: de'i phyir bsngags par 'gyur dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi rtsom pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsngags par 'gyur dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi rtsom pa smras te /
translated: Therefore, the author of the verse declares, “One should guard morality, etc.”

original: tshul khrims bsrung bar bya zhes bya ba ni bde ba gsum 'thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung bar bya zhes bya ba ni bde ba gsum 'thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “One should guard morality” means that in order to obtain the three kinds of happiness,

original: mkhas pas tshul khrims bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: mkhas pas tshul khrims bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: the wise person should guard morality.

original: bsngags par 'gyur ba bskyed par bya ba ni gzhan dag las chos thams cad kyis don du gnyer bas mkhas pas tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / longs spyod 'byung ba dang / lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten gyi lha rnams su skye bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsngags par 'gyur ba bskyed par bya ba ni gzhan dag las chos thams cad kyis don du gnyer bas mkhas pas tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / longs spyod 'byung ba dang / lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten gyi lha rnams su skye bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “One should generate praise” means that in order to obtain the praise of others, the wise person should guard morality, in order to obtain wealth, and in order to be reborn in the happy realms of the gods after separating from the body.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in one verse.

original: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni legs par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni legs par spyod pa ste /
translated: “Morality” is good conduct.

original: lus dang sems tshim par byed pas chu bsil ba dang / tsan dan la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: lus dang sems tshim par byed pas chu bsil ba dang / tsan dan la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It is like cool water and sandalwood, etc., because it satisfies the body and mind.

original: de yang 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, morality is twofold, as entrance and as avoidance.

original: de la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims ni rjes su bsgrub cing spyad par bya ba'i tshul ji skad du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims ni rjes su bsgrub cing spyad par bya ba'i tshul ji skad du bshad pa ste /
translated: Entrance morality is the practice of the morality that has been explained.

original: nang par langs nas so shing bcas te bla ma'i thad du song nas yongs su dri ba la sogs pa bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang par langs nas so shing bcas te bla ma'i thad du song nas yongs su dri ba la sogs pa bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having risen in the morning, having cleaned the teeth, having gone into the presence of the Guru, one should ask about the duties, and so on.

original: ldog pa'i tshul khrims ni gang bya ba ma yin pa las ldog par bya ba ji skad du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshul khrims ni gang bya ba ma yin pa las ldog par bya ba ji skad du bshad pa ste /
translated: Avoidance morality is the avoidance of what should not be done, as has been explained.

original: lham mkhan dang / rigs ngan dang / gdol ba dang / de lta bu las rab tu dbyung bar mi bya ba dang / rkun ma la sogs pa ma yin pa dang / gtses pa dang / ya mtshan can la sogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lham mkhan dang / rigs ngan dang / gdol ba dang / de lta bu las rab tu dbyung bar mi bya ba dang / rkun ma la sogs pa ma yin pa dang / gtses pa dang / ya mtshan can la sogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: One should not go forth from such as cobbler, menial, or outcast families, nor from families of thieves, and so on, nor from families of the oppressed, nor from families of the strange, and so on.

original: bsrung bar bya zhes bya ba ni yongs su bskyang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsrung bar bya zhes bya ba ni yongs su bskyang bar bya ba ste /
translated: One should protect means one should preserve.

original: bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i 'bras bu nyid phul du byung bas bdag nyid dang / mngon par 'brel cing bdag nyid gang gis 'di nyid cho ga bzhin du bsrung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i 'bras bu nyid phul du byung bas bdag nyid dang / mngon par 'brel cing bdag nyid gang gis 'di nyid cho ga bzhin du bsrung bar bya zhe na /
translated: The result of one's own action is the best, and one should protect oneself by means of that very thing with which one is connected.

original: mkhas pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mkhas pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The wise person, he says,

original: yongs su rtogs pa'i blo yod pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa'i blo yod pa ste /
translated: has a mind that is fully understood,

original: rig pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rig pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is, is endowed with knowledge.

original: yon tan thams cad nye bar bsdu zhing yongs su bskyang ba'i rtsa ba ni /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad nye bar bsdu zhing yongs su bskyang ba'i rtsa ba ni /
translated: The root of the collection and preservation of all good qualities🔽is knowledge, and the root of the engagement in all faults is ignorance.

original: ye shes yin la nyes pa thams cad la 'jug pa'i rtsa ba ni @153b mi shes pa yin pas rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams ni /
analyzed: ye shes yin la nyes pa thams cad la 'jug pa'i rtsa ba ni @153b mi shes pa yin pas rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams ni /
translated: Therefore, those who are endowed with knowledge🔽do not do anything that is useless.

original: dgos pa med pa ci yang mi byed de de bas na 'dir dgos pa ni bsngags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa ci yang mi byed de de bas na 'dir dgos pa ni bsngags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the purpose here is indicated by the words praise, etc.

original: de la bsngags par 'gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bstod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la bsngags par 'gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bstod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Among them, praise means praise.

original: nor thob pa ni dbyig dang gser la sogs pa dngos po mchog tu gyur pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: nor thob pa ni dbyig dang gser la sogs pa dngos po mchog tu gyur pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: The acquisition of wealth is the acquisition of the most excellent things, such as gold and silver.

original: sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag gi grangs su bya ba las 'dod pas 'thob par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir dang gi sgra smos so //
analyzed: sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag gi grangs su bya ba las 'dod pas 'thob par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir dang gi sgra smos so //
translated: The word “and” is mentioned in order to indicate that one acquires the desired state among the categories of sentient beings and non-sentient beings.

original: pha rol zhes bya ba lus dang bral nas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol zhes bya ba lus dang bral nas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The other world is so called because one goes there after separating from the body.

original: bde 'gro zhes bya ba ni lha'i 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: bde 'gro zhes bya ba ni lha'i 'gro ba'am /
translated: A good destination is a divine destination.

original: mtho ris su 'gro ba ni legs par spyod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bde 'gror skye ba'o //
analyzed: mtho ris su 'gro ba ni legs par spyod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bde 'gror skye ba'o //
translated: One is born in a good destination because going to a good destination is the result of good conduct.

original: bsngags pa dang nor thob par 'dod pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir /
analyzed: bsngags pa dang nor thob par 'dod pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir /
translated: One does not observe morality only for the sake of acquiring a good reputation and wealth.

original: tshul khrims bsrung ba ma yin gyi bde 'gror skye zhing bde ba rjes su myong bar yang 'gyur ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung ba ma yin gyi bde 'gror skye zhing bde ba rjes su myong bar yang 'gyur ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word “also” is mentioned in order to indicate that one is born in a good destination and experiences happiness.

original: dga' bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mgu bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dga' bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mgu bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: One becomes happy means one becomes satisfied.

original: bde ba gsum po ni bde ba rnam pa gsum gyi rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba gsum po ni bde ba rnam pa gsum gyi rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The three kinds of pleasure are the cause of the three kinds of pleasure.

original: bsngags par 'gyur ba dang / nor thob pa dag ni bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir bde ba zhes bya ba ste /🔽sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: bsngags par 'gyur ba dang / nor thob pa dag ni bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir bde ba zhes bya ba ste / sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
translated: Praise and the acquisition of wealth are called pleasure because they are the cause of pleasure.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is said: “The appearance of the Buddhas is a pleasure.🔽”

original: cig shos ni 'dir bde ba nyid de /
analyzed: cig shos ni 'dir bde ba nyid de /
translated: The other is pleasure in itself.

original: gang yang bde ba dang / gang yid bde ba de ni bde ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang bde ba dang / gang yid bde ba de ni bde ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Whatever is pleasure and whatever is satisfaction is pleasure.

original: don gnyer bas zhes bya ba ni kun du tshol te /
analyzed: don gnyer bas zhes bya ba ni kun du tshol te /
translated: “Seeking” means searching for.

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is it that is sought?

original: bde ba gsum mo //
analyzed: bde ba gsum mo //
translated: The three kinds of pleasure.

original: sngar smras pa'i tshigs su bcad pa don khyad par dang bcas pas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngar smras pa'i tshigs su bcad pa don khyad par dang bcas pas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to clarify the verse that was stated previously, together with its special meaning, it says: “the noble ones, etc.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni yid la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byor par 'gyur ba'i dngos por gnas shing mngon par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni yid la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byor par 'gyur ba'i dngos por gnas shing mngon par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: ” “Dwelling” means that one should desire to dwell in the state of the desired result.

original: 'di dag mthong ba yis zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i bsngags pa la sogs pa gsum po 'di dag mthong zhing /
analyzed: 'di dag mthong ba yis zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i bsngags pa la sogs pa gsum po 'di dag mthong zhing /
translated: Seeing these means seeing these three, praise, etc., as previously explained.

original: yang dag par rtag la nges par bsam pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par rtag la nges par bsam pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of correct reflection and ascertainment,

original: tshul khrims yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir 'bras bu ni 'di dag yin par khong du chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir 'bras bu ni 'di dag yin par khong du chud pa'i phyir /
translated: one should understand that these are the results of protecting morality.

original: tshul khrims yongs su bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should protect morality.

original: mngon par 'dod par bshad pa'i bde ba'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod par bshad pa'i bde ba'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: It is the cause of the happiness that is desired.

original: 'di nyid khong du chud pa ni mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid khong du chud pa ni mkhas pa ste /
translated: One who understands this is wise,

original: de nyid du gus pas yongs su skyong bar byed do //
analyzed: de nyid du gus pas yongs su skyong bar byed do //
translated: and he will be respected by the wise.

original: tshul khrims bsrung ba'i phyir mkhas pas zhes @154a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung ba'i phyir mkhas pas zhes @154a * //
translated: Because of protecting morality, the wise person

original: bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bya ba smras te /
translated: is said to be wise.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i gnas la rab tu sbyor zhing 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i gnas la rab tu sbyor zhing 'jug pa ste /
translated: He is applied to and engaged in the states of learning, reflection, and meditation.

original: rim pa 'dis nges par 'byed pa'i cha thos pas blo gros byad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis nges par 'byed pa'i cha thos pas blo gros byad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By this process, he will attain the wisdom of learning that is conducive to penetration.

original: tshul khrims yongs su bsrungs pa'i phan yon dam pa 'jig rten las 'das pa bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su bsrungs pa'i phan yon dam pa 'jig rten las 'das pa bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to teach the highest benefit of thoroughly protecting morality, which is supramundane, he says, “the noble ones.”

original: mchod par bya zhing sdig pa'i sgrib pa mi sogs pas 'phags pa'i gang zag ste /
analyzed: mchod par bya zhing sdig pa'i sgrib pa mi sogs pas 'phags pa'i gang zag ste /
translated: They are noble persons because they are worthy of offerings and do not accumulate the obscurations of immorality.

original: sdig pa mi spyod cing bya ba ma yin pa sdom pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi spyod cing bya ba ma yin pa sdom pa thob pa'o //
translated: They do not engage in immorality and obtain the restraint of not doing what is not to be done.

original: de yang tshul khrims 'di la gnas shing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la bsgom pas mthong ba'i lam thob ste /
analyzed: de yang tshul khrims 'di la gnas shing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la bsgom pas mthong ba'i lam thob ste /
translated: Moreover, they abide in this morality and, through cultivating serenity and insight, they obtain the path of seeing.

original: 'phags par gyur cing /
analyzed: 'phags par gyur cing /
translated: They become noble ones

original: 'bras bu de las dang nyon mongs pa'i ngan 'gro'i dogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de las dang nyon mongs pa'i ngan 'gro'i dogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: and are free from the fear of the bad destinies due to karma and afflictions.

original: mthong ba phun tshogs dang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa phun sum tshogs shing /
analyzed: mthong ba phun tshogs dang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa phun sum tshogs shing /
translated: “The perfection of vision” means the perfection of the noble truths.

original: yang dag par rjes su myong ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su myong ba ste /
translated: They experience them correctly.

original: 'dis ni bden pa mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bden pa mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means “they see the truths.”

original: 'dis bsgom pa'i lam 'thob par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis bsgom pa'i lam 'thob par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that they obtain the path of cultivation through this, he says,

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The term “mundane” is mentioned.

original: de de lta bu'i lam gyi tshegs la lam bsgom pa'i rjes su 'jug cing /
analyzed: de de lta bu'i lam gyi tshegs la lam bsgom pa'i rjes su 'jug cing /
translated: At the time of the path, one engages in the cultivation of the path in that way.

original: mthong ba'i chos 'di nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos 'di nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one abides in this very life.

original: zhi ba rten gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: zhi ba rten gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “Peace” is the attainment of freedom from attachment to the three realms.

original: mi slob pa'i lam la mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam la mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that one attains nirvana on the path of no-more-learning.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de thob pas mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa'i don te /
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de thob pas mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that one abides on the path of no-more-learning by attaining nirvana with and without remainder.

original: nye bar zhi zhing des zhi ba nyid de srid pa zad pa'i bde ba don du gnyer bar kyang /
analyzed: nye bar zhi zhing des zhi ba nyid de srid pa zad pa'i bde ba don du gnyer bar kyang /
translated: One should also strive for the bliss of the exhaustion of existence, which is complete peace and pacification.

original: tshul khrims 'di nyid bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'di nyid bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One should also protect this morality.

original: sngar bshad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only what has been explained above,

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba 'thob par 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba 'thob par 'dod pas /
translated: but also those who desire to attain mundane and supramundane bliss,

original: de'i las skyed par byed pa'i lam tshul khrims zhes bya ba la nges par sbyar ba'i phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i las skyed par byed pa'i lam tshul khrims zhes bya ba la nges par sbyar ba'i phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The path that generates that karma is called morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi sgra'i don nyid rnam par dbye ba'i phyir //🔽lus la yongs su gdung med par //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sgra'i don nyid rnam par dbye ba'i phyir // lus la yongs su gdung med par //
translated: In order to analyze the meaning of the term morality, he says:

original: tshul khrims kyis ni bde ba 'thob //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni bde ba 'thob //
translated: Morality brings happiness,

original: ces smos te /
analyzed: ces smos te /
translated: because it is not tormented in body.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu tshul khrims 'dod pa rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu tshul khrims 'dod pa rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said to the sons of good family who desire morality:

original: rigs kyi bu tshul khrims ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu tshul khrims ni bde ba'o //
translated: “Sons of good family, morality is happiness.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par 'dzin pa ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par 'dzin pa ni bde ba'o //
translated: Upholding morality is happiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: @154b rigs kyi bu tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams bde bar gnyid kyis log cing bde bar sad pa dang / nyal ba na 'di la lha rnams bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @154b rigs kyi bu tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams bde bar gnyid kyis log cing bde bar sad pa dang / nyal ba na 'di la lha rnams bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sons of good family, those who have morality go to sleep happily and wake up happily. While they are sleeping, the gods protect them.

original: 'di lta ste so ga'i dus su dgon pa'i nang du chud pa'i lam du zhugs pa rnams ni lus shin tu yongs su gdungs shing ngal ba rnams grib ma dang bcas shing chu mig bsil ba dang bcas pa'i shing drung du phyin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste so ga'i dus su dgon pa'i nang du chud pa'i lam du zhugs pa rnams ni lus shin tu yongs su gdungs shing ngal ba rnams grib ma dang bcas shing chu mig bsil ba dang bcas pa'i shing drung du phyin pa'am /
translated: For example, in the spring, those who have entered the path to the monastery, with their bodies extremely tormented and exhausted, go to the shade of a tree with a cool spring.

original: dbul phongs gter chen po rnyed pa'am /
analyzed: dbul phongs gter chen po rnyed pa'am /
translated: Or, the poor find a great treasure.

original: long bas mig gam /
analyzed: long bas mig gam /
translated: The blind find their sight.🔽The helpless find a great protector.

original: mgon med pa rnams la mgon chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: mgon med pa rnams la mgon chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: And so on up to:

original: bde ba zhes bya ba mngon par 'dod pa'i bde ba ma lus par 'thob par byed pa ni /🔽tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba mngon par 'dod pa'i bde ba ma lus par 'thob par byed pa ni / tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: The attainment of every happiness that is desired is the taking up of morality.
