original: legs par spyod pa'i bya ba sngon du 'gro bar khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa'i bya ba sngon du 'gro bar khas blangs pa'o //
translated: The taking up of morality is the promise to engage in good conduct.

original: bde ba de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that happiness?

original: gang gi phyir 'di na tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di na tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur pa ni /
translated: Because here, one who has become moral

original: lus la yongs su gdung med par //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lus la yongs su gdung med par //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: has no torment in the body.

original: tshul khrims kyis brgyan ba rnams la ni gdung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyes par spyod pa mi srid pas de rgyur gyur pa'i lus kyi gdung ba mi srid de /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis brgyan ba rnams la ni gdung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyes par spyod pa mi srid pas de rgyur gyur pa'i lus kyi gdung ba mi srid de /
translated: Those who are adorned with morality do not have the possibility of the bodily torment that is the cause of torment, since they do not have the possibility of misconduct, which is the cause of torment.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams la ni /🔽bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa lag pa gcod pa la sogs pa kun du ma bsdams pas /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams la ni / bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa lag pa gcod pa la sogs pa kun du ma bsdams pas /
translated: Those who are immoral

original: lus kyis kun nas gdung ba rjes su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyis kun nas gdung ba rjes su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: have the experience of the torment of the body, because they are not restrained from harming themselves and others, such as by cutting off their hands.

original: de bas na bsil bar gyur pas na tshul khrims so zhes nges pa'i tshig tu sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na bsil bar gyur pas na tshul khrims so zhes nges pa'i tshig tu sbyar ba ste /
translated: Therefore, morality is cool, and is thus applied as a definitive term.

original: tshim par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshim par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means “that which satisfies.”

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig chun 'phyang tsan dan mchog brlan dang // chu thigs bsil ba'i char dang bcas pa'i rlung //
analyzed: gang zhig chun 'phyang tsan dan mchog brlan dang // chu thigs bsil ba'i char dang bcas pa'i rlung //
translated: The hanging garlands, the best of sandalwoods, the cool drops of water, the wind with its rain,

original: zla zer sgra med dgon pa ku mu da //
analyzed: zla zer sgra med dgon pa ku mu da //
translated: the moonbeams, the silent forest, the night lotus—

original: gdung ba sel bar gyur pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gdung ba sel bar gyur pa ma yin te //
translated: these do not remove the torment.

original: srog 'jig tshe na kun du 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: srog 'jig tshe na kun du 'byung ba yi //
translated: But when life is destroyed,

original: dus mtha'i me ltar sreg cing 'jig pa dang // tshul khrims dran na'ang rjes su sel byed de /
analyzed: dus mtha'i me ltar sreg cing 'jig pa dang // tshul khrims dran na'ang rjes su sel byed de /
translated: and it drives away the recollection of morality.

original: gang phyir de ni tshim byed rnams kyi mchog / ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang phyir de ni tshim byed rnams kyi mchog / ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is the best of the things that satisfy.

original: mtshan mo bde bar nyal dang zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo shin tu bag phab ste /
analyzed: mtshan mo bde bar nyal dang zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo shin tu bag phab ste /
translated: Sleeping well at night means that at night one goes to sleep very relaxed.

original: gnyid kyis log pa ste g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa ste g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is free from distraction.

original: de bas na tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'i khams la yang dag par brten nas tshul khrims kyi sgra'i dgod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'i khams la yang dag par brten nas tshul khrims kyi sgra'i dgod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that one should establish oneself in the element of the undertaking of morality and then set forth the sound of morality.

original: sad pa na yang dga' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sad pa na yang dga' bar 'gyur //
translated: One is happy when one awakens.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyid dang bral bar gyur cing ma nyal ba'i gnas su nye bar 'tshe ba zad cing chos kyi lus @155a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyid dang bral bar gyur cing ma nyal ba'i gnas su nye bar 'tshe ba zad cing chos kyi lus @155a * //
translated: This means that when one is free from sleep and has arisen from bed, one's troubles are ended and one practices the Dharma with a body.

original: la spyod la bar chad med pa'i lam la slob pas yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur zhing mgu bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: la spyod la bar chad med pa'i lam la slob pas yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur zhing mgu bar gyur pa ste /
translated: One is happy and delighted by the path of no obstacles.

original: zang zing med par dga' ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhes ba'i don to //
analyzed: zang zing med par dga' ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhes ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one experiences joy without material things.

original: 'dis ni goms pa'i don gyis tshul khrims kyi sgra rnam par 'byed pa rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni goms pa'i don gyis tshul khrims kyi sgra rnam par 'byed pa rtogs par byed de /
translated: This explains the term morality through the meaning of cultivation.

original: gdung ba ma lus par sel bar byed pa'i tshul khrims la nges par sbyar ba'i phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gdung ba ma lus par sel bar byed pa'i tshul khrims la nges par sbyar ba'i phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated because it is definitely applied to morality that completely removes all burning.

original: sbyin pa la sogs lam gyi tshogs gzhan yongs su dag pa yang tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs lam gyi tshogs gzhan yongs su dag pa yang tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the complete perfection of morality is also the complete purification of the other collections of the path such as generosity,

original: sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Generosity, etc.,”

original: sbyin pa dang sbyin pa po dang / so sor len pa rnam par dag pa la sogs pa yod do zhes mdo las gsungs so zhes pa ni tshigs su bcad pa 'di yin no zhes sde pa gzhan dag smra ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang sbyin pa po dang / so sor len pa rnam par dag pa la sogs pa yod do zhes mdo las gsungs so zhes pa ni tshigs su bcad pa 'di yin no zhes sde pa gzhan dag smra ba'o //
translated: and so on. The other schools say that this verse is stated in the sūtras: “Generosity, the giver, and the recipient are said to exist.”

original: sbyin pa ni zas dang / skom dang / dbyig dang / rta dang / glang po che la sogs pa so sor ster ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni zas dang / skom dang / dbyig dang / rta dang / glang po che la sogs pa so sor ster ba'o //
translated: Generosity is the giving of food, drink, gold, horses, elephants, and so on.

original: sbyin par bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of generosity is it?

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dag ces bya ba ste /🔽gang zhig shin tu tshul khrims dang ldan zhing gzhan dag nye bar 'tshe ba med pa dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa rnams ster zhing sbyin par byed pa'i sbyin pa dag sbyin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dag ces bya ba ste / gang zhig shin tu tshul khrims dang ldan zhing gzhan dag nye bar 'tshe ba med pa dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa rnams ster zhing sbyin par byed pa'i sbyin pa dag sbyin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is generosity to those who are moral.🔽It is the generosity of those who are very moral and who give gifts and make offerings to others without harming them.

original: byin pa zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa nyid kyis na de las gzhan pa'i zag pa med pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur pas tshul khrims dang ldan pa nyid ni sbyin pa dag byed na /
analyzed: byin pa zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa nyid kyis na de las gzhan pa'i zag pa med pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur pas tshul khrims dang ldan pa nyid ni sbyin pa dag byed na /
translated: The generosity of those who are moral is the generosity of those who are endowed with perfect morality.

original: de ni nges par bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni nges par bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are moral and practice generosity will certainly attain happiness.

original: la la ni thams cad la yang 'di ltar khyad par med par gzung bas so zhes zer te /
analyzed: la la ni thams cad la yang 'di ltar khyad par med par gzung bas so zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: It is not different in this way for all of them.

original: ji ltar dung la brten nas rlung de nyid rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar dung la brten nas rlung de nyid rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as wind expands based on a conch,

original: tshul khrims la brten pa'i sbyin pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims la brten pa'i sbyin pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: so too is generosity based on morality.

original: de bas na sbyin pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba tshig mang po par rigs te /
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba tshig mang po par rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is correct to say “of the generosities” in the plural.

original: dman pa dang / bar ma dang / khyad par can gyi zhing la so sor sbyin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi dbang gis 'bras bu che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dman pa dang / bar ma dang / khyad par can gyi zhing la so sor sbyin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi dbang gis 'bras bu che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That generosity to individual inferior, middling, and superior fields becomes great fruit by the power of morality.

original: bsod nams kyis zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la sogs pa legs par spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyis zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims la sogs pa legs par spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: “Merit” refers to the perfection of good conduct such as morality and so on.

original: gang gis 'thob ce na /
analyzed: gang gis 'thob ce na /
translated: By what is it obtained?

original: mkhas pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mkhas pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says “by the wise.”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dag par 'brel pa la sogs pa nges par gyur cing gsung rab la sogs pa la rab tu byung la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dag par 'brel pa la sogs pa nges par gyur cing gsung rab la sogs pa la rab tu byung la /
translated: The wise are those who are certain about the correct connection between cause and effect and so on and who have gone forth in the scriptures and so on.

original: thos pa mang ba dang bcas @155b pas mkhas pa'i stobs kyis sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i tshogs rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: thos pa mang ba dang bcas @155b pas mkhas pa'i stobs kyis sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i tshogs rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
translated: and by the power of learning, one purifies the collections of generosity, morality, etc.

original: ji skad du /🔽shes rab kyis ni mun pa ma bsal gang //
analyzed: ji skad du / shes rab kyis ni mun pa ma bsal gang //
translated: As it is said:🔽How can there be purity of morality

original: de yi tshul khrims dag par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi tshul khrims dag par ga la 'gyur //
translated: for one who has not dispelled ignorance by wisdom?

original: phal cher tshul khrims bral ba de dag ni //

analyzed: 'di dang zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //

original: skyes zin pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i skye ba'o //

original: pha rol zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gzhan dag tu'o ;

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rtag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because permanence is the nature of nirvana.

original: bde ba'i zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Happiness is excellence.

original: 'thob par 'gyur ba ni yang dag par rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ba ni yang dag par rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par 'dod pa rnams la ni thabs bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: rgyun du lhag par mdzes pa'i rgyan ni tshul khrims yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: rgan pa'i bar la tshul khrims dge / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: lha zhig 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das la / rgan pa'i bar du dge ba gang //
translated: and asked:🔽What is virtuous in the beginning,

original: legs par gnas par gang zhig 'gyur //
analyzed: legs par gnas par gang zhig 'gyur //
translated: middle, and end?

original: mi rnams kyi ni rin chen gang //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni rin chen gang //

original: chom pos dbrog dka' gang zhig lags //
analyzed: chom pos dbrog dka' gang zhig lags //

analyzed: zhes zhus pa dang / de nas rgan pa'i bar la tshul khrims dge zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
translated: Morality is good from childhood on,🔽and also in old age.

original: tshul khrims ni byis pa nas brtsams te ji srid rgas bar gyur gyi bar du dge zhing bzang la rnam par mdzes pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni byis pa nas brtsams te ji srid rgas bar gyur gyi bar du dge zhing bzang la rnam par mdzes pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that morality is good, excellent, and beautiful from childhood on, and also in old age.

original: rgyan la la dag ni byis pa'i tshe mdzes kyi /
analyzed: rgyan la la dag ni byis pa'i tshe mdzes kyi /

original: rgas par gyur pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgas par gyur pa la ni ma yin no //

original: la la ni skyes pa la mdzes kyi bud med la ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: la la ni skyes pa la mdzes kyi bud med la ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Some are beautiful for men, but not for women.

analyzed: tshul khrims ni gnas skabs kun du yang thams cad la yang mdzes pa yin no //
translated: But morality is beautiful in all circumstances and for all people.

original: dad la rab tu gnas na legs //
analyzed: dad la rab tu gnas na legs //
translated: It is good to be well-established in faith.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems rab tu dang ba ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems rab tu dang ba ni dad pa ste /

analyzed: legs pa rnams ster ba zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word “good” means “bestows what is good.”

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dad pa ma bzhin dge ba skyed pa yin //
analyzed: dad pa ma bzhin dge ba skyed pa yin //

original: zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: rab tu gnas pa ni mi 'bral ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa'i rtsa ba las skyes pa zhes @156a * //

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ni legs pa ste dad pa la rab tu gnas pa ni de kho na nyid du rab tu mdzes pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni legs pa ste dad pa la rab tu gnas pa ni de kho na nyid du rab tu mdzes pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that “that is good” because one who is well-established in faith is well-adorned with reality.

original: mi yi rin chen shes rab ste //🔽zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: mi yi rin chen shes rab ste // zhes bya ba la //
translated: Wisdom is the jewel of humans.

original: shes rab ni de kho na nyid la nges pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni de kho na nyid la nges pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is certainty about reality.

original: de ni mi rnams kyi rin po che mchog ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rnams kyi rin po che mchog ste /

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste gser ram dbyig 'di ni cung zad tsam gyi rin po che'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste gser ram dbyig 'di ni cung zad tsam gyi rin po che'o //

original: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi rin po che ni rin po che'i mchog go zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir dang / rnyed par dka' ba dang / mngon par 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi rin po che ni rin po che'i mchog go zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir dang / rnyed par dka' ba dang / mngon par 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to obtain and is the cause of the perfection of what is desired.

original: rin po che'i cig shos ni rnyed par sla zhing thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che'i cig shos ni rnyed par sla zhing thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other jewel is easy to obtain and is common.

original: shes rab ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes rab ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: Wisdom is not a cause of suffering.

original: phal cher na gcig tu bde ba'i rgyu ni shes rab yin te ji skad du /
analyzed: phal cher na gcig tu bde ba'i rgyu ni shes rab yin te ji skad du /
translated: For the most part, wisdom is a cause of happiness alone. As it is said:

original: rmongs pa rgyud pa kun gyi rtsa //
analyzed: rmongs pa rgyud pa kun gyi rtsa //

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs dang 'brel //
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs dang 'brel //

original: de bas 'di ltar mi rnams kyis //
analyzed: de bas 'di ltar mi rnams kyis //
translated: Therefore, people should🔽cultivate wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should be endowed with thorough analysis.

original: bsod nams chom pos dbrog par dka' //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams chom pos dbrog par dka' // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Merit is difficult to steal away.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa legs par spyod pa ni bsod nams te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa legs par spyod pa ni bsod nams te /
translated: Merit is the good conduct of generosity and so on.

original: de rkun po rnams kyis dbrog par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: de rkun po rnams kyis dbrog par mi nus pa ste /
translated: It cannot be stolen away by thieves.

original: shin tu dka' bas kyang de dbrog par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu dka' bas kyang de dbrog par mi nus pa'o //
translated: It cannot be stolen away even by the most difficult of means.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: skyes ba'am ni bud med kyi //🔽bsod nams rgyal po rkun po dag / g-yo zhing brtson par gyur bas kyang //
analyzed: skyes ba'am ni bud med kyi // bsod nams rgyal po rkun po dag / g-yo zhing brtson par gyur bas kyang //
translated: The merit of a man or a woman🔽cannot be stolen away by kings or thieves,

original: dbrog par nus pa ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbrog par nus pa ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: even if they try with all their might.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bsdus pa'i don ni tshul khrims kyi rgyu ni dad pa yin la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bsdus pa'i don ni tshul khrims kyi rgyu ni dad pa yin la /

original: legs par spyod pa'i rgyu ni shes rab ste //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa'i rgyu ni shes rab ste //
translated: Wisdom is the cause of good conduct.

original: tshul khrims dang legs par spyod pa dag gis ni bde 'gro'i phun sum tshogs pa 'byor par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang legs par spyod pa dag gis ni bde 'gro'i phun sum tshogs pa 'byor par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through morality and good conduct, one obtains the excellence of good destinies.

original: yang na gang la shes rab yod pa de ni dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gang la shes rab yod pa de ni dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, one who has wisdom becomes faithful.

original: gang zhig dad pa de ni tshul khrims la gnas te /
analyzed: gang zhig dad pa de ni tshul khrims la gnas te /
translated: One who is faithful abides in morality.

original: gang zhig gsum po 'di dag ni legs par spyod pa de ni bsod nams chen po yin no zhes de la nges par sbyor ba'i phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gsum po 'di dag ni legs par spyod pa de ni bsod nams chen po yin no zhes de la nges par sbyor ba'i phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One who has these three is one who conducts oneself well. He is one who is endowed with great merit. This is stated in order to connect these three with that.

analyzed: 'bru thams cad sa la brten pa dang 'dra bar yon tan thams cad ni tshul khrims la gnas pa'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that just as all grains are based on the earth, so all good qualities are based on morality,🔽he says:

original: dge slong tshul khrims la gnas shing //
analyzed: dge slong tshul khrims la gnas shing //
translated: The monk who abides in morality,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: having attained the basis,

original: btsun pa dge slong ji lta bu yongs su @156b nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong ji lta bu yongs su @156b nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Venerable, what kind of monk does not degenerate and

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang nye bar blta bar bgyi /

analyzed: 'di na dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa /

analyzed: tshul khrims la zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la'o //
translated: The two verses beginning with “with moral discipline” refer to the vow of individual liberation.

original: gnas shing zhes bya ba ni der rab tu gnas shing yongs su ma nyams pa'i tshul gyis te /
analyzed: gnas shing zhes bya ba ni der rab tu gnas shing yongs su ma nyams pa'i tshul gyis te /
translated: “Living” means dwelling in that, maintaining it without degeneration,

original: lhag ba'i bsam pas skyong ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ba'i bsam pas skyong ba'o //
translated: with an elevated intention.

analyzed: dge slong pad ma can dper byas pa'i tshig gis tshul khrims kyi sdom pa gsungs nas dbang po bsdams ba bstan pa'i phyir //

analyzed: dbang po rnams kyang bsdams pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: he said, “His sense faculties are also restrained.”

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo bsdams shing sbas pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo bsdams shing sbas pa ste /
translated: The doors of the eye, etc. are closed and guarded,

original: yul thams cad las bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: yul thams cad las bsrung ba'o //

original: de ma bsdams pas ni dge ba thams cad nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ma bsdams pas ni dge ba thams cad nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If they are not closed, all virtue will be lost.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mi rnams kyi ni dbang po lnga //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni dbang po lnga //

original: dbang po gcig cing bu gar gyur //🔽rgyal ba'i rkang las chu bzhin du //
analyzed: dbang po gcig cing bu gar gyur // rgyal ba'i rkang las chu bzhin du //
translated: are one faculty and one orifice.🔽From that, like water from a spring,

original: de nyid las ni shes rab 'dzag / ces bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las ni shes rab 'dzag / ces bshad pa'o //
translated: wisdom flows.

original: 'dir dang zhes bya ba thams cad ni bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang zhes bya ba thams cad ni bsdus pa'o //
translated: Here, the word “and” is inclusive.

original: kyang zhes bya ba 'di ni sred pa ste /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba 'di ni sred pa ste /
translated: The word “also” is craving,

original: bdag med pa bstan pa dang 'dra bar bde 'gro la sogs pa srid pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa bstan pa dang 'dra bar bde 'gro la sogs pa srid pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the existence of happy rebirths, etc., as if they were taught to be non-self.

original: yang na kyang dang / dang gnyi gang yang tshig gi phrad du bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na kyang dang / dang gnyi gang yang tshig gi phrad du bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Or, “also” and “and” are both included in the word “also.”

original: zas zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: zas zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs ba'o //
translated: “Food” is eating, drinking, etc.

original: tshod rig pa ni tshad shes pa ste /
analyzed: tshod rig pa ni tshad shes pa ste /
translated: “Moderation” is knowing the measure.

original: zas lhag par zos pas ni ma zhu ba la sogs pa'i nad du 'gyur la /
analyzed: zas lhag par zos pas ni ma zhu ba la sogs pa'i nad du 'gyur la /
translated: By eating more than that, one becomes subject to illness such as indigestion.

original: nyung du zos pas ni lus nyam chung zhing spro ba dang stobs med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyung du zos pas ni lus nyam chung zhing spro ba dang stobs med par 'gyur te /
translated: By eating less, one’s body becomes weak, and one is without enthusiasm and strength.

original: de bas na ji tsam na nye bar spyod par rigs pa'i tshod shes pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na ji tsam na nye bar spyod par rigs pa'i tshod shes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, one should know the measure of what is suitable to consume.

original: 'dis ni tshul khrims dang dbang po bsdoms pa nye bar bstan par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshul khrims dang dbang po bsdoms pa nye bar bstan par 'gyur ba'i rgyu gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the cause for the teaching of the combination of morality and the sense-faculties.

original: mi nyal ba la 'bad pa ste //
analyzed: mi nyal ba la 'bad pa ste //

original: zhes bya ba ni mi nyal bar byed pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi nyal bar byed pas na /
translated: means that one is not lying down,
