analyzed: mi nyal ba ste lam gyi tshogs la sogs pa bsgoms pa de la brtson zhing snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la mngon par sbyor ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and that one is exerting oneself in the cultivation of the requisites of the path, etc., and is applying oneself to meditative concentration, etc.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: tshul khrims tshul khrims la gnas shing //
analyzed: tshul khrims tshul khrims la gnas shing //
translated: “One who is established in morality,

original: chos gnyis po la gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chos gnyis po la gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: because of being established in the two dharmas,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa'o //
translated: and so on extensively.🔽🔽

original: de ltar gnas par zhes bya ba @157a * //
analyzed: de ltar gnas par zhes bya ba @157a * //
translated: Thus, abiding is as explained above, abiding by the method of abiding.

original: ni sngar bshad pa'i cho gas gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa de ni de ltar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ni sngar bshad pa'i cho gas gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa de ni de ltar gnas pa ste /
translated: That is thus abiding.

original: de ltar kun du spyod pa la 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun du spyod pa la 'bad pa'o //
translated: Thus, he strives in the practice.

original: brtson pa dang zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa dang zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
translated: Strive means to undertake effort.

original: dus ji srid cig tu zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu zhe na /
translated: For how long a time?

original: nyin mtshan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyin mtshan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says day and night.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo ni nyin mtshan no //
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo ni nyin mtshan no //
translated: Day and night is day and night.

original: de ltar 'dis ni rtag tu bya ba'i sbyor ba gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'dis ni rtag tu bya ba'i sbyor ba gsungs nas /
translated: Thus, having stated the application of constant practice,

original: gus par bya ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gus par bya ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the application of respect,

original: snyom las mi byed pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: snyom las mi byed pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says not lazy.

original: snyom las lhod ba gang yin pa de ni snyom las te /
analyzed: snyom las lhod ba gang yin pa de ni snyom las te /
translated: Laziness is slackness.

original: de rab tu dgag pa ni snyom las mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rab tu dgag pa ni snyom las mi byed pa'o //
translated: The negation of that is not lazy.🔽

original: de yang sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra bar le lo'i rnam par rmongs shing brtson 'grus zhum pa de lta bu'i sems can gang gis bcings pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra bar le lo'i rnam par rmongs shing brtson 'grus zhum pa de lta bu'i sems can gang gis bcings pa yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of beings are bound by that laziness, which is confused about the nature of the cloudless sky?

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are those who are subject to complete degeneration.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yang yon tan las yongs su nyams pa'i tshul gyis yongs su nyams pas snod ma yin bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yang yon tan las yongs su nyams pa'i tshul gyis yongs su nyams pas snod ma yin bar 'gyur na /
translated: If those who are subject to complete degeneration are not suitable vessels because they degenerate from their virtues,🔽how much more so are those who do not degenerate.

original: yongs su ma nyams pa lta smos kyang ci dgos mya ngan las 'das ba zhes bya ba ni thar pa nyid de /🔽'khor ba ma yin par ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma nyams pa lta smos kyang ci dgos mya ngan las 'das ba zhes bya ba ni thar pa nyid de / 'khor ba ma yin par ro //
translated: Nirvana is liberation, not cyclic existence.

original: de zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'jug pa'i sbyor ba la spyod pa'o //
translated: Those who are bound by laziness are not suitable vessels for the teaching of the universal vehicle.

original: nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khad nye ba'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khad nye ba'o //
translated: They are not suitable vessels because they are close to degeneration.

original: gdul bya rnams bya ba nyams su len pa la dmigs pa'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug par 'gyur zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'dod pa rnams la de thob ba'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs pa
analyzed: gdul bya rnams bya ba nyams su len pa la dmigs pa'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug par 'gyur zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'dod pa rnams la de thob ba'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs pa
translated: This was taught in order to cause those to be trained to enter into the realm of nirvana without remainder, which is focused on the practice of action, and in order to teach the stages of attaining that to those who desire the bliss of nirvana.🔽In order to teach that one should guard morality, etc. in pursuit of the exhaustion of all suffering,

original: yin no // sdug bsngal ma lus pa zad pa don du gnyer bas tshul khrims yongs su bsrung ba la sogs pa bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yin no // sdug bsngal ma lus pa zad pa don du gnyer bas tshul khrims yongs su bsrung ba la sogs pa bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he said,

original: mi ni tshul khrims la gnas nas //
analyzed: mi ni tshul khrims la gnas nas //
translated: A man, having lived morally,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: should reflect on the body as a body.

original: 'phags pa srung dpang gi bu skyes pa nas brtsams te nad sna tshogs kyis gdungs pa dang / des bcom ldan 'das la btsun pa dge slong ji lta bu sdug bsngal zad pa rjes su thob par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'i don du ji srid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa srung dpang gi bu skyes pa nas brtsams te nad sna tshogs kyis gdungs pa dang / des bcom ldan 'das la btsun pa dge slong ji lta bu sdug bsngal zad pa rjes su thob par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'i don du ji srid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: The noble son of the protector, beginning from birth, was afflicted by various diseases, and asked the Bhagavat, Venerable, what kind of monk will attain the exhaustion of suffering? In order to teach the meaning of that, he spoke two verses.

original: tshul khrims la gnas nas zhes bya ba ni khyim yongs su spangs nas thar pa'i mchog la dmigs pa'i bsam pas so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dag yongs su 'dzin cing rjes su 'jug par byed kyi //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas nas zhes bya ba ni khyim yongs su spangs nas thar pa'i mchog la dmigs pa'i bsam pas so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dag yongs su 'dzin cing rjes su 'jug par byed kyi //
translated: The phrase having taken up morality means that, having renounced the household life, one takes up and follows the vows of individual liberation, with the intention of aiming for the highest liberation.

original: 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pas ni ma yin @157b te ;
analyzed: 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pas ni ma yin @157b te ;
translated: One does not do so out of fear of not being able to make a living,

original: de'i 'bras bu ni 'khor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni 'khor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result of that is samsara.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab can te 'di nyid tshul khrims yongs su dag pa la gnas pa'i skal ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab can te 'di nyid tshul khrims yongs su dag pa la gnas pa'i skal ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the wise means those who have wisdom, because they are the ones who have the fortune to take up morality.

original: de'i rjes thogs la ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs la ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should they do after that?

original: sems dang shes rab bsgom pa la //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang shes rab bsgom pa la // zhes pa ste /
translated: Cultivating mind and wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes la bslab par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes la bslab par bya ba ste /
translated: One should train in concentration and wisdom.

original: thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung sgrub pa snying por byed pa'o zhes gsungs pas na sgrub pa yang lam bsgoms pa las rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa gsod do zhes mdo las gsungs pas sems ni 'dir ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung sgrub pa snying por byed pa'o zhes gsungs pas na sgrub pa yang lam bsgoms pa las rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa gsod do zhes mdo las gsungs pas sems ni 'dir ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes
translated: The speech of the Lord of Sages is the essence of practice.🔽Since it is said in the sutras that practice is the wisdom of the vajra-like samadhi that arises from cultivating the path and kills the afflictions, here mind refers to the samadhi that arises immediately after the samadhi and protects the samadhi.

original: thogs la ting nge 'dzin rjes su srung bar byed pa'o zhes rnam par dbye'o //
analyzed: thogs la ting nge 'dzin rjes su srung bar byed pa'o zhes rnam par dbye'o //
translated: This is the analysis.

original: ji lta bur gnyis po de bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gnyis po de bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one cultivate those two?

original: brtson zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: brtson zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, with effort.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams shing yon tan nye bar bsogs pa la ngal bar mi sems pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams shing yon tan nye bar bsogs pa la ngal bar mi sems pa'o //
translated: One should be diligent, not thinking of weariness in accumulating good qualities.

original: nges gnas zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i nyes pa las bdag nyid rtag tu yongs su skyong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: nges gnas zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i nyes pa las bdag nyid rtag tu yongs su skyong bar byed pa ste /
translated: Abiding in discipline means always protecting oneself from the faults of the Vinaya.

original: bag yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bag yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of conscientiousness.

original: rgyun du bya ba dang gus par bya ba'i sbyor bas zag pa rnams las sems bsrung bas na 'bras bu 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyun du bya ba dang gus par bya ba'i sbyor bas zag pa rnams las sems bsrung bas na 'bras bu 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: These results are stated because the mind is guarded against the contaminants by means of the application of constant practice and respect.

original: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ma lus par zad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ma lus par zad pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term monk refers to the complete exhaustion of the afflictions.

original: 'dis na lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis na lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in terms of the realm of nirvāṇa that is with remainder.

original: sdug bsngal zad pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: One attains the end of suffering.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings bsgrub pa ste /
translated: This is the accomplishment of the realm of nirvāṇa that is “without remainder.”

original: de'i tshe nyid na sdug bsngal ma lus pa mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nyid na sdug bsngal ma lus pa mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time the suffering is completely terminated.

original: gang gi phyir tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phan yon de nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phan yon de nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The benefits of morality, etc., are taught in order to demonstrate just that.

original: de phyir rtag tu tshul khrims dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de phyir rtag tu tshul khrims dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, always be moral.

original: rtag tu 'di ni tshul khrims bcos ma ma yin pa dang / dum bu ma yin pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par tshul khrims bsrungs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu 'di ni tshul khrims bcos ma ma yin pa dang / dum bu ma yin pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par tshul khrims bsrungs pa'o //
translated: He always observes morality that is not artificial, not partial, and uninterrupted.

original: ting 'dzin rjes su srung ba dang // zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su skyong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ting 'dzin rjes su srung ba dang // zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su skyong bar byed pa ste /
translated: He guards meditative concentration means he protects meditative attainment.

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brtson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brtson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is diligent in cultivating meditative concentration.

original: lhag mthong la ni bslab pa dang // zhes bya ba ni de'i don du bslab cing rab tu 'jug pas shes rab la bslab par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lhag mthong la ni bslab pa dang // zhes bya ba ni de'i don du bslab cing rab tu 'jug pas shes rab la bslab par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: He trains in insight means he should train in wisdom, since he trains in and engages in that for that purpose.

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: shes bzhin so sor dran bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽yang dag pa'i ye @158a * //
analyzed: shes bzhin so sor dran bar bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te / yang dag pa'i ye @158a * //
translated: He should be mindful and aware.🔽He should be mindful and aware of that.🔽Mindfulness is the entry to the realization of right knowledge.

original: shes mngon du gyur pa la 'jug pa ni dran pa yin pa'i phyir 'dis ni dbang po sdom pa bshad de /
analyzed: shes mngon du gyur pa la 'jug pa ni dran pa yin pa'i phyir 'dis ni dbang po sdom pa bshad de /
translated: This explains the restraint of the faculties.

original: shes bzhin dang dran pa'i rgyu las dbang po bsdams par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de bsdams pas ting nge 'dzin bsgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bzhin dang dran pa'i rgyu las dbang po bsdams par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de bsdams pas ting nge 'dzin bsgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is said that the faculty is restrained due to the cause of introspection and mindfulness, one meditates on concentration by restraining that.

original: gang de lta bu dang yang dag par ldan pa de cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang de lta bu dang yang dag par ldan pa de cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens to one who is endowed with such?

original: der ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning with “there” is stated.

original: yid 'bral zhes bya ba ni dge slong dri ma med pa zhes bya ba sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' can gyi nye du mang po rnams kyis de'i tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nye du rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la btsun pa 'gro ba gang lags
analyzed: yid 'bral zhes bya ba ni dge slong dri ma med pa zhes bya ba sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' can gyi nye du mang po rnams kyis de'i tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nye du rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la btsun pa 'gro ba gang lags
translated: “The mind is detached” means that when the stainless monk passed into complete nirvana, his many relatives asked the Bhagavan, “Venerable One, what is his destination?”

original: zhes zhus pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes zhus pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs te /
translated: and he spoke this verse.

original: yid 'bral zhes bya ba ni las bdag gir bya ba dang / gang zag la la bdag med pa la sogs pa rtogs pas nga rgyal med cing mthong ba'i lam la sbyor bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yid 'bral zhes bya ba ni las bdag gir bya ba dang / gang zag la la bdag med pa la sogs pa rtogs pas nga rgyal med cing mthong ba'i lam la sbyor bar gsungs pa'o //
translated: “The mind is detached” means that one is free of pride and is applied to the path of seeing by realizing the selflessness of persons and so on.

original: lhag ma med 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i 'tshe ba dang ldan pas 'dis ni bsgom pa'i lam bshad pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma med 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i 'tshe ba dang ldan pas 'dis ni bsgom pa'i lam bshad pa ste /
translated: The phrase “without remainder” refers to the afflictions of ignorance, pride, etc., and the harm of karma and birth. This verse describes the path of meditation.

original: mi slob pa'i lam yang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam yang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The path of no-more-learning is also mentioned.

original: gang gis lhag ma med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis lhag ma med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what means is there no remainder?

original: kun sbyor zad byas nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽gang gis kun du sbyor ba dgu zad par bya ba'am /
analyzed: kun sbyor zad byas nas zhes bya ba gsungs te / gang gis kun du sbyor ba dgu zad par bya ba'am /
translated: The verse states, “having destroyed the fetters.”🔽The means by which the nine fetters are destroyed,

original: gang gis bag chags zad pa de nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis bag chags zad pa de nyid do //
translated: or the means by which the latent propensities are destroyed, is the path of no-more-learning.

original: lus zhig ces bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i sde pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: lus zhig ces bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i sde pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase “the body is destroyed” means that the body is separated from the class of homogeneous character.

original: shes rab ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ste rmongs pa rnams la 'di yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ste rmongs pa rnams la 'di yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase “endowed with wisdom” means that one has attained nirvāṇa with remainder, which is not possessed by the confused.

original: bgrang du med pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams su bgrang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bgrang du med pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams su bgrang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase “incalculable” means that one is not to be counted among the transmigrators.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba lhag ma med pa'i tshul la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba lhag ma med pa'i tshul la zhugs pa ste /
translated: Because of that, the one who has entered the mode of nirvana without remainder is called a “nirvana-attainer.”

original: dge slong dag de'i rnam par shes pa ni shar phyogs su 'gro zhes nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag de'i rnam par shes pa ni shar phyogs su 'gro zhes nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Monks, I do not say that his consciousness goes to the eastern direction,” and so on.

original: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'dod pa rjes su brtags pa'i rim pa nye bar brtag pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'dod pa rjes su brtags pa'i rim pa nye bar brtag pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: This is stated for the purpose of examining the stages of the desire for the happiness of nirvana.

original: sa'i gzhi'i rgyas par grags pa'i rgyu ni tshul khrims yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshul khrims las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sa'i gzhi'i rgyas par grags pa'i rgyu ni tshul khrims yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshul khrims las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show that the cause of the fame of the ground of the earth is morality, he says, “From morality,” and so on.

original: bsgom pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of cultivation:

original: tshul khrims bsgom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dang / @158b shes rab bsgom pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsgom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dang / @158b shes rab bsgom pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
translated: the cultivation of morality, the cultivation of concentration, and the cultivation of wisdom.

original: khyim bdag la la zhig nyi ma la dad par byed pa dang / de nyi ma 'char zhing rnam par snang bar gyur pa mthong nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag la la zhig nyi ma la dad par byed pa dang / de nyi ma 'char zhing rnam par snang bar gyur pa mthong nas /
translated: Some householder, having faith in the sun, sees the sun rise and shine.

original: bcom ldan 'das la /🔽'jig rten 'di na nyi ma ltar //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la / 'jig rten 'di na nyi ma ltar //
translated: He asks the Blessed One:🔽Who in this world shines

original: lam mer 'bar ba su zhig mchis //
analyzed: lam mer 'bar ba su zhig mchis //
translated: like the sun?

original: zhes zhus pa dang ; 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zhus pa dang ; 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say that this is what was said.

original: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Morality means

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa'i //
translated: the vow of individual liberation, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni dge ba la sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni dge ba la sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind on virtue.

original: shes rab ni don gyi de kho na nyid nges par shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni don gyi de kho na nyid nges par shes pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is the definite knowledge of the reality of the meaning.

original: de dag ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin legs par bsgom ba'o ;
analyzed: de dag ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin legs par bsgom ba'o ;
translated: These are well cultivated just as they are taught.

original: / so so bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: / so so bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to teach them individually, he says and.

original: de bas na 'di gsum zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di gsum zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says these three.

original: 'phags pa'i sde tshan la ni 'di dag gi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir phung po gsum gyi lam yang dag par bsdus pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sde tshan la ni 'di dag gi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir phung po gsum gyi lam yang dag par bsdus pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the path of the three aggregates is included in the noble truths, since they have the nature of those.

original: rnal 'byor ba gang gis legs par bsgom pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba gang gis legs par bsgom pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to show the result of the yogi's proper meditation, it is said:

original: shin tu dri med mthar phyin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shin tu dri med mthar phyin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Extremely stainless, perfected.

original: dri ma med pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Stainless means free from the stains of attachment and so on.

original: shin tu mthar phyin pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu mthar phyin pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Extremely perfected means uprooting the afflictions up to the peak of existence.

original: gdung med ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pas des bskyed pa'i yid kyi gdung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdung med ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pas des bskyed pa'i yid kyi gdung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Free from torment means free from the torment of the mind produced by afflictions due to abandoning them.

original: yang srid zad gyur dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir yang srid par 'byung mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang srid zad gyur dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir yang srid par 'byung mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having exhausted rebirth means it is impossible for rebirth to occur again due to abandoning the cause of birth.

original: chags pa'i 'ching ba las grol zhing //
analyzed: chags pa'i 'ching ba las grol zhing //
translated: He is liberated from the bondage of attachment.

original: zhes bya ba ni sred pa spangs pas chags pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sred pa spangs pas chags pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: This is the freedom from attachment due to the abandonment of craving.

original: gang gi phyir srid ba'i rtsa ba ni sred pa yin pas de spangs pas na yang srid pa zad pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srid ba'i rtsa ba ni sred pa yin pas de spangs pas na yang srid pa zad pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since craving is the root of existence, by abandoning it, there is the termination of future rebirth.

original: kar mi zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kar mi zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi tshor ba spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: He is free from the pain of the body, because he has abandoned afflicted feeling.

original: tshor ba'i dbang gis 'dod pa rnams mngon par 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang gis 'dod pa rnams mngon par 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the power of feeling, the desires increase.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa thob pa'o ;
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa thob pa'o ;
translated: He is endowed with wisdom, because he has attained the knowledge of destruction and non-origination.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus spangs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lus spangs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He has abandoned the body,

original: srid pa gsum gyi sgrib pa las nges par grol ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi sgrib pa las nges par grol ba'o //
translated: because he is definitely liberated from the obscurations of the three realms.

original: de yang de bskyed ba'i gags su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de bskyed ba'i gags su gyur pa'o //
translated: And that is the obstruction to the production of that.

original: bdud kyi yul las 'das pa dag / ces bya ba ni bdud kyi yul las 'das nas 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi yul las 'das pa dag / ces bya ba ni bdud kyi yul las 'das nas 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: He has transcended the domain of Mara, because he has transcended the domain of Mara and is free from the Mara of the Lord of Death, etc.

original: ji skad du gang @159a * //🔽zhig rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi kun du bsgom zhing bsten ba ni bskal pa'am /
analyzed: ji skad du gang @159a * // zhig rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi kun du bsgom zhing bsten ba ni bskal pa'am /
translated: As it is said:

original: bskal pa las lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: “He who cultivates and relies upon the four bases of supernormal power can remain for an eon or more.”

original: dpe dman pa dag bstan pa ni //
analyzed: dpe dman pa dag bstan pa ni //
translated: The inferior examples are taught:

original: nyi ma bzhin du lam mer 'bar //
analyzed: nyi ma bzhin du lam mer 'bar //
translated: He shines like the sun.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is said.

original: sprin dang bral ba'i rnam mkha'i nyi ma dang 'dra bar srid pa gsum du khyad par du 'phags shing rnam bar mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: sprin dang bral ba'i rnam mkha'i nyi ma dang 'dra bar srid pa gsum du khyad par du 'phags shing rnam bar mdzes pa'o //
translated: Like the sun in a cloudless sky, he is exalted and beautiful in the three worlds.

original: gnas ma lus par grags par 'dod pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas ma lus par grags par 'dod pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is said in order to teach the means of becoming famous in all the worlds.

original: nyi ma la dad pa de nyid mngon par dad par gyur nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: nyi ma la dad pa de nyid mngon par dad par gyur nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The one who has faith in the sun, having become full of faith, thinks this:

original: gal te 'di ltar tshul khrims la sogs par bsgom pa ni 'bras bu che ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar tshul khrims la sogs par bsgom pa ni 'bras bu che ste /
translated: “If the cultivation of morality, etc. has such a great result,

original: de la 'dir gang gi ba gegs su gyur pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de la 'dir gang gi ba gegs su gyur pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: what is the obstacle to that here?”

original: thams cad rdzogs pa ni gang yin snyam pa dang / de'i bsam pa mkhyen nas tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang dag par zhugs shing bsgom pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thams cad rdzogs pa ni gang yin snyam pa dang / de'i bsam pa mkhyen nas tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang dag par zhugs shing bsgom pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Understanding his thought, the Lord said: “It is perfected by the practice of morality, etc., and by the cultivation of meditation.

original: log par zhugs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: log par zhugs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not perfected by the practice of the opposite of morality, etc.

original: ji ltar na log par zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na log par zhugs pa yin /
translated: What is the practice of the opposite of morality, etc.?

original: 'di na gang zhig ni bag med par gyur pa yin zhes gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽dge slong phyi dang nang nyid la //
analyzed: 'di na gang zhig ni bag med par gyur pa yin zhes gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong zhes bya ba gsungs so // dge slong phyi dang nang nyid la //
translated: When he asked: “What is the state of heedlessness?” the Lord said: “The monk who is heedless.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la sems 'phros pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la sems 'phros pa'o //
translated: “Inwardly and outwardly” means that the mind is distracted by objects such as form.

original: de nyid ni re re zhing bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni re re zhing bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Each of these is an obstacle.

original: bag med ces bya ba ni bag med pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bag med ces bya ba ni bag med pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: “Heedless” means to be in a state of heedlessness.

original: rlom par byed ces bya ba ni khengs pa ste /
analyzed: rlom par byed ces bya ba ni khengs pa ste /
translated: “He becomes conceited” means that he becomes arrogant.

original: bdag tu rlom sems pas yon tan rnams kyi rtsa ba nas 'byin par gnas te /
analyzed: bdag tu rlom sems pas yon tan rnams kyi rtsa ba nas 'byin par gnas te /
translated: Because of his conceit in self, he plucks out the very roots of the virtues.

original: dregs pas bcom pas yon tan ring mi gnas //
analyzed: dregs pas bcom pas yon tan ring mi gnas //
translated: Because of being destroyed by pride, good qualities do not remain long.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: yang na 'dam bu mthon po dang 'dra bar nang na stong zhing mnog chung ba'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: yang na 'dam bu mthon po dang 'dra bar nang na stong zhing mnog chung ba'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: Or, like a tall reed, it is hollow inside and insignificant. This is the etymology.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung bar gyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung bar gyur kyang ngo //
translated: Even though one has gone forth, one is called a monk.

original: phyi dang nang nyid la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la sems 'phros pa ste /
analyzed: phyi dang nang nyid la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la sems 'phros pa ste /
translated: As for internally and externally, the mind is distracted toward objects such as form.

original: de re res kyang go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gags su gyur te /
analyzed: de re res kyang go rims ji lta ba bzhin du gags su gyur te /
translated: Each of these, in order, becomes an obstacle,

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur zhing rab kyi mthar thug par bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur zhing rab kyi mthar thug par bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the perfection of morality, etc. will not be completed and will not be accomplished to the highest degree.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa yongs su sbyong zhing de'i bar chad dang bral ba la sbyar ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa yongs su sbyong zhing de'i bar chad dang bral ba la sbyar ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in order to apply oneself to purifying morality, etc. and to being free from obstacles to that.

original: tshul khrims gang gis @159b dag pa dang ma dag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims gang gis @159b dag pa dang ma dag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what morality does one become pure or impure?

original: sprin gyis khebs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sprin gyis khebs las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning “When covered by clouds” and so on was spoken in Kauśāmbī.

original: yul koo sh'amb'ir tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa gnas pa na de yang dang yang du ltung ba 'byung ba dang phyir gso bar mi byed do //
analyzed: yul koo sh'amb'ir tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa gnas pa na de yang dang yang du ltung ba 'byung ba dang phyir gso bar mi byed do //
translated: The venerable Saṅgharakṣita lived there, and he repeatedly committed downfalls but did not restore them.

original: de la dge slong rnams kyis brtsad cing dris pa na /
analyzed: de la dge slong rnams kyis brtsad cing dris pa na /
translated: When the monks investigated and questioned him,🔽he said, “I don’t see this as a downfall.”

original: ngas ltung ba'i rnam pa 'di ma mthong ngo zhes zer ba dang / skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / ji srid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: ngas ltung ba'i rnam pa 'di ma mthong ngo zhes zer ba dang / skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / ji srid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One, and he spoke two verses.

original: sprin gyis khebs las zhes bya ba ni sprin gyis khebs pa bzhin du gang du nyes pa rnams sbed pa de nyid ni 'dir tshul khrims nyams pa'i khyad par yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sprin gyis khebs las zhes bya ba ni sprin gyis khebs pa bzhin du gang du nyes pa rnams sbed pa de nyid ni 'dir tshul khrims nyams pa'i khyad par yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: “When covered by clouds” means that just as clouds cover the sky, in the same way, downfalls are concealed. This is known as a specific case of damaged ethical discipline.

original: gzhan dag mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because other [explanations] are impossible.

original: de yang dran pa brjed pa las tshul khrims 'chal pa la cung zad la khyad du gsod cing gal te rnyed pa dang bkur sti rnam par gcod pa'i 'jigs pas bkab pa na nye bar spyod pa de mngon par 'bab cing gzhan dag mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur
analyzed: de yang dran pa brjed pa las tshul khrims 'chal pa la cung zad la khyad du gsod cing gal te rnyed pa dang bkur sti rnam par gcod pa'i 'jigs pas bkab pa na nye bar spyod pa de mngon par 'bab cing gzhan dag mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur
translated: Moreover, when one is careless about a slight transgression of morality due to forgetting mindfulness, and when one is covered by the fear of losing gain and honor, then that enjoyment will be lost and other things will increase.

original: ro // ji ltar nam mkha' la sprin gyis khebs pa las char 'bab par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ro // ji ltar nam mkha' la sprin gyis khebs pa las char 'bab par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Just as rain falls from clouds covering the sky,

original: sprin dang bral zhing gnam thang ba las ni char mi 'bab po //
analyzed: sprin dang bral zhing gnam thang ba las ni char mi 'bab po //
translated: but rain does not fall from a cloudless, clear sky.

original: de bzhin du gang gi tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi tshe /
translated: In the same way,

original: 'ba' zhig gi drung du so sor 'chags shing smra ba de'i tshe rgyud la 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gi drung du so sor 'chags shing smra ba de'i tshe rgyud la 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: when one confesses and speaks in the presence of a single person, then the fetters do not bind the mindstream.🔽Therefore, remove the cover!

original: de bas khebs pa sol cig dang ; / zhes bya ba dang / gtan tshigs de bas na gzhan dag gis yongs su mi shes pa'i sgrib pa yang bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas khebs pa sol cig dang ; / zhes bya ba dang / gtan tshigs de bas na gzhan dag gis yongs su mi shes pa'i sgrib pa yang bshags par bya ste /
translated: And because of that reason, one should also confess the obscurations that are not known by others.

original: de ltar na de 'bab par mi 'gyur zhing rnam pa 'dis sdig pa sogs shing 'phel bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na de 'bab par mi 'gyur zhing rnam pa 'dis sdig pa sogs shing 'phel bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it does not rain on it, and by this aspect, sin and so on do not increase.

original: sprin gyis khebs las char 'bab cing //
analyzed: sprin gyis khebs las char 'bab cing //
translated: It rains from clouds that are covered.

original: zhes bya ba mi shes pa'i sgrib pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khebs shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba mi shes pa'i sgrib pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khebs shing /
translated: Others say that the four noble truths are covered by the obscuration of ignorance,

original: nyon mongs pa dang skyes ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i char 'bab par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang skyes ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i char 'bab par 'gyur gyi /
translated: and the rain of affliction and the affliction of birth falls.

original: sgrib pa dang bral ba rnams ni 'di ltar mi byed do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bral ba rnams ni 'di ltar mi byed do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: But those who are free from obscuration do not act in this way.

original: 'di'i don ni tshul khrims dang 'brel pa med pas na mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni tshul khrims dang 'brel pa med pas na mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: The meaning of this is that it is not proper to be without the connection of morality.

original: de ni shin tu yang tshul khrims dag par rigs te /
analyzed: de ni shin tu yang tshul khrims dag par rigs te /
translated: But it is very proper to have pure morality.

original: de ltar rtag tu mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, always seeing and so on.

original: yon tan nyes pa 'di dag 'dir rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan nyes pa 'di dag 'dir rtogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the qualities and faults are understood.

original: rtag tu bslab ces bya ba ni dus rtag tu tshul khrims la sogs pa la bslab par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtag tu bslab ces bya ba ni dus rtag tu tshul khrims la sogs pa la bslab par bya ba ste /
translated: Always train in morality and so on.

original: dge slong dag sdig pa gang yin pa dang sgrogs pa dang / @160a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag sdig pa gang yin pa dang sgrogs pa dang / @160a * //
translated: Monks, you should live in a way that conceals your virtues and reveals your sins.

original: dge ba rnams sbas pas gnas shing sdig pas ma bsgribs par gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba rnams sbas pas gnas shing sdig pas ma bsgribs par gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Do not be obscured by your sins.

original: dge slong ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa la rjes su 'jug pa ste /🔽de'i mtshan nyid ni tshul khrims sdom pa dang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa la rjes su 'jug pa ste / de'i mtshan nyid ni tshul khrims sdom pa dang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Monks are those who follow the teaching of the Lord.

original: 'dul ba'i sde snod las gsungs pa'i spyod pa rnams la yang dag par bsdams shing /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i sde snod las gsungs pa'i spyod pa rnams la yang dag par bsdams shing /
translated: Their characteristics are stated in the verse: “Monks are those who are restrained by the restraint of moral discipline,🔽who are restrained by the restraint of the faculties, and who are restrained by the restraint of the path.

original: tshul khrims dang dbang po sdom pa dag dang yang dag par ldan pas bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang dbang po sdom pa dag dang yang dag par ldan pas bsdams pa'o //
translated: ” They are restrained because they are endowed with the restraint of moral discipline and the restraint of the faculties.

original: de'i khyad par ji lta bu bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ji lta bu bsgrub ce na /
translated: What is the special quality that they achieve?

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: They are said to be “on the path that leads to nirvana.”

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i thabs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i thabs so //
translated: They are the means of going to nirvana.

original: myur ba kho nar zhes bya ba ni rings pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: myur ba kho nar zhes bya ba ni rings pa kho nar ro //
translated: “Swiftly” means quickly.

original: rnam bar dag ces bya ba ni bsgom pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam bar dag ces bya ba ni bsgom pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ste /
translated: “Pure” means perfected through meditation.

original: lam ni bsgom par bya zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni bsgom par bya zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sutra says, “The path is to be cultivated.”

original: lam bsgom pa'i thabs bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: lam bsgom pa'i thabs bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was said in order to teach the means of cultivating the path.🔽In order to show that morality is the spreading of the supreme fragrance,🔽five verses beginning with🔽“The fragrance of a flower does not travel against the wind”

original: tshul khrims ni dri mchog rgyas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni dri mchog rgyas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: were spoken.🔽Then the venerable Ananda, having gone off alone and secluded,🔽had this thought: “The fragrance of a flower travels with the wind, but not against it.🔽The fragrance of jasmine travels with the wind, but not against it.

original: me tog dri ni rdzi phyogs min mi 'gro //
analyzed: me tog dri ni rdzi phyogs min mi 'gro //
translated: The fragrance of tagara travels with the wind, but not against it.🔽But the noble disciple who has destroyed the taints,🔽whose taints are finished, who has lived the holy life,🔽whose asavas are destroyed, who has laid down the burden,🔽reached his goal, utterly destroyed the fetter of becoming,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga gsungs te /
translated: and is liberated by right knowledge—🔽his fragrance travels with and against the wind,🔽and his fragrance travels everywhere in the world.”🔽Then the venerable Ananda rose from his seat,🔽went to the Blessed One,🔽and having approached him, he said:🔽“Blessed One, I have gone off alone and secluded,

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gcig pu dben par song nas yang dag par gzhag pa ste /🔽'di lta bu'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa skyes pa dang / de bsal ba'i phyir dri'i rigs ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gcig pu dben par song nas yang dag par gzhag pa ste / 'di lta bu'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa skyes pa dang / de bsal ba'i phyir dri'i rigs ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: and I had this thought:🔽‘The fragrance of a flower does not travel against the wind.🔽The fragrance of jasmine does not travel against the wind.

original: me tog dri ni zhes bya ba ni me tog gi dri yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: me tog dri ni zhes bya ba ni me tog gi dri yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: The fragrance of tagara does not travel against the wind.🔽But the noble disciple who has destroyed the taints,🔽whose taints are finished, who has lived the holy life,🔽whose asavas are destroyed, who has laid down the burden,🔽reached his goal, utterly destroyed the fetter of becoming,🔽and is liberated by right knowledge—🔽his fragrance travels with and against the wind,🔽and his fragrance travels everywhere in the world.’🔽“Blessed One, I have gone off alone and secluded,🔽and I had this thought:🔽‘The fragrance of a flower does not travel against the wind.🔽The fragrance of jasmine does not travel against the wind.🔽The fragrance of tagara does not travel against the wind.

original: rdzi phyogs min mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni rlung mngon par mi phyogs par mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rdzi phyogs min mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni rlung mngon par mi phyogs par mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: But the noble disciple who has destroyed the taints,🔽whose taints are finished, who has lived the holy life,🔽whose asavas are destroyed, who has laid down the burden,🔽reached his goal, utterly destroyed the fetter of becoming,🔽and is liberated by right knowledge—🔽his fragrance travels with and against the wind,🔽and his

original: de lta na ni pa ri dza ta dang / ko bi da ra la sogs pa rnams ni rdzi phyogs ma yin par ni dpag tshad brgyar dris khyab la /
analyzed: de lta na ni pa ri dza ta dang / ko bi da ra la sogs pa rnams ni rdzi phyogs ma yin par ni dpag tshad brgyar dris khyab la /
translated: In that case, the sandalwood, the jasmine, etc. would not pervade a hundred yojanas in the direction of the wind,

original: rdzi phyogs su ni dpag tshad lnga brgyar khyab bo zhes bshad na /
analyzed: rdzi phyogs su ni dpag tshad lnga brgyar khyab bo zhes bshad na /
translated: but would pervade five hundred yojanas in the direction of the wind.

original: de ltar shing de dkar pa yin zhes na /
analyzed: de ltar shing de dkar pa yin zhes na /
translated: If it is said that the tree is white,🔽the meaning is that the tree is white in color.

original: dgongs pa ni mi rnams kyi me tog gi dri'i dbang du mdzad pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni mi rnams kyi me tog gi dri'i dbang du mdzad pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: The intention is that the fragrance of the flowers is in the wind, so there is no fault.

original: rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni aa ga ru la sogs pa'i dri ni rtsa ba'i dri zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni aa ga ru la sogs pa'i dri ni rtsa ba'i dri zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of root is that the fragrance of agarwood, etc. is called the fragrance of the root.

original: rgya spos zhes bya ba ni dri 'di ni rgya spos kyi yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgya spos zhes bya ba ni dri 'di ni rgya spos kyi yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of sandalwood is that this fragrance belongs to sandalwood.

original: tsan dan rnams kyang min zhes bya ba ni tsan dan gyi dri ste /
analyzed: tsan dan rnams kyang min zhes bya ba ni tsan dan gyi dri ste /
translated: The meaning of not even the sandalwoods is that the fragrance of sandalwood is not like that.

original: 'di dag gis ni dri tha mal pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni dri tha mal pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: These explain the ordinary fragrances.

original: dam pa'i dri zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang rlung dang yang grags pa'i rang bzhin gyi dri'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i dri zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang rlung dang yang grags pa'i rang bzhin gyi dri'o //
translated: The meaning of excellent fragrance is the fragrance of the nature of morality, wind, and fame.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rdzi phyogs @160b min mi 'gro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rdzi phyogs @160b min mi 'gro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The word “also” is for the sake of clarifying the meaning.

original: rlung mngon par mi phyogs par yang mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rlung mngon par mi phyogs par yang mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: He does not go against the wind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir phyogs rnams kun du zhes bya ba ste phyogs kyi cha ma lus par ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs rnams kun du zhes bya ba ste phyogs kyi cha ma lus par ro //
translated: Because he is famous in all directions, in all parts of the world.

original: mi mchog ni spyod pa dam pa'i dri dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mi mchog ni spyod pa dam pa'i dri dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The best of men is accompanied by the fragrance of holy conduct.

original: dri yis khyab ces bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin gyi grags pa'i dris khyab ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dri yis khyab ces bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin gyi grags pa'i dris khyab ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is pervaded by fragrance means that he is pervaded by the fragrance of the good name that comes from moral discipline.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dam pas phyogs gang na gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: dam pas phyogs gang na gnas gyur pa //
translated: Wherever the holy ones dwell,

original: ston zla dri med lta bur grags pa snang //
analyzed: ston zla dri med lta bur grags pa snang //
translated: their fame shines like the stainless autumn moon.

original: 'jig rten gsum po dag tu'ang snang gyur phyir //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po dag tu'ang snang gyur phyir //
translated: Because they shine in the three worlds,

original: de bas tshul khrims phyi nang bsrung bar bya //🔽ci phyir phyogs rnams kun du khyab pa yi //
analyzed: de bas tshul khrims phyi nang bsrung bar bya // ci phyir phyogs rnams kun du khyab pa yi //
translated: therefore you should protect your moral discipline inside and out.🔽Why is it that there is no fragrance other than the aggregate of moral discipline,

original: tshul khrims phung po las gzhan dri yod min //
analyzed: tshul khrims phung po las gzhan dri yod min //
translated: which pervades all directions?

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bla na med pa'i don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify this very unexcelled meaning,🔽it is said:🔽sandalwood, utpala,

original: rgya spos dang ni tsan dan dang / autapa la dang zhes bya ba dag yin te /🔽autpala la dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rgya spos dang ni tsan dan dang / autapa la dang zhes bya ba dag yin te / autpala la dang bcas pa'o //
translated: and jasmine flowers.🔽Utpalas are blue lotuses.

original: m'a mi ka ni me tog gi rigs so /
analyzed: m'a mi ka ni me tog gi rigs so /
translated: Mamikas are a type of flower.

original: 'di dag pas zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i dri'i rnam pa las zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /🔽de rnams ni gcig tu lung du ma bstan pas bla na yod pa dang bcas pa'o //🔽tshul khrims dri bsung phul du phyin //
analyzed: 'di dag pas zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i dri'i rnam pa las zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste / de rnams ni gcig tu lung du ma bstan pas bla na yod pa dang bcas pa'o // tshul khrims dri bsung phul du phyin //
translated: These are said to be surpassed by the fragrance of morality.🔽The fragrance of morality is supreme.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi dri de ni mchog tu gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi dri de ni mchog tu gtso bo yin te /
translated: The fragrance of morality is supreme, the best.

original: 'bras bu bde ba'i phyir dang / skyes bu dam pas bsngags pa'i phyir dang / gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu bde ba'i phyir dang / skyes bu dam pas bsngags pa'i phyir dang / gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its result is happiness, because it is praised by holy beings, and because it is unsurpassed.

original: de dag kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are they surpassed?🔽It is said:

original: chung du ma zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chung du ma zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: because they are small.

original: chung du ma tsam du yongs su gyur pa'i dri ni dman pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: chung du ma tsam du yongs su gyur pa'i dri ni dman pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The smell that is transformed into the size of a small sesame seed is inferior.

original: gang gi phyir 'di nyid na sna tsam gyis nye bar longs spyod pa yin pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di nyid na sna tsam gyis nye bar longs spyod pa yin pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is enjoyed by the nose alone.

original: chung du ma tsam du brjod pa'i dri 'di gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: chung du ma tsam du brjod pa'i dri 'di gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is this smell that is said to be the size of a small sesame seed?

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be this.

original: rgya spos dang tsan dan la sogs pa gang yin pa'i dri de ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgya spos dang tsan dan la sogs pa gang yin pa'i dri de ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the smell of incense, sandalwood, and so on.

original: tshul khrims ldan pa'i dri bsung gang //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan pa'i dri bsung gang //
translated: The fragrance of those with discipline

original: zhes bya ba ni gang yang dam pa rnams kyi grags pa'i dri de'i rlung gis khyab par gyur pa ni mtho ris khyab ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang yang dam pa rnams kyi grags pa'i dri de'i rlung gis khyab par gyur pa ni mtho ris khyab ces bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning is that the wind pervades the fragrance of the holy ones.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i gnas su yang khyab na 'di ni mi rnams na lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i gnas su yang khyab na 'di ni mi rnams na lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If it pervades the pure abodes, what need is there to mention humans?

original: tshul khrims kyi phan yon gzhan bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phan yon gzhan bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To explain the benefits of discipline further,

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag par bya //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag par bya //
translated: One should purify one's discipline.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽tshul khrims rnam par dag pa 'di ni rnyog pa rnams kyi bu ga med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par @161a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa 'di ni rnyog pa rnams kyi bu ga med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par @161a * //
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This pure morality is endowed with the special qualities of being free from the holes of the defilements, etc.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i gtso bo'i yan lag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i gtso bo'i yan lag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the principal limbs of pure morality, etc.,🔽he said:

original: bag yod par ni gnas bya zhing //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bag yod par ni gnas bya zhing // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One should abide in heedfulness.

original: bag med par spyod pa rnams ni 'dis lam gyi tshogs su gyur par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bag med par spyod pa rnams ni 'dis lam gyi tshogs su gyur par bshad pa'o //
translated: Heedlessness is explained as the collection of the path for those who practice heedlessly.

original: yang dag shes pas rnam grol na //
analyzed: yang dag shes pas rnam grol na //
translated: One is liberated by right knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log cing nges pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log cing nges pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Right knowledge is non-erroneous and certain.

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is undefiled knowledge.

original: des rnam par grol ba ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: des rnam par grol ba ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa las grol ba'o //
translated: Liberation by that is liberation from the defilements of the three realms.

original: de rnams ni 'di lta bu'i yon tan la brten pas /
analyzed: de rnams ni 'di lta bu'i yon tan la brten pas /
translated: Since they rely on such qualities,

original: bdud kyi lam ni rnyed mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi lam ni rnyed mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
translated: they do not find the path of Mara.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud kyi bgrod par de mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud kyi bgrod par de mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That is not the path of the demon of the sons of the gods.

original: sngar bshad pa 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach just this which was previously explained,🔽he says,

original: 'di ni bde bar 'gro lam ste //
analyzed: 'di ni bde bar 'gro lam ste //
translated: This is the path to happy rebirth,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshigs su bcad pas brjod pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par dag pa nyid de /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshigs su bcad pas brjod pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par dag pa nyid de /
translated: The meaning of the verses just explained is the purity of cause and effect.

original: tshul khrims dang bag yod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i lam 'di ni bde bar 'gro ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i thabs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang bag yod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i lam 'di ni bde bar 'gro ba ste mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i thabs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This path endowed with morality, heedfulness, and so on, is the path to happy rebirth, the means to attain nirvana.

original: 'di nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this so?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because,

original: rnam par dag byed lam 'di la //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par dag byed lam 'di la // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: this path purifies.

original: khams gsum gyi bag la nyal spang ba ni rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi bag la nyal spang ba ni rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The abandonment of the latent states of the three realms is purification.

original: de'i don gyi tshul khrims la sogs pa'i tshul ni lam ste /
analyzed: de'i don gyi tshul khrims la sogs pa'i tshul ni lam ste /
translated: The method of that is morality and so on, which is the path,

original: de thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes one to attain that.

original: ji ltar na 'di nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di nyid khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this to be understood?

original: gang gi phyir rab tu zhugs te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab tu zhugs te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because it is said, “having entered into. ”

original: tshul khrims rnam par sbyong ba dang / bag yod pa la gnas pa dang / lam sgom par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par sbyong ba dang / bag yod pa la gnas pa dang / lam sgom par byed pa'o ;
translated: One enters into the purification of morality, the state of heedfulness, and the cultivation of the path.

original: / bsgoms nas kyang zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: / bsgoms nas kyang zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: “Having cultivated” means having the nature of cultivation.

original: 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la brtson pa'o //
translated: Thus, one is diligent in the cultivation of serenity and insight.

original: de yang / shes rab med la bsgom pa med //
analyzed: de yang / shes rab med la bsgom pa med //
translated: And it is said in the scriptures, “There is no cultivation without wisdom.

original: shes rab dag ni bsgoms las 'byung //
analyzed: shes rab dag ni bsgoms las 'byung //
translated: Wisdom arises from cultivation.

original: zhes lung las gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes lung las gsungs pas so //
translated: So it is said in the scriptures.🔽🔽

original: bdud kyi 'ching ba ni bdud kyi zhags pa ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi 'ching ba ni bdud kyi zhags pa ste /
translated: The “bonds of Mara” are the snares of Mara.

original: de yongs su spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spangs pa ste /
translated: “Having abandoned” means having rejected.

original: 'chi ba'i chos can nye bar gdung ba'i bag la nyal ni bdud de /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i chos can nye bar gdung ba'i bag la nyal ni bdud de /
translated: Mara is the latent tendency to despair, which is the cause of death.

original: de nyid ni 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'ching ba'o //
translated: That itself is bondage.

original: de spang ba ni yongs su 'dor ba ste /🔽bdud kyi 'ching ba dor bar bya //
analyzed: de spang ba ni yongs su 'dor ba ste / bdud kyi 'ching ba dor bar bya //
translated: “Having abandoned” means having rejected.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Having abandoned the bonds of Mara” is to be supplied.

original: bdud kyi 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i thabs bstan pa'i @161b phyir 'di gsungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi 'ching ba las rnam par grol ba'i thabs bstan pa'i @161b phyir 'di gsungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: This is taught in order to show the method of liberation from the bonds of Māra.

original: tshul khrims kyi tshoms te drug pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /🔽// / tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi tshoms te drug pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so / // / tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The chapter on morality is completed.🔽In order to teach the essence of morality,

original: de'i rnam grangs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rnam grangs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: or in order to teach its synonyms,

original: legs par spyod pa'i tshoms bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: legs par spyod pa'i tshoms bstan par bya ste /
translated: the chapter on good conduct is taught.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod spang zhing //
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod spang zhing //
translated: One should abandon evil conduct by body,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: mnyan du yod pa na dge slong gsum zhig lhan cig gnas pa las gcig cig lus kyis nyes par spyod pa'i kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas par gnas la /
analyzed: mnyan du yod pa na dge slong gsum zhig lhan cig gnas pa las gcig cig lus kyis nyes par spyod pa'i kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas par gnas la /
translated: In Śrāvastī, three monks lived together. One of them lived with the great evil conduct of body.

original: gzhan dag kyang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dag la gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dag la gnas te /
translated: The other two lived with evil conduct of speech and mind.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs pa yin no //
translated: With regard to them, three verses were spoken.

original: gang gis shin tu nyes par gyur pa ni nyes par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis shin tu nyes par gyur pa ni nyes par spyod pa ste /
translated: That which is very faulty is faulty conduct.

original: dri mar byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni nyes par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dri mar byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni nyes par spyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the cause of making dirty.

original: de las gzhan pas ni lus nye bar bcom zhing nyes par spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pas ni lus nye bar bcom zhing nyes par spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not faulty conduct for one who is other than that, who does not harm the body.

original: de la nye bar gzung ba'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pas nyes par spyod pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: de la nye bar gzung ba'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pas nyes par spyod pa yin pa'am /
translated: Therein, faulty conduct is either the faulty conduct that is assumed by the path of action,

original: lus kyi bdag nyid can yin nam /
analyzed: lus kyi bdag nyid can yin nam /
translated: or it is the nature of the body.

original: lus rgyur gyur pa'i nyes par spyod pa ni lus kyis nyes par spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: lus rgyur gyur pa'i nyes par spyod pa ni lus kyis nyes par spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs te /
translated: Faulty conduct that is the cause of the body is the non-informative form of faulty conduct by the body.

original: de spang zhing de bzlog pa'i phyir 'bad pas rjes su mnos shig pa'o //
analyzed: de spang zhing de bzlog pa'i phyir 'bad pas rjes su mnos shig pa'o //
translated: One should accept it and strive to stop it and turn away from it.

original: ldog par byed pa'i tshul gyis legs par spyod pa'i tshul gyi rang bzhin smras nas /
analyzed: ldog par byed pa'i tshul gyis legs par spyod pa'i tshul gyi rang bzhin smras nas /
translated: Having explained the nature of good conduct by the method of stopping,

original: 'jug pa'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the nature of engaging,🔽he said,

original: lus kyis legs spyad spyad pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lus kyis legs spyad spyad pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “Because of good conduct by the body.”

original: lus kyi sdom pa dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and will be endowed with the restraint of the body.

original: sngar gyi tshigs su bcad pa phyed rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /🔽lus kyi nyes chen las bsrungs na //
analyzed: sngar gyi tshigs su bcad pa phyed rnam par dbye ba'i phyir / lus kyi nyes chen las bsrungs na //
translated: In order to analyze the first half of the previous verse,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Having guarded against the great evils of the body,” and so on.

original: de bzhin du ngag dang yid kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag dang yid kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the verses on speech and mind should be explained as appropriate.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod spang zhing //
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod spang zhing //
translated: “ Having abandoned evil conduct with the body,”

original: zhes bya ba ni dge slong lhan cig gnas pa gsum po de nyid kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos pas yang dag pa'i 'du shes skyes te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge slong lhan cig gnas pa gsum po de nyid kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos pas yang dag pa'i 'du shes skyes te /
translated: means that the three fellow monks, having heard this Dharma discourse, gave rise to right understanding.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: They said to the Blessed One,🔽“In the same way, Venerable One, having heard this Dharma discourse, it will be for our benefit for a long time.”

original: de bzhin du mdor bsdus nas btsun pa bdag cag gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos pas yun ring po'i don du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas ji srid tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdor bsdus nas btsun pa bdag cag gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos pas yun ring po'i don du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas ji srid tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs so //
translated: Up to the three verses were spoken.
Body

original: kyis nyes par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum po sbyor ba dang mjug dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: kyis nyes par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum po sbyor ba dang mjug dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Evil conduct is the three types of evil conduct such as killing, together with their preparation and consequences.

original: spang ba ni dor ba'o //
analyzed: spang ba ni dor ba'o //
translated: Abandoning is rejecting.

original: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi'o //
translated: Evil conduct by speech is the four types of evil conduct by speech such as false speech.

original: yid kyis nyes par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni brnab sems la sogs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: yid kyis nyes par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni brnab sems la sogs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Evil conduct by mind is the three types such as covetousness.

original: gang gzhan zhes bya ba ni gang yang las kyi lam gzhan dag gis bsdus pa'i nyes par spyod pa de dag kyang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gzhan zhes bya ba ni gang yang las kyi lam gzhan dag gis bsdus pa'i nyes par spyod pa de dag kyang spang bar bya'o //
translated: What other means whatever other evil conduct is included in the other paths of action.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir skyon ldan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyon ldan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because they are faulty.

original: nyon mongs pa dang 'brel cing nyon mongs pa slong ba nyid dang 'bras bu mi sdug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang 'brel cing nyon mongs pa slong ba nyid dang 'bras bu mi sdug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are related to the afflictions, they are the instigators of the afflictions, and they have unpleasant results.

original: de dag spangs nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dag spangs nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is done after abandoning them?

original: lus kyis dge ba rnams bya zhing //
analyzed: lus kyis dge ba rnams bya zhing //
translated: One should do good by body.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: lus kyis srog gcod pa spangs pa la sogs pa rang bzhin can gyi legs par spyod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyis srog gcod pa spangs pa la sogs pa rang bzhin can gyi legs par spyod par bya ba'o //
translated: One should practice good conduct, such as the natural morality of avoiding killing, etc.

original: ngag gis dge ba phal cher bya //
analyzed: ngag gis dge ba phal cher bya //
translated: One should do most of the good conduct of speech.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa ste /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gyur pa'o //

analyzed: lus kyis dge ba rnams bya zhing // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;

original: de'i don ni bshad zin to //

analyzed: rtag tu bde ba zhes bya ba ni 'di'i sred pa zad pa'i bde ba ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: gang rgyu rtag pa dang mngon par ldan pa de ni dag pa'i 'bras bu 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis te /

analyzed: rtag tu lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: ji tsam na btsun pa bdag ni 'tshe ba med pa'i mchod sbyin bgyid de /

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

analyzed: chos ni mi 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid can zhes bgyi ba lags so zhes gsol pa dang / de nas tshigs su bcad pa bzhi gsungs so //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyun du so sor thar pa dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa'i lus dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: thub pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams so //

analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa yin zhes bya ba ni mi 'tshe bas na 'tshe ba med pa ste /

analyzed: 'dis ni phyi rol gyi 'tshe ba dang / de'i rgyu dang bral ba'o //

original: de'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The result of that is

analyzed: de ni 'chi med gnas 'gro zhing //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: de 'chi ba med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i gnas so //

analyzed: 'gro zhing zhes bya ba ni thob pa ste mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'bras bu de'i phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gang du song na mya ngan med //

analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni gnas so //

analyzed: song ba zhes bya ba ni 'das par gyur pa ste /

analyzed: yang kun nas gdung ba'i mya ngan rjes su myong bar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'tshe ba thams cad shin tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: ngag dang yid la yang de bzhin brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag dang yid la yang de bzhin brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: brtan pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang de yin te de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: brtan pa rnams kyi lus bsdam zhing //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs @163a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs @163a * //

analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa ste /

analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i tshogs la gnas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang thub pa dang brtan pa de'i mtshan nyid dang / sdom pa bshad nas de ji lta bu yin zhe na /

analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: legs pa ste zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa ste /

analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
