original: // / tshul khrims kyi tshoms su lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod pa las ldog pa'i bsngags pa spyir bstan na de ci thams cad la kun du ldog par bya ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: // / tshul khrims kyi tshoms su lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod pa las ldog pa'i bsngags pa spyir bstan na de ci thams cad la kun du ldog par bya ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it necessary to turn away from all misdeeds?

original: ma yin te smras pa /
analyzed: ma yin te smras pa /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de lta mod kyi khyad par du ngag gis nyes par spyod pa yin pas 'di ltar de tsam gyis dge 'dun gyi 'khor lo'i dbyen byas pa las ltung ba thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi khyad par du ngag gis nyes par spyod pa yin pas 'di ltar de tsam gyis dge 'dun gyi 'khor lo'i dbyen byas pa las ltung ba thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: However, since verbal misdeeds are particularly serious, one incurs a downfall if one causes a schism in the saṅgha by merely saying the following words.

original: des na de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: des na de nyid smras pa /
translated: Therefore, the root text states:

original: gang dag byas bzhin ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag byas bzhin ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Those who say, ‘I did not do what I did’ and so on.”

original: mnyan yod na mu stegs can gzhan gyis bskul te /
analyzed: mnyan yod na mu stegs can gzhan gyis bskul te /
translated: In Śrāvastī, a non-Buddhist tīrthika challenged the Buddha.

original: tsan tsa zhes bya ba'i bram ze'i bu mo shin tu yid du 'ong ba blta na sdug pa zhig gzhong pa dku'i phyogs su bcings te /
analyzed: tsan tsa zhes bya ba'i bram ze'i bu mo shin tu yid du 'ong ba blta na sdug pa zhig gzhong pa dku'i phyogs su bcings te /
translated: He had a very attractive and beautiful young brahmin girl named Cañcā tied up in a basket.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor mang po'i nang du chos ston pa'i thad du 'ongs te smras pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor mang po'i nang du chos ston pa'i thad du 'ongs te smras pa /
translated: He brought her before the Blessed One, who was teaching the Dharma in the midst of a large retinue, and said:🔽“Blessed One, if you are omniscient,

original: skad shin tu chags @164a * //
analyzed: skad shin tu chags @164a * //
translated: The voice is very attached.🔽

original: pa dang yid du 'ong zhing snyan pas bdag sbrum par byas so zhes byas te /
analyzed: pa dang yid du 'ong zhing snyan pas bdag sbrum par byas so zhes byas te /
translated: The sound was so sweet and pleasant that she conceived a child.

original: da khyod kyis chos shod cig ces smras so //
analyzed: da khyod kyis chos shod cig ces smras so //
translated: Now you must teach the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: brdzun du smra ba dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur // zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: Those who lie go to hell.🔽The king asked, What happens to those who do not speak after making a vow?

original: des gsol ba yang gang zhig byas nas mi smra ba de cir 'gyur zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: des gsol ba yang gang zhig byas nas mi smra ba de cir 'gyur zhes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gang dag byas bzhin ma byas zer ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gang dag byas bzhin ma byas zer ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal to //
translated: Those who say, 'I did not do what I did,' and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu brgya byin gyis byi ba zhig tu sprul te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brgya byin gyis byi ba zhig tu sprul te /
translated: Then Indra manifested as a mouse.

original: des gzhong pa bcings pa'i skud pa bcad nas skye bo'i chogs chen po'i mngon sum du ltung bar byas so //
analyzed: des gzhong pa bcings pa'i skud pa bcad nas skye bo'i chogs chen po'i mngon sum du ltung bar byas so //
translated: He cut the rope that bound the bowl, causing it to fall in the presence of a great crowd of people.

original: de yang sags pa'i nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: de yang sags pa'i nang du zhugs te /
translated: It fell into a pile of chaff

original: mnar med pa'i dmyal ba'i me rab tu 'bar zhing drag pa'i nang du song ngo //
analyzed: mnar med pa'i dmyal ba'i me rab tu 'bar zhing drag pa'i nang du song ngo //
translated: and went into the blazing, fierce fire of the Avīci hell.

original: brdzun zhes bya ba ni ma yin bzhin du smra ba ste /
analyzed: brdzun zhes bya ba ni ma yin bzhin du smra ba ste /
translated: Lying is speaking falsely.

original: med pa'i skyon brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa'i skyon brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one is guilty of non-existence.

original: dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba las kyi zhing gi gnas ji lta ba bzhin du yang sos la sogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba las kyi zhing gi gnas ji lta ba bzhin du yang sos la sogs par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will go to hell. As with the field of karma, one will be reborn in the Reviving Hell, etc.🔽One who says, “I did not do what I did,”

original: gang dag byas bzhin ma byas zer ba dang // zhes bya ba ni gang yang sdig pa byas nas rnam par sbed par byed pa gzhan gyis dris na yang de tshogs kyi nang du shes shing dran par gyur kyang mi brjod de /
analyzed: gang dag byas bzhin ma byas zer ba dang // zhes bya ba ni gang yang sdig pa byas nas rnam par sbed par byed pa gzhan gyis dris na yang de tshogs kyi nang du shes shing dran par gyur kyang mi brjod de /
translated: is one who, having committed a sin, conceals it. When questioned by others, he does not speak, even though he knows and remembers the assembly.

original: bdag gis ni de ltar ma byas so zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ni de ltar ma byas so zhes smra ba'o //
translated: He says, “I did not do that.”

original: de yang dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: de yang dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dang gi sgra'o //
translated: He too will go to hell. The word “too” is understood.

original: ci'i phyir gnyi ga yang dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyi ga yang dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why will both go to hell?

original: smras pa / gnyi ga zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: smras pa / gnyi ga zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said:

original: gang dag bdag nyid bzhin la tshig ngan pa brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag bdag nyid bzhin la tshig ngan pa brjod pa ste /
translated: Both are said to be those who speak evil words to themselves.

original: gang yang mi rigs pa'i smra ba dang / de ltar bdag ni byed pa ma yin no zhes smra ba 'di gnyi ga ste /
analyzed: gang yang mi rigs pa'i smra ba dang / de ltar bdag ni byed pa ma yin no zhes smra ba 'di gnyi ga ste /
translated: And the one who says, I am not doing that, both of these are not right.

original: 'di ltar dman pa'i chos zhes bya ba de 'dir blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dman pa'i chos zhes bya ba de 'dir blta bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, the so-called inferior dharmas should be seen here.

original: song nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di nas shi 'phos nas 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: song nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di nas shi 'phos nas 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Having gone means having died and transmigrated from this world, one goes to another world.

original: 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni mnyam par dmyal ba la sogs par skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni mnyam par dmyal ba la sogs par skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Similar means equal, one will be born in the hells and so forth.

original: ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: smras pa / dman pa'i chos zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / dman pa'i chos zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is said to be the so-called inferior dharmas.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar smad par bya ba spyad cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar smad par bya ba spyad cing /
translated: Because one practices in this way, which is to be despised,

original: ngan pa'i las brdzun du smra ba byas pas so zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: ngan pa'i las brdzun du smra ba byas pas so zhes dgongs so //
translated: and because one has done the bad action of lying. This is the intention.

original: mi de zhes bya ba ni sems can no //
analyzed: mi de zhes bya ba ni sems can no //
translated: The so-called person is a sentient being.

original: gang du de ltar rjes su 'gro ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang du de ltar rjes su 'gro ba yin zhe na /
translated: Where does one go in this way?

original: smras pa / pha rol tu phyin zhes @164b bya ba mkhas pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: smras pa / pha rol tu phyin zhes @164b bya ba mkhas pa rnams la ste /
translated: It is said to be the perfection for the wise ones.

original: de dag ni skye ba thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag ni skye ba thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are the principal ones of all births.

original: yang na ci mthong ba'i chos nyid la dman pa'i rjes su brjod par bya ba'am zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ci mthong ba'i chos nyid la dman pa'i rjes su brjod par bya ba'am zhe na /
translated: Or else, is it to be said that they are inferior in this very life?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.🔽It is said:🔽Even if one acts badly in this way for the sake of the next world, one is not censured in the world as a person of bad conduct,

original: smras pa / 'on kyang pha rol du zhes bya ba 'jig rten pha rol gyi ched du 'di ltar ngan par spyod pa byas par gyur na yang skye bo'i tshogs chen po'i nang du mi ston pas des legs par spyod pa yin no zhes 'jig rten du bsngags par 'gyur gyi
analyzed: smras pa / 'on kyang pha rol du zhes bya ba 'jig rten pha rol gyi ched du 'di ltar ngan par spyod pa byas par gyur na yang skye bo'i tshogs chen po'i nang du mi ston pas des legs par spyod pa yin no zhes 'jig rten du bsngags par 'gyur gyi
translated: but rather is praised as a person of good conduct.

original: / 'jig rten pha rol du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: / 'jig rten pha rol du ni ma yin te /
translated: But not in the next world,🔽because the result arises there in accordance with the action.

original: spyod pa dang mthun pa nyid du der 'bras bur 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir song nas zhes bya ba dang 'dir sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: spyod pa dang mthun pa nyid du der 'bras bur 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir song nas zhes bya ba dang 'dir sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “having gone there” should be applied to the phrase “for the sake of the next world.”

original: 'di nas song nas 'jig rten pha rol du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di nas song nas 'jig rten pha rol du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “having gone from here to the next world.”

original: tshig gi rten lce de yang dag gis nyes par spyod pa'i rgyur gyur ba yin pas smad pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig gi rten lce de yang dag gis nyes par spyod pa'i rgyur gyur ba yin pas smad pa yin te /
translated: The tongue, the basis of words, is also despised because it is the cause of bad conduct.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽It is said:

original: skyes bu skyes pa'i kha nas ni //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skyes bu skyes pa'i kha nas ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: From the mouth of a man is born

original: ko ka li ka zhes bya ba'i dge slong lha sbyin gyi tshogs pa yon tan yang dag par blangs pa la sogs pa spong bar byed cing 'od ma'i tshal na gnas te /
analyzed: ko ka li ka zhes bya ba'i dge slong lha sbyin gyi tshogs pa yon tan yang dag par blangs pa la sogs pa spong bar byed cing 'od ma'i tshal na gnas te /
translated: The monk Kokālika, Devadatta’s companion, was staying in the Bamboo Grove, abandoning the qualities of taking up what is wholesome, and so forth.

original: 'od ma'i tshal de'i bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa rnams ma dad par byed cing 'dug go //
analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal de'i bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa rnams ma dad par byed cing 'dug go //
translated: He was staying there, causing the faithful brahmins and householders of the Bamboo Grove to lose faith.

original: ji tsam na der sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu gnyis 'ongs par gyur to //
analyzed: ji tsam na der sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu gnyis 'ongs par gyur to //
translated: At one point, Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana came there.

original: de gnyis kyis 'di ltar yi dam bcas te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis 'di ltar yi dam bcas te /
translated: The two of them made this vow:

original: nyin re zhing sems can gcig ngan song las ma phyung bar bdag cag gis zan mi bza'o zhes rgya cher te /
analyzed: nyin re zhing sems can gcig ngan song las ma phyung bar bdag cag gis zan mi bza'o zhes rgya cher te /
translated: “We will not eat until we have each liberated one being from the lower realms.”

original: des lung phog pa'i mthus gzhan zhig lha'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
analyzed: des lung phog pa'i mthus gzhan zhig lha'i 'jig rten du skyes te /
translated: By the power of their transmission of the scriptures, another was born in the world of the gods.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyis 'od ma'i tshal du 'ongs nas smras pa /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyis 'od ma'i tshal du 'ongs nas smras pa /
translated: He came to Bamboo Grove by his magical power and said,

original: ji ltar nyan thos chen po 'di gnyis la bsnyen bkur mi byed ces dad pa skyed do //
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos chen po 'di gnyis la bsnyen bkur mi byed ces dad pa skyed do //
translated: “Why do you not honor these two great disciples?”

original: de nas de dag khros te /
analyzed: de nas de dag khros te /
translated: Then they became angry.

original: ko ka li ka la ji ltar khyod kyis don 'di lta bu bdag la ma brjod ces smras so //
analyzed: ko ka li ka la ji ltar khyod kyis don 'di lta bu bdag la ma brjod ces smras so //
translated: “Why didn’t you tell us about this matter?” they said to Kokālika.🔽He was tormented by jealousy. He became obsessed with finding fault with those two.

original: de phrag dog gis rab tu gdungs te de gnyis kyi skyon tshol ba mchog tu byed par gyur pa dang / ji tsam na phug cig tu de gnyis bsam gtan gyi phyir zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: de phrag dog gis rab tu gdungs te de gnyis kyi skyon tshol ba mchog tu byed par gyur pa dang / ji tsam na phug cig tu de gnyis bsam gtan gyi phyir zhugs par gyur to //
translated: One day they entered a cave to meditate.

original: skyes bu gnyis shig dang bud med gcig kyang ston ka'i char 'bab pas nyen te /
analyzed: skyes bu gnyis shig dang bud med gcig kyang ston ka'i char 'bab pas nyen te /
translated: Two men and a woman were also caught in a fall rainstorm.

original: de nyid du zhugs so //🔽skyes bu gnyis ni sngar song la bud med ni phyis byung bas skyes bu de gnyis kyis nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas /
analyzed: de nyid du zhugs so // skyes bu gnyis ni sngar song la bud med ni phyis byung bas skyes bu de gnyis kyis nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas /
translated: They entered the same cave.

original: ko ka li kas 'phags pa de gnyis @165a * //
analyzed: ko ka li kas 'phags pa de gnyis @165a * //
translated: The two men left first, and the woman came later. Kokālika saw signs that the two men had enjoyed themselves with the woman.🔽“The noble ones,” he said,

original: la sdig pa byed pa yin no zhes tshig ngan pa smras so //
analyzed: la sdig pa byed pa yin no zhes tshig ngan pa smras so //
translated: He said, You are a sinner!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ko ka li ka sh'a ri'i bu mood gal gyi bu gnyis la ni mngon par ma dad pa ma bskyed cig / de dag ni nye bar na gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: ko ka li ka sh'a ri'i bu mood gal gyi bu gnyis la ni mngon par ma dad pa ma bskyed cig / de dag ni nye bar na gnas pa yin la /
translated: Kokālika, do not generate disrespect for Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana. They are close to me,

original: de gnyis ni nges shing tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni nges shing tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yin te /
translated: and they are my spiritual friends,

original: yun ring por gnod par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yun ring por gnod par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: and they will be harmed for a long time.

original: 'di ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la dad par byas pa dang / yid ches par byas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la sdig pa 'dod pa yin no zhes smras so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la dad par byas pa dang / yid ches par byas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la sdig pa 'dod pa yin no zhes smras so zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, although the Blessed One made me faithful and confident, he said, The Blessed One desires my sin.

original: de ma thag tu yungs kar tsam dang mon sran sde'u tsam dang / sran ma tsam dang / rgya shug gi tshi gu tsam dang / bil pa'i 'bras bu tsam dang ga pid ta tsam gyi 'brum bu rnams kyis lus la khyab par gyur nas ji tsam na dmyal ba padma chen po ltar gas par skyes te /
analyzed: de ma thag tu yungs kar tsam dang mon sran sde'u tsam dang / sran ma tsam dang / rgya shug gi tshi gu tsam dang / bil pa'i 'bras bu tsam dang ga pid ta tsam gyi 'brum bu rnams kyis lus la khyab par gyur nas ji tsam na dmyal ba padma chen po ltar gas par skyes te /
translated: Then he is born in the Great Lotus Hell.

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs so //
translated: For this reason, three verses are spoken.

original: 'dir kha cig ni de ltar dge slong aar gi ka zhes bya ba dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'ongs te /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig ni de ltar dge slong aar gi ka zhes bya ba dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'ongs te /
translated: Here, some say: Thus, the monk named Argiṣṭa came at the right time.

original: bcom ldan 'das la gnod sems shin tu drag po skyed par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gnod sems shin tu drag po skyed par gyur to //
translated: He generated very strong malice towards the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de nyi ma bdun la shi 'phos nas dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de nyi ma bdun la shi 'phos nas dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One also prophesied that he would die after seven days and be reborn in hell.

original: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis kyang thos te rang gi yul nas spyugs so //
analyzed: rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis kyang thos te rang gi yul nas spyugs so //
translated: King Prasenajit also heard this and exiled him from his country.

original: de ltar grong khyer chen po drug dang / shing drung la sogs par de'i lha rnams dang / wa rnams kyis kyang gnas rnyed pa yin pa na bdag gis ni 'dzam bu'i gling du skabs ma rnyed do zhes khrag dron por skyugs te mnar med par skyes pa de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar grong khyer chen po drug dang / shing drung la sogs par de'i lha rnams dang / wa rnams kyis kyang gnas rnyed pa yin pa na bdag gis ni 'dzam bu'i gling du skabs ma rnyed do zhes khrag dron por skyugs te mnar med par skyes pa de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the gods of the six great cities, the gods of the foot of trees, and so on, and even foxes find a place to live, but I have not found a place in Jambudvīpa.

original: skyes bu'i skyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni sems med pa dang ma skyes pa rnams la ni las kyis 'phags pa la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i skyes pa'i zhes bya ba ni sems med pa dang ma skyes pa rnams la ni las kyis 'phags pa la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase “a person who is born” in the root text refers to those who are sentient, not those who are insentient or unborn, because it is impossible for karma to propel them to a higher rebirth and so on.

original: da ltar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu lnga len pa yin no zhes lung las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu lnga len pa yin no zhes lung las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The five results that occur in the present are the results of the present action.

original: sta re shing la sogs pa gcod pa'i cha byad de /
analyzed: sta re shing la sogs pa gcod pa'i cha byad de /
translated: The axe is the instrument that cuts down trees and so on.

original: de dang chos mthun pa yin pa'i phyir lce la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa yin pa'i phyir lce la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The tongue is called an axe because it is similar to an axe.

original: kha nas skyes gyur nas zhes bya ba ni sdig pa byed pa kha las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: kha nas skyes gyur nas zhes bya ba ni sdig pa byed pa kha las skyes pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “born from the mouth” means that the mouth gives rise to evil.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How does it give rise to evil?

original: lce sta re lta bu las gang zhig bdag nyid gcod par byed par 'gyur ba'i tshig ces bya ba tshig gang zhig gi gnas su gyur pa ni lce yin la /🔽des 'di ltar bdag nyid 'jig par byed @165b pa yin te /
analyzed: lce sta re lta bu las gang zhig bdag nyid gcod par byed par 'gyur ba'i tshig ces bya ba tshig gang zhig gi gnas su gyur pa ni lce yin la / des 'di ltar bdag nyid 'jig par byed @165b pa yin te /
translated: The tongue is the place of the words, and it cuts the self in this way.

original: shing mkhan gyis shing la sta res bya ba byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shing mkhan gyis shing la sta res bya ba byed pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a woodcutter who uses an axe to cut wood.

original: des na de sta re yin no //
analyzed: des na de sta re yin no //
translated: Therefore, the tongue is like an axe.

original: bdag nyid gcod par byed pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid gcod par byed pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the self that is cut?

original: smras pa / ngan pa smra byed pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / ngan pa smra byed pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is said to be the one who speaks badly.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa smra zhing ngag ma bsdams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa smra zhing ngag ma bsdams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one speaks what should not be said and one's speech is unrestrained.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: ngan par smra bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid smras pa /
analyzed: ngan par smra bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid smras pa /
translated: The nature of speaking badly is stated:

original: gang zhig smad 'ong skye bo stod byed dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig smad 'ong skye bo stod byed dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The one who praises the contemptible... and so on.

original: gang la la zhig smad par rigs pa'i skye bo de ni bstod cing bstod par 'os pa'i skye bo ni rnam par smad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang la la zhig smad par rigs pa'i skye bo de ni bstod cing bstod par 'os pa'i skye bo ni rnam par smad par byed pa ste /
translated: He praises those who are worthy of blame and disparages those who are worthy of praise.

original: yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir bstod par 'os pa'i sems can /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir bstod par 'os pa'i sems can /
translated: He disparages those who are worthy of praise because they have all good qualities.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa smod pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa smod pa'o //
translated: He disparages the noble Śāriputra and so on.

original: 'di dag ni ngan pa smra bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni ngan pa smra bar byed pa ste /
translated: These are the evil things he says.

original: de skad smra ba'i gang zag ni tshig ngan pa smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad smra ba'i gang zag ni tshig ngan pa smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The person who speaks in this way becomes one who speaks evil words.

original: de ni kha yi 'thab krol kun stsogs shing //
analyzed: de ni kha yi 'thab krol kun stsogs shing //
translated: He collects all the quarrels of the mouth.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: kha la de gnas pa yin par ston te /
analyzed: kha la de gnas pa yin par ston te /
translated: It shows that it resides in the mouth.

original: gnas kyis ston pa'i phyir grong can 'ongs pa la grong can 'ongs zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnas kyis ston pa'i phyir grong can 'ongs pa la grong can 'ongs zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Because it shows the location, it is like saying the one who comes to the village has come to the village.

original: gang zhig ngan par smra bar byed pa de ni kha yis 'thab krol te /
analyzed: gang zhig ngan par smra bar byed pa de ni kha yis 'thab krol te /
translated: He who speaks evil words is one who quarrels with the mouth.

original: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa'i bdag nyid gnod pa kun du bsogs par 'gyur zhing 'thab krol can gang gi rgyu nges ni 'di dang phyi ma gnyi gar bde ba'am 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rjes su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa'i bdag nyid gnod pa kun du bsogs par 'gyur zhing 'thab krol can gang gi rgyu nges ni 'di dang phyi ma gnyi gar bde ba'am 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rjes su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who is of the nature of verbal misconduct accumulates all harm and is quarrelsome. The cause of that is not the experience of a pleasant or desired result in either this life or the next.

original: gzhan yang 'thab krol ni gnod pa byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'thab krol ni gnod pa byed pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, quarrelsomeness is the very cause of harm.🔽Why is it not mentioned here?

original: de la 'di zhes ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
analyzed: de la 'di zhes ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
translated: It is said:

original: smras pa / 'thab krol de ni cung zad tsam du zad //
analyzed: smras pa / 'thab krol de ni cung zad tsam du zad //
translated: That quarrelsomeness is just a little bit.

original: ces bya ba 'di'o /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di'o /
translated: This is it.

original: 'di ni cung zad tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'di ni cung zad tsam du zad de /
translated: This is just a little bit.🔽What is the harm in that?

original: 'di ltar 'di'i gnod pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i gnod pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: smras pa / gang 'dir cho los rang nor pham byed pa //
analyzed: smras pa / gang 'dir cho los rang nor pham byed pa //
translated: Here, by gambling, one's own wealth is defeated.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is it.

original: 'thab krol gang zhig 'jig rten 'dir rgyan po la sogs pa 'jab bu'i mis rang gi nor te dbyig la sogs pa las pham pa dang / 'jig pa dang / nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab krol gang zhig 'jig rten 'dir rgyan po la sogs pa 'jab bu'i mis rang gi nor te dbyig la sogs pa las pham pa dang / 'jig pa dang / nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: That quarrelsomeness in this world is gambling and so on, by which one's own wealth, such as gold and so on, is defeated, destroyed, and lost.

original: yang na gang zhe bya ba ni gang zag ste dngos po gang gi rang gi nor khyad par can 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'thab krol gyis sgrub par byed kyang 'di ni nyes pa cung zad tsam du zad de /
analyzed: yang na gang zhe bya ba ni gang zag ste dngos po gang gi rang gi nor khyad par can 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'thab krol gyis sgrub par byed kyang 'di ni nyes pa cung zad tsam du zad de /
translated: Or else, “what” refers to the person. The characteristic of the destruction of one’s special wealth is the cause of quarrels. But this is only a slight fault,

original: tshe 'di'i 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa tsam 'jig pa'i phyir ro //🔽de 'dir 'thab krol shin tu chen po yin //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa tsam 'jig pa'i phyir ro // de 'dir 'thab krol shin tu chen po yin //
translated: because it is only the destruction of the perfect wealth of this life.🔽This is a very great quarrel in this life.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid ni tshe 'dir yang 'thab krol shin tu chen po yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid ni tshe 'dir yang 'thab krol shin tu chen po yin te /
translated: This is a very great quarrel in this very life.

original: su zhig ce na /🔽gang zhig bde bar gshegs la @166a * //
analyzed: su zhig ce na / gang zhig bde bar gshegs la @166a * //
translated: Who is it?

original: yid 'khrugs pa //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yid 'khrugs pa // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He who is angry with the Well-Gone One.🔽He who is angry with the Well-Gone One.

original: skyon med pa'i dam pa rnams la sems rab tu 'khrugs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skyon med pa'i dam pa rnams la sems rab tu 'khrugs par byed pa ste /
translated: He who is angry with the best of the faultless.

original: yid tsam 'khrugs pas kyang de lta bu yin no /
analyzed: yid tsam 'khrugs pas kyang de lta bu yin no /
translated: Even a slight anger toward them is like this.

original: ngag gis 'khrugs par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: ngag gis 'khrugs par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention being angry with them verbally?

original: skye ba du ma dag tu bde ba'i khyad par nyams pa'i phyir dang / shin tu mi bzad pa'i sdug bsngal 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba du ma dag tu bde ba'i khyad par nyams pa'i phyir dang / shin tu mi bzad pa'i sdug bsngal 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because for many lives he will experience the loss of happiness and the attainment of extremely unbearable suffering.

original: gang dam pa rnams la yid 'khrugs par byed cing 'phya bar byed pa de ni dmyal ba gang dang gang du dus ji tsam gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang dam pa rnams la yid 'khrugs par byed cing 'phya bar byed pa de ni dmyal ba gang dang gang du dus ji tsam gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: For how long does one remain in the hells who has disturbed the minds of the holy and who has reviled them?

original: de'i phyir ngag yid 'phags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngag yid 'phags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the verse says, “The noble ones are disturbed in mind and reviled by the mind and speech.”

original: dmyal ba 'di dag gi lo dang tshe'i tshad rnam par phye bar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dpe tsam du gsungs te /
analyzed: dmyal ba 'di dag gi lo dang tshe'i tshad rnam par phye bar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dpe tsam du gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One has taught the measure of years and life in the hells only as an example.

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: “Monks, it is like this:

original: yul ma ga dh'a'i khal nyi shu shong ba'i rdzang til gyis bkang ste kha bcings pa las /
analyzed: yul ma ga dh'a'i khal nyi shu shong ba'i rdzang til gyis bkang ste kha bcings pa las /
translated: a granary in Magadha holding twenty Magadhan measures of sesame seeds is filled with sesame seeds.

original: de nas la la zhig gis lo brgya brgya zhing til gyi 'bru re re phyung bas ni dge slong dag myur ba nyid du yul ma ga dh'a'i til gyi rdzang khal nyi shu shong ba de rim gyis yongs su zad cing med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nas la la zhig gis lo brgya brgya zhing til gyi 'bru re re phyung bas ni dge slong dag myur ba nyid du yul ma ga dh'a'i til gyi rdzang khal nyi shu shong ba de rim gyis yongs su zad cing med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Then, monks, suppose someone were to take out one seed every hundred years.

original: chu bur can du skyes pa'i sems can gyi tshe'i tshad ni de ltar mthar thug par 'gyur ro zhes nga mi smra'o //
analyzed: chu bur can du skyes pa'i sems can gyi tshe'i tshad ni de ltar mthar thug par 'gyur ro zhes nga mi smra'o //
translated: Monks, I say that the Magadhan sesame store would quickly be emptied in this way, but not the life-span of beings born in the Blistering Hell.

original: dge slong dag 'di ltar rdzang khal nyi shu'i tshad ni chu bur can gyi yin te /🔽de gcig tu brtsis pa'i nyi shu 'gyur ni chu bur rdol ba'i yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar rdzang khal nyi shu'i tshad ni chu bur can gyi yin te / de gcig tu brtsis pa'i nyi shu 'gyur ni chu bur rdol ba'i yin no //
translated: Monks, the measure of the Blistering Hell is the amount that would fit in twenty Magadhan carts.🔽Twenty times the life-span of the Blistering Hell is the life-span in the Bursting Blister Hell.

original: de bzhin du pad ma ltar gas pa'i tshe gcig tu brtsis pa'i nyi shu 'gyur ni pad ma ltar gas pa chen po'i yin no //🔽de las rdzang gcig ni chu bur can gyi tshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du pad ma ltar gas pa'i tshe gcig tu brtsis pa'i nyi shu 'gyur ni pad ma ltar gas pa chen po'i yin no // de las rdzang gcig ni chu bur can gyi tshad do //
translated: Twenty times the life-span of the Bursting Blister Hell is the life-span in the Hell of Chattering Teeth.

original: rdzang nyi shu ni chu bur rdol ba'i 'o //
analyzed: rdzang nyi shu ni chu bur rdol ba'i 'o //
translated: Twenty times the life-span of the Hell of Chattering Teeth is the life-span in the Hell of Screaming.🔽Twenty times the life-span of the Hell of Screaming is the life-span in the Hell of Great Screaming.🔽Twenty times the life-span of the Hell of Great Screaming is the life-span in the Hell of Incessant Pain.

original: rdzang de bzhi brgya ni so thams thams kyi'o //
analyzed: rdzang de bzhi brgya ni so thams thams kyi'o //
translated: The four hundred yojanas of the fourth hell are the hell of the Howling.

original: rdzang de stong phrag brgyad cu ni aa chu zer ba'i 'o //
analyzed: rdzang de stong phrag brgyad cu ni aa chu zer ba'i 'o //
translated: The eight thousand yojanas of the fifth hell are the hell of the Great Howling.

original: rdzang de 'bum phrag drug khri ni kyi hud zer ba'i 'o //
analyzed: rdzang de 'bum phrag drug khri ni kyi hud zer ba'i 'o //
translated: The sixty-four thousand yojanas of the sixth hell are the hell of the Heat.

original: de 'bum phrag drug cu rtsa gnyis ni autpal ltar gas pa'i 'o //🔽rdzang de bye ba phrag drug dang 'bum phrag bzhi bcu ni pad ma ltar gas pa'i 'o //
analyzed: de 'bum phrag drug cu rtsa gnyis ni autpal ltar gas pa'i 'o // rdzang de bye ba phrag drug dang 'bum phrag bzhi bcu ni pad ma ltar gas pa'i 'o //
translated: The sixty-two hundred thousand yojanas of the seventh hell are the hell of the Great Heat.

original: rdzang de bye ba phrag brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad ni pad ma ltar gas pa chen po'i yin no zhes bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: rdzang de bye ba phrag brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad ni pad ma ltar gas pa chen po'i yin no zhes bgrang ba'o //
translated: The four hundred twenty-eight hundred thousand yojanas of the eighth hell are the hell of the Incessant Torture.

original: tsha ba'i dmyal ba rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyang de dang mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: tsha ba'i dmyal ba rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyang de dang mnyam pa yin te /
translated: The life expectancy in the hot hells is equal to the dimensions of the hells.

original: grang ba'i dmyal ba rnams la skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir gdul bya rnams la de ltar dper brjod pa yin no zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: grang ba'i dmyal ba rnams la skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir gdul bya rnams la de ltar dper brjod pa yin no zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say that the life expectancy in the cold hells is equal to the life expectancy in the corresponding hot hells.

original: 'brum bu phra mos bar mtshams med par lus la khyab pa'i phyir chu @166b bur rdol ba'o //
analyzed: 'brum bu phra mos bar mtshams med par lus la khyab pa'i phyir chu @166b bur rdol ba'o //
translated: The hell of the Blisters is so called because the bodies of the sentient beings there are covered with blisters from head to foot.

original: bye bar chu bur can dang zhes bya ba ni dus de srid kyi bar du pad ma chen po ltar gas pa'i sems can nyid gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: bye bar chu bur can dang zhes bya ba ni dus de srid kyi bar du pad ma chen po ltar gas pa'i sems can nyid gnas pa yin te /
translated: The “blisters” are the beings in the Great Lotus Hell, who remain there for that length of time.

original: shin tu tshe ring por dus de srid kyi bar du ko ka li ka gnas pas des na de nyid dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: shin tu tshe ring por dus de srid kyi bar du ko ka li ka gnas pas des na de nyid dbye ba yin no //
translated: Since the monk Kokalika lived for a very long time, he was divided into that hell.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to the hell.

original: 'phags pas smad pa ni dam pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'phags pas smad pa ni dam pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “Condemned by the noble ones” means condemned by the holy ones.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Will go” means will enter.

original: ci zhig byas nas 'gro ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas 'gro ba yin zhe na /
translated: What will he do when he goes there?

original: ngag yid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ngag yid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “with speech and mind.”

original: sdig pa can gyi tshig dang sdig pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi tshig dang sdig pa can gyi yid do //
translated: Evil speech and evil mind.

original: bsten pa ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bsten pa ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Relying” means engaging in.

original: smad pa bsten pa na ni dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smad pa bsten pa na ni dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one relies on what is condemned, one will go to hell.

original: de la 'di tsam du gnas par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'di tsam du gnas par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning of this is “he will remain there for that length of time.”

original: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa'i mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ma shes pa dag la de'i 'bras bu bstan pas de las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa'i mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ma shes pa dag la de'i 'bras bu bstan pas de las bzlog par bya ba'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was taught in order to turn them away from that by showing the undesirable result of verbal misconduct to those who do not know it.

original: dam pa rnams ni bden pa ma yin pas tshig ngan pa brjod kyang mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dam pa rnams ni bden pa ma yin pas tshig ngan pa brjod kyang mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that the noble ones do not change even when spoken to with untrue bad words, it is said:

original: sdig pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: With a sinful mind, they falsely accused the noble one.

original: mdza' bo dang sa las skyes zhes bya ba'i dge slong de gnyis dang tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor tshe rabs su khon zhugs par gyur pas de gnyis kyis tshig ngan pa smras te /
analyzed: mdza' bo dang sa las skyes zhes bya ba'i dge slong de gnyis dang tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor tshe rabs su khon zhugs par gyur pas de gnyis kyis tshig ngan pa smras te /
translated: Those two monks, Mitrāvasu and Bhūmija, had a long-standing grudge against the venerable Aśvajit, so they spoke bad words.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example:

original: gyad bu nor bdag cag gis dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog dang mi tshangs par spyod pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gyad bu nor bdag cag gis dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog dang mi tshangs par spyod pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: We saw Aśvajit the monk engaging in impure conduct with the nun Utpalavarnā.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to that, it is said:

original: sdig pa'i sems kyis ma nyes skyon brjod pa //
analyzed: sdig pa'i sems kyis ma nyes skyon brjod pa //
translated: With a sinful mind, they falsely accused the noble one.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is what he said.

original: ma nyes pa ni mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: ma nyes pa ni mi bden pa'o //
translated: No fault means untrue.

original: skyon brjod pa ni tshig ngan pas sun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyon brjod pa ni tshig ngan pas sun par byed pa'o //
translated: Fault-finding means to revile with harsh words.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: sdig pa'i sems kyis @167a * //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sdig pa'i sems kyis @167a * // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By a sinful mind.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid kyis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid kyis so //
translated: By a defiled mind.

original: sems kyi skyon dang bral zhing skyon spangs pa'i 'phags pa rnams ni skyon brjod par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sems kyi skyon dang bral zhing skyon spangs pa'i 'phags pa rnams ni skyon brjod par mi rung ngo //
translated: The noble ones, who are free from mental faults and have abandoned faults, are not fit to be faulted.

original: skyon brjod pas ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: skyon brjod pas ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by fault-finding?

original: bdag nyid gsad phyir dmyal ba spel bar zad //
analyzed: bdag nyid gsad phyir dmyal ba spel bar zad //
translated: It only increases the hells for the sake of killing oneself.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said:

original: bdag nyid bcom pa'i phyir dmyal ba'i 'gro bar dor bar byed de /
analyzed: bdag nyid bcom pa'i phyir dmyal ba'i 'gro bar dor bar byed de /
translated: For the sake of destroying oneself, one is cast into the hell realms.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu nye bar len cing shin tu mi bzad pa'i tshor ba myong ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu nye bar len cing shin tu mi bzad pa'i tshor ba myong ba yin te /
translated: One takes on the fruitional effect and experiences extremely unbearable feelings.

original: gang dag mthong ba'i chos nyid kyi yul gyi ro la dmigs shing mthong la /
analyzed: gang dag mthong ba'i chos nyid kyi yul gyi ro la dmigs shing mthong la /
translated: Those who, in this very life, observe and see the object of the sense faculties,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal chen po'i rgyun ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal chen po'i rgyun ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: but not the cause of a great future suffering.

original: gang mkhas pa dag ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang mkhas pa dag ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang mi 'gyur te /
translated: The wise do not become angry even when harmed by others.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar stobs ldan nyes med ces bya ba ni 'di'i so sor brtags pa'i stobs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar stobs ldan nyes med ces bya ba ni 'di'i so sor brtags pa'i stobs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because they have the power of discernment.

original: bzod par byed pa ni mi bzod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bzod par byed pa ni mi bzod pa med pa'o //
translated: They are patient, that is, they do not become impatient.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni skyon brjod pa de thos kyang ngo //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni skyon brjod pa de thos kyang ngo //
translated: Even when they hear such criticism,

original: 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na ;
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na ;
translated: How do we know that?

original: sems kyang 'khrugs par mi byed do //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems kyang 'khrugs par mi byed do // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They do not become mentally disturbed.

original: sems rnyog par ma byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems rnyog par ma byas pa yin no //
translated: They do not become mentally agitated.

original: rigs pa ni dam pa rnams kyi gzhung lugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: rigs pa ni dam pa rnams kyi gzhung lugs kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: Reason is the practice of the scriptures of the holy ones.

original: dam pa rnams kyi gzhung rjes su bsrungs bas rnyog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyi gzhung rjes su bsrungs bas rnyog pa med pa'o //
translated: They are not agitated because they follow the scriptures of the holy ones.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dam pa rnams ni 'ching gyur kyang//
analyzed: dam pa rnams ni 'ching gyur kyang//
translated: Even when the holy ones are bound,

original: sems ni 'khrugs par mi 'dod de //
analyzed: sems ni 'khrugs par mi 'dod de //
translated: They do not wish for a disturbed mind.

original: srog gi phyir yang mi 'khrugs pa //
analyzed: srog gi phyir yang mi 'khrugs pa //
translated: He is not disturbed even for the sake of his life.

original: de bas mkhas pa 'dod mi byed //
analyzed: de bas mkhas pa 'dod mi byed //
translated: Therefore, the wise do not desire it.

original: ces bshad do //
analyzed: ces bshad do //
translated: This is explained.

original: sems kyang 'bad pas 'khrugs par mi byed do zhes kha cig brjod de /
analyzed: sems kyang 'bad pas 'khrugs par mi byed do zhes kha cig brjod de /
translated: Some say that the mind also is not disturbed by effort.

original: skye bo dam pa rnams ni nam yang 'khrugs pa dang bcas pa mi byed do zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don to //
analyzed: skye bo dam pa rnams ni nam yang 'khrugs pa dang bcas pa mi byed do zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning here is that the holy persons never act with disturbance.

original: dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is stated to show the difference between the holy and the unholy.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la yon tan la smod par byed pa ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la yon tan la smod par byed pa ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that for him who disparages the virtues, there is the undesirable result, it is said:

original: bsam brlag gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam brlag gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The one who is devoid of thought, etc.

original: lha sbyin gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i lam spangs te /
analyzed: lha sbyin gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i lam spangs te /
translated: Devadatta abandoned the path taught by the Blessed One.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi lnga po 'di dag ni don dam pa thob par byed pa yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi lnga po 'di dag ni don dam pa thob par byed pa yin no zhes ston te /
translated: He taught that these five precepts are for attaining the ultimate.

original: 'di ltar 'o ma btung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'o ma btung bar mi bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should not drink milk.

original: gang gi rgyus be'u la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi rgyus be'u la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would harm the calf.

original: sha bza' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: sha bza' bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not eat meat

original: sems can la gnod pa'i las 'byung ba'i phyir @167b ro ;
analyzed: sems can la gnod pa'i las 'byung ba'i phyir @167b ro ;
translated: because it would lead to the sin of killing.

original: / kha tshar gcad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: / kha tshar gcad par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not cut the fringe

original: thags mkhan gyi skyes bu byed pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: thags mkhan gyi skyes bu byed pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
translated: because it would lead to the sin of cutting grass.

original: lan tshva bza' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: lan tshva bza' bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not eat salt

original: dbang phyug chen po'i khu ba las yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i khu ba las yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the essence of the great lord Maheśvara.

original: dgon par gnas par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dgon par gnas par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not live in the forest

original: sbyin pa po rnams kyi sbyin pa'i bsod nams yongs su spyad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston te /
analyzed: sbyin pa po rnams kyi sbyin pa'i bsod nams yongs su spyad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston te /
translated: because it would lead to the sin of depriving donors of the merit of giving.

original: des na 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: des na 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is what is taught.🔽A certain monk, who had previously been a tīrthika, taught the following:

original: dge slong zhig sngar mu stegs can zhig pas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: dge slong zhig sngar mu stegs can zhig pas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa'i gtam mdzad pa ni /
translated: “The Blessed One taught the discourse on the four noble truths

original: ji tsam na lan gsum gyi bar du yang tshig ngan pas smod par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos la smod pa 'dis ni dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji tsam na lan gsum gyi bar du yang tshig ngan pas smod par byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos la smod pa 'dis ni dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “This one who reviles the true Dharma will be born in hell.

original: lo bye ba stong phrag brgyad cur sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lo bye ba stong phrag brgyad cur sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: For eighty thousand million years he will experience suffering.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas kyang 'dir skyes te /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas kyang 'dir skyes te /
translated: And after dying from there, he will be born here.

original: de'i tshig thams cad kyis kyang mnyan par mi 'os par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshig thams cad kyis kyang mnyan par mi 'os par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And all his words will be unworthy of being listened to.”

original: zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: This is what others say.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni gang la la zhig go //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni gang la la zhig go //
translated: “Whoever” means whoever.

original: bstan pa ni ji lta ba nyid bstan pa'o /
analyzed: bstan pa ni ji lta ba nyid bstan pa'o /
translated: “Teaching” is teaching the way things are.

original: 'phags pa ni bden pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni bden pa mthong ba'o //
translated: “Noble one” is one who has seen the truth.

original: dgra bcom pa ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa ste /
translated: “Arhat” is one who has abandoned the afflictions of the three realms.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra thams cad las nges par mi rgyal ba ni dgra bcom par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra thams cad las nges par mi rgyal ba ni dgra bcom par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has not completely conquered all the afflictions of the enemy is not an arhat.

original: chos kyis 'tsho ba dang zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam thob pa des ni dogs pa med par chos kyis 'tsho bar rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyis 'tsho ba dang zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam thob pa des ni dogs pa med par chos kyis 'tsho bar rtag pa yin te /
translated: “He lives by the Dharma” means that one who has attained the path of no-more-learning always lives by the Dharma without fear.

original: 'dir rtsod pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i kun du rgyu ba'i mdo yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rtsod pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i kun du rgyu ba'i mdo yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, the sutra on the wandering mendicant who is ready to debate should be cited.

original: spong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang de'i nyan thos rnams kyis bstan pa la phyin ci log tu byed cing yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: spong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang de'i nyan thos rnams kyis bstan pa la phyin ci log tu byed cing yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: “He rejects” means that he acts in opposition to and rejects the teaching of the Buddha and his disciples.

original: 'di ltar ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ltar ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa'o ;
translated: “It is not like that” is the statement of rejection.

original: / de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: / de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: smras pa / bsam brlag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: smras pa / bsam brlag ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is said: “He is a fool.”

original: blo ngan zhing blun po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo ngan zhing blun po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is evil-minded and stupid.

original: ci la brten nas de ltar spong bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci la brten nas de ltar spong bar byed ce na /
translated: On the basis of what does he reject?

original: sdig can gyi lta ba la brten nas zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sdig can gyi lta ba la brten nas zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: “He rejects on the basis of the view of the wicked.”

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni sdig pa can gyi lta ba ngan pa thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni sdig pa can gyi lta ba ngan pa thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the root of all the wicked, bad views.

original: yang na sdig pa can gyi lta ba ni lta ba log pa ste /
analyzed: yang na sdig pa can gyi lta ba ni lta ba log pa ste /
translated: Or else, the sinful view is the wrong view,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i sdig pa can tshol bar byed pa nyid la brjod de /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i sdig pa can tshol bar byed pa nyid la brjod de /
translated: because it is the sinful view that seeks the perishable collection, etc.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad gcod pa'i phyir dang / dam pa'i gzhi nyams par byed pa'i phyir sdig pa can gyi gdol pa lta bu dang / dri nga ba'i mar lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad gcod pa'i phyir dang / dam pa'i gzhi nyams par byed pa'i phyir sdig pa can gyi gdol pa lta bu dang / dri nga ba'i mar lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a sinful outcast, because it severs all the roots of virtue, and it is like stinking butter, because it destroys the basis of the holy life.

original: yang na @168a * //
analyzed: yang na @168a * //
translated: Or else,

original: mu stegs can gzhan gyi lta ba la brten pa ste de la brten pas ni 'di lta bu spong bar byed pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can gzhan gyi lta ba la brten pa ste de la brten pas ni 'di lta bu spong bar byed pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is the view that is based on the views of other tīrthikas, because it arises in dependence on them and because it abandons this view.

original: de'i nyes dmigs bstan pa /
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs bstan pa /
translated: The teaching of its disadvantage:

original: smyig ma 'bru chags lta bur ni //
analyzed: smyig ma 'bru chags lta bur ni //
translated: Like a reed with fruit,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says.

original: smyig ma la tsher ma dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu yod de /
analyzed: smyig ma la tsher ma dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu yod de /
translated: A reed has fruit with thorns.

original: de ni rang nyid gsod pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni rang nyid gsod pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur te /

original: de skyes na de skams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skyes na de skams par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dper na gang de ltar de rang gi 'bras bus gsod pa bzhin du 'di spong bar byed na rang gi gnas 'jig par byed pa yin te /

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ngan song la sogs par smin cing 'bras bu spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ngan song la sogs par smin cing 'bras bu spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: dam pa'i chos spong bar dgag pa'i phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spong bar dgag pa'i phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no //

original: gang gi phyir man ngag ma rungs pa nyid kyis ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir man ngag ma rungs pa nyid kyis ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yin te /

analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

analyzed: tshig bzang kho na smra ba yin //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: mnyan yod na bud med gtum mo kha cig bab col du khro ba dang ldan zhing dmod mo 'debs pa yod de /

analyzed: de las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so // tshig bzang kho na zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
