translated: It is well-spoken, because it is free of the four faults of speech.🔽It

original: sdig pa can ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sdig pa can ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The sinful man is as previously explained.

original: gdung byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gdung bar byed pa yin te me bzhin no //
analyzed: gdung byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gdung bar byed pa yin te me bzhin no //
translated: The tormentor is one who torments himself and others, like fire.

original: byis pa sdig can zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni khyad par du bdag nyid la gdung bar byed pa dang / bdag nyid la gnod par byed par ston te /
analyzed: byis pa sdig can zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni khyad par du bdag nyid la gdung bar byed pa dang / bdag nyid la gnod par byed par ston te /
translated: The fool, the sinful man, etc. show that he especially torments himself and injures himself.

original: gal te gang zhig sdig pa can gyi tshig smra bar byed na de ni nges par gzhan spong ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te gang zhig sdig pa can gyi tshig smra bar byed na de ni nges par gzhan spong ba yin te /
translated: If someone speaks the words of a sinful man, he certainly abandons the other world.

original: 'jig @168b rten pha rol yongs su spong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig @168b rten pha rol yongs su spong ba yin no //
translated: He abandons the other world.

original: 'dir gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the word “other” is a condition of the other world.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pha rol mchog tu byed pa ni legs kyang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i sdig pa mi byed cing bsod nams nye bar sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pha rol mchog tu byed pa ni legs kyang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i sdig pa mi byed cing bsod nams nye bar sogs pa yin no //
translated: Because he does not produce sin which generates an undesirable result, he is a good man who makes the other world supreme. He accumulates merit.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni the tshom med par sdig pa rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni the tshom med par sdig pa rtsom par byed do //
translated: The others, without doubt, commit evil.

original: ji ltar sdig pa byed cing 'jig rten pha rol spong ba yin zhes gzung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sdig pa byed cing 'jig rten pha rol spong ba yin zhes gzung bar bya zhe na /
translated: How do they commit evil and reject the next world?

original: smra ba'i tshe na 'ching 'gyur la //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smra ba'i tshe na 'ching 'gyur la // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are bound by the noose of karma when they speak.

original: gang gi phyir gang dag sdig pa can gyi tshig dam pa rnams la smra ba na ngan song gi las kyi zhags pas 'ching bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang dag sdig pa can gyi tshig dam pa rnams la smra ba na ngan song gi las kyi zhags pas 'ching bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because when they speak, they are bound by the noose of karma leading to the miserable realms.

original: de nas der skyes pa na sdug bsngal khyad par can dag myong ba yin no //
analyzed: de nas der skyes pa na sdug bsngal khyad par can dag myong ba yin no //
translated: Then, when they are born there, they experience special sufferings.

original: des na de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: des na de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de dag 'phags pa mi gsung ngo //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag 'phags pa mi gsung ngo // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The noble ones do not speak like that.

original: ngag ma rungs pa ni dam pa rnams mi brjod do //
analyzed: ngag ma rungs pa ni dam pa rnams mi brjod do //
translated: The noble ones do not speak evil words.

original: de lta na gang zhig brjod pa yin zhe na byis pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: de lta na gang zhig brjod pa yin zhe na byis pa zhes smos te /
translated: If that is so, then who speaks? The foolish.

original: de'i nyes dmigs ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not see the disadvantages of that.

original: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa ni skyon ma shes pa rnams la de'i skyon bstan pas de las bzlog pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa ni skyon ma shes pa rnams la de'i skyon bstan pas de las bzlog pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: As for verbal misconduct, it is taught in order to turn people away from it by showing the faults of that to those who do not know the faults.

original: gang zhig ngag yang dag par sdom par byed pas chos ston pa de'i tshig ni shin tu yid du 'ong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang zhig ngag yang dag par sdom par byed pas chos ston pa de'i tshig ni shin tu yid du 'ong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that the speech of one who teaches the Dharma by restraining speech is very pleasing, it is said:

original: dge slong ngag ni bsdams pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ngag ni bsdams pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The speech of a monk who is restrained... and so on.

original: btsun pa dge slong rnams ji tsam gyis na snyan par smra ba zhes brjod pa lags zhes zhus pa dang / ji tsam na 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong rnams ji tsam gyis na snyan par smra ba zhes brjod pa lags zhes zhus pa dang / ji tsam na 'di gsungs so //
translated: Venerable ones, to what extent is one said to be a pleasant speaker? When asked this, he said:

original: gzhan dag ni rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa spyan drangs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa spyan drangs te /
translated: Others say that King Prasenajit invited the Blessed One together with the community of śrāvaka monks,

original: zhal zas btung ba gya nom pa dag gis tshim par byas so //
analyzed: zhal zas btung ba gya nom pa dag gis tshim par byas so //
translated: and satisfied them with excellent food and drink.

original: tshe dang ldan pa lan tshva bzang po 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lan tshva bzang po 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The venerable Bhadraka thought this:

original: rgyal pos ni bdag cag la nyin par ni zang zing gis tshim par byas so //
analyzed: rgyal pos ni bdag cag la nyin par ni zang zing gis tshim par byas so //
translated: The king has satisfied us with material things during the day,🔽and at night I will satisfy them with the Dharma.

original: mtshan mo ni bdag gis kyang chos kyis tshim par bya'o zhes bya bas des ji ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i khyad par thob pa de ltar snyan pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: mtshan mo ni bdag gis kyang chos kyis tshim par bya'o zhes bya bas des ji ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i khyad par thob pa de ltar snyan pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: Thus, he taught the Dharma in such a way that they obtained various kinds of distinctions.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This was stated with reference to him.

original: ngag bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni kha yang dag par sdom pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: ngag bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni kha yang dag par sdom pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: “ Restrained in speech” means “restrained in mouth,”

original: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽dge slong zhes bya ba ni lung @169a * //
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro // dge slong zhes bya ba ni lung @169a * //
translated: because he has abandoned all verbal misconduct.

original: slob cing slong ba ste /
analyzed: slob cing slong ba ste /
translated: “ Bhikṣu” means “one who is begged for alms”🔽and “one who is instructed in the scriptures.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang nyan thos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang nyan thos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Blessed One also said, “They are called śrāvakas because they listen.”

original: gang gi phyir de ni ngag kyal pa spangs pa yang dag par bsdams pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni ngag kyal pa spangs pa yang dag par bsdams pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Because he has abandoned idle chatter, he is restrained in speech.

original: gzhan mu stegs can gyi tshig dag ni 'brel ba med pa'i tshig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can gyi tshig dag ni 'brel ba med pa'i tshig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words of others, i.e., the non-Buddhists, are not connected with the words of the Buddha.

original: dal bus smra zhing zhes bya ba ni nyung du smra ba yin te /
analyzed: dal bus smra zhing zhes bya ba ni nyung du smra ba yin te /
translated: He speaks slowly, i.e., he speaks little.

original: don dang ldan zhing dgos pa'i tshig tsam brjod pa'i phyir dal bus smra ba'o //
analyzed: don dang ldan zhing dgos pa'i tshig tsam brjod pa'i phyir dal bus smra ba'o //
translated: He speaks slowly because he speaks only the words that are meaningful and necessary.

original: de lta bu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is he like?

original: smras pa / rlom pa med ces bya ba ste nye bar zhi zhing mi brtan pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rlom pa med ces bya ba ste nye bar zhi zhing mi brtan pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: he is free from conceit, because he is tranquil and has abandoned instability.

original: gang zhig chos ldan don ston pa //🔽zhes bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig chos ldan don ston pa // zhes bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He teaches the Dharma that is meaningful

original: dus dang mtshams dag tu chos kyi don gyi tshig tshul bzhin du ston pa kha ton la sogs pa'i dus su yang don dang ldan pa'i chos phyin ci log par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dus dang mtshams dag tu chos kyi don gyi tshig tshul bzhin du ston pa kha ton la sogs pa'i dus su yang don dang ldan pa'i chos phyin ci log par ston pa yin no //
translated: He who has the above-mentioned qualities teaches the Dharma that is meaningful and has a purpose at the proper time and occasion. He teaches the words of the Dharma correctly, even at the time of recitation, and he teaches the Dharma that is meaningful and not erroneous.

original: yang na do ni thar pa don thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na do ni thar pa don thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the Dharma is the supreme goal of all, because it is the highest of all goals.

original: chos ni de thob pa'i lam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni de thob pa'i lam la sogs pa'o //
translated: Dharma is the path to attaining that.

original: de ni snyan par smra ba yin //
analyzed: de ni snyan par smra ba yin //
translated: He is a good speaker.

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid bdag nyid chen pos bshad pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid bdag nyid chen pos bshad pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is the statement of the great being himself.

original: yid du 'ong ba dang skyon med pas sbrang rtsi bzhin du chags par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang skyon med pas sbrang rtsi bzhin du chags par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is honey-like, causing attachment through its sweetness and faultlessness.

original: snyan cing rna ba'i dbang po tshim par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snyan cing rna ba'i dbang po tshim par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is pleasing and satisfying to the ear, this is the meaning.

original: de bas na legs par gsungs pa ni rab tu bsngags pa yin pas legs par smra ba mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na legs par gsungs pa ni rab tu bsngags pa yin pas legs par smra ba mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, since good speech is highly praised, it is said to be the best, and so on.

original: tshig rkang bzhi pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs khyed la bshad par bya bas //
analyzed: tshig rkang bzhi pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs khyed la bshad par bya bas //
translated: I will explain to you the Dharma discourse in four lines.

original: de nyon cig ces pa nas ji srid du 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyon cig ces pa nas ji srid du 'di gsungs so //
translated: Listen to that, and so on up to he spoke this.

original: tha dad pa rnams mtshams sbyar nas smras pa ni legs par smras pa'am legs par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa rnams mtshams sbyar nas smras pa ni legs par smras pa'am legs par gsungs pa ste /
translated: Speaking with connected different words is good speech or good explanation.

original: gang gis tha dad pa sbyar bar byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni kho na nyid de legs par smras pa de nyid mtshams sbyar ba de bzhin du'o //🔽mchog gam gtso bo ni tha dad pa med par byed pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: gang gis tha dad pa sbyar bar byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni kho na nyid de legs par smras pa de nyid mtshams sbyar ba de bzhin du'o // mchog gam gtso bo ni tha dad pa med par byed pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The word only is used to exclude the application of the other two kinds of speech.🔽The word best or chief is used to exclude the application of the other two kinds of speech.

original: mtshams byed par gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams byed par gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word chief is used because it is the most important, since it is the basis for the other two kinds of speech.

original: 'phags pas gsungs pa ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pas gsungs pa ni ston pa'o //
translated: The word taught is used because it is the speech of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa ni sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos te /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos te /
translated: The word noble refers to the Buddhas and the disciples of the Buddhas.

original: 'di ni chos kyi tshig dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi tshig dang po'o //
translated: This is the first word about the Dharma.

original: snyan smra mi snyan ma yin de gnyis pa //
analyzed: snyan smra mi snyan ma yin de gnyis pa //
translated: The second word is pleasant, not unpleasant.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jam par smra zhing dga' ba bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jam par smra zhing dga' ba bskyed pa ste /
translated: The word pleasant is used because it is gentle speech that gives rise to joy.

original: mi rtsub pa 'di ni chos kyi tshig gnyis pa yin no //🔽bden smra brdzun pa ma yin de gsum @169b pa ;
analyzed: mi rtsub pa 'di ni chos kyi tshig gnyis pa yin no // bden smra brdzun pa ma yin de gsum @169b pa ;
translated: This is the second word about the Dharma.🔽The third word is true, not false.

original: / zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par smra zhing nam yang brdzun gyi tshig mi smra ba 'di ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par smra zhing nam yang brdzun gyi tshig mi smra ba 'di ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The word true is used because it is speech that is not distorted and never utters falsehoods. This is the third word.

original: chos smra phal ba ma yin bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: chos smra phal ba ma yin bzhi pa'o //
translated: He is not an ordinary Dharma teacher, the fourth.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir rigs pa'i don bzhin du smra ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir rigs pa'i don bzhin du smra ba'o //
translated: Here, he speaks in accordance with the meaning of reason.

original: phal pa ste ma 'brel ba'i tshig ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phal pa ste ma 'brel ba'i tshig ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is not an ordinary person, that is, one whose words are not connected.

original: yang na legs par smra ba ni bsngags pa'i tshig legs par gsungs pa la brjod do //
analyzed: yang na legs par smra ba ni bsngags pa'i tshig legs par gsungs pa la brjod do //
translated: Or else, he speaks well, that is, he speaks with words of praise.

original: de yang tshul gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang tshul gsum ste /
translated: And that is threefold:

original: yid du 'ong ba dang phyin ci ma log pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang phyin ci ma log pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: pleasing, non-erroneous, and helpful.

original: de go rims bzhin du snyan smra mi snyan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de go rims bzhin du snyan smra mi snyan ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: These are indicated respectively by the words pleasant, not unpleasant, etc.

original: snyan par smra bas ni mchog tu dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: snyan par smra bas ni mchog tu dga' bar byed do //
translated: By pleasant speech, he delights them.

original: bden par smra bas ni tshul khrims rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: bden par smra bas ni tshul khrims rdzogs par byed do //
translated: By truthful speech, he perfects their morality.

original: ci khyod ni tshul khrims nyams sam ma nyams zhes dris pa na bdag gis ji lta ba bzhin du rjod par byed cing ngo tsha bas tshul khrims sam 'chal bar mi byed do //
analyzed: ci khyod ni tshul khrims nyams sam ma nyams zhes dris pa na bdag gis ji lta ba bzhin du rjod par byed cing ngo tsha bas tshul khrims sam 'chal bar mi byed do //
translated: When asked, “Have you or have you not violated morality? ” he replies truthfully, and out of shame he does not violate morality or pretend to have done so.

original: 'chal par gyur kyang ji lta ba bzhin du sbyangs pas yang yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chal par gyur kyang ji lta ba bzhin du sbyangs pas yang yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one is corrupt, one can become pure again by training in the right way.

original: chos smras pas ni gzhan mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la 'jog par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos smras pas ni gzhan mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la 'jog par byed pa yin te /
translated: The Dharma teacher turns others away from nonvirtue and establishes them in virtue.

original: de'i phyir snyan par smra ba la ni brdzun pa dang chos ma yin pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir snyan par smra ba la ni brdzun pa dang chos ma yin pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the pleasant speech of the Dharma teacher is free of lies and of what is contrary to the Dharma.

original: phal pa dag la ni mi bden par smra ba la sogs pa yod do zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: phal pa dag la ni mi bden par smra ba la sogs pa yod do zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: But ordinary people do have lies and so on.

original: 'brel ba med pa'i ngag kyal ba la chags pa rnams legs par bshad pa rnams nyan pa la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: 'brel ba med pa'i ngag kyal ba la chags pa rnams legs par bshad pa rnams nyan pa la gzud pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This verse was spoken in order to induce those who are attached to idle chitchat that is unrelated to the Dharma to listen to the good explanations.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de nyid rnam par dbye ba'i phyir smras pa //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de nyid rnam par dbye ba'i phyir smras pa //
translated: In order to analyze that verse, he says:

original: tshig de rnams ni smra bya zhing //
analyzed: tshig de rnams ni smra bya zhing //
translated: Those words should be spoken

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das tshig rkang bzhi pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs ston pa de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa ngag dbang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das tshig rkang bzhi pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs ston pa de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa ngag dbang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When the Lord was teaching the Dharma in the form of four-line verses, the venerable Ananda thought:🔽I will praise this Dharma in the form of four-line verses.

original: gang bdag gis tshig rkang bzhi pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mngon par bstod par bgyi'o zhes rgya cher zhus pa dang / gnang ba thob pa ste des 'di dag smras so //🔽tshig de rnams ni smra bya zhing //
analyzed: gang bdag gis tshig rkang bzhi pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mngon par bstod par bgyi'o zhes rgya cher zhus pa dang / gnang ba thob pa ste des 'di dag smras so // tshig de rnams ni smra bya zhing //
translated: He asked in detail, and having obtained permission, he said:🔽Those words should be spoken

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig de nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig de nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: means that those very words should be expressed.

original: gang gis bdag kyang mi gdung la //
analyzed: gang gis bdag kyang mi gdung la //
translated: By which one does not torment oneself

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig gis bdag nyid la tshe 'dir grags pa ma yin pa dang // pha rol du sdug bsngal bas gdung bar mi byed cing mi sreg pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig gis bdag nyid la tshe 'dir grags pa ma yin pa dang // pha rol du sdug bsngal bas gdung bar mi byed cing mi sreg pa'o //
translated: means that one should not torment oneself in this life with infamy, and in the next life with suffering.

original: pha rol la yang gnod med pa'i //
analyzed: pha rol la yang gnod med pa'i //
translated: And which does not torment others

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: means

original: gnod pa ni lus dang ngag gis gzhan la gnod pa mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnod pa ni lus dang ngag gis gzhan la gnod pa mi bya ba ste /
translated: torment is not harming others with body and speech.

original: tha dad par mi bya zhing mi @170a * //
analyzed: tha dad par mi bya zhing mi @170a * //
translated: One should not make them different,

original: dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbye bar bya'o //
translated: but should not make distinctions.

original: tshig de legs par smra bar bya //
analyzed: tshig de legs par smra bar bya //
translated: One should speak those words well.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: tshe de nyid la legs par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la legs par smra ba yin no //
translated: speaking well in that very life.

original: tshig rkang dang po'i bstod pa byas nas /
analyzed: tshig rkang dang po'i bstod pa byas nas /
translated: Having praised the first line,

original: gnyis pa bstod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis pa bstod pa'i phyir /
translated: for the sake of praising the second,

original: gang gis mngon par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: gang gis snyan par smra bas dga' bar 'gyur ba de ni mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba ste /

original: snyan par smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba zhes bya'o //

original: des na de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: des na de nyid smras pa /

analyzed: 'di mnyan pas dga' zhing rangs pa skye bar 'gyur pa'o //

analyzed: yang na tshig rkang snga mas ni don snyan par bstan to //

translated: by this, the pleasant words are taught.

translated: The phrase

analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa smra ba ni bdud rtsi'i tshig tu bshad de /
translated: Speaking the truth is explained as the nectar of speech.

analyzed: de la gnas pas na mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: Since one abides in that, one attains nirvana.

analyzed: gang gi phyir bden pa nyid ni ro shin tu bsod pa yin no zhes lung las 'byung ste /

analyzed: des mkhas pa rnams tshim pa'i khyad par dang nyams brtas par 'gyur ba'i phyir lha rnams kyi bdud rtsi bzhin no //
translated: Since it satisfies the wise and increases their strength, it is like the nectar of the gods.

original: bden pa'i tshig ni bla med yin //
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig ni bla med yin //
translated: The words of truth are supreme.

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad las khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad las khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: This is because they are superior to all,

original: don thams cad las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don thams cad las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are superior to all meanings.

original: yang na tshig ni gtsug gi nor bur gyur pa'i phyir me tog gi phreng ba shin tu yid du 'ong ba rab tu gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
analyzed: yang na tshig ni gtsug gi nor bur gyur pa'i phyir me tog gi phreng ba shin tu yid du 'ong ba rab tu gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
translated: Or, the words are like a very beautiful garland of flowers, because they are like a crest jewel.

original: legs par pha rol tu phyin pa'i skyes pa'i rabs @170b la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par pha rol tu phyin pa'i skyes pa'i rabs @170b la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should tell the stories of the perfections, the Jataka tales, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir bla na med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bla na med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it unsurpassed?

original: 'dir rgyu smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu smras pa /
translated: Here the reason is stated:

original: bden pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Truthful is stated.

original: gang gi phyir bden pa'i tshig ni don la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bden pa'i tshig ni don la rab tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: Because the word of truth is well-established in fact,

original: de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes dam pa rnams brjod de /
analyzed: de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes dam pa rnams brjod de /
translated: it arises from that, so the holy ones say.

original: 'jig rten 'di'i dgos pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i dgos pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it fulfills the needs of this world.

original: chos la yang rab tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: chos la yang rab tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: And it is well-established in the Dharma,

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi dgos pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi dgos pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it fulfills the needs of the next world.

original: yang na don la gnas pa ni 'jig rten pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: yang na don la gnas pa ni 'jig rten pa'i phan yon no //
translated: Or, being established in fact is the benefit in this world,

original: chos la gnas pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phan yon no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos la gnas pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phan yon no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and being established in the Dharma is the benefit in the next world, and so on.

original: dam pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid reg pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid reg pa ste /
translated: It is the touch of the reality of holy things,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang ; de'i gzhung la spyod pa'i nyan thos dag go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang ; de'i gzhung la spyod pa'i nyan thos dag go //
translated: of omniscience and the sravakas who practice its scriptures.

original: gsungs pa ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this is as follows.

original: tshig rkang bzhi pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: tshig rkang bzhi pa las brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the fourth verse:

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni gsungs tshig gang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni gsungs tshig gang //
translated: Whatever words the Buddha has spoken

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du thugs rje chen pos gzhan gyi don la brtson pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du thugs rje chen pos gzhan gyi don la brtson pa ste /
translated: He is the Omniscient One, who is intent on the welfare of others through great compassion.

original: tshul khrims kyis mtshon pa sems pa khyad par can sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis mtshon pa sems pa khyad par can sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Buddha is the special volition characterized by morality.

original: gang cung zad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: gang cung zad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: Whatever the Lord Buddha has spoken is the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji lta bus gsungs she na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ji lta bus gsungs she na /
translated: In what way has the Lord Buddha spoken?

original: smras pa / bden pa ste 'jigs pa med pa mngon par mtho ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / bden pa ste 'jigs pa med pa mngon par mtho ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: the truth, because it is the cause of the higher realms, which are free from fear.

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba ni thar pa thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba ni thar pa thob par byed pa ste /
translated: It leads to nirvana, because it causes the attainment of liberation.

original: nges par legs pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: nges par legs pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It is the attainment of the highest good, because it is the cause of the highest good.

original: dngos po'i skyon med pas 'dir bsam pa'i skyon yang nam yang med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i skyon med pas 'dir bsam pa'i skyon yang nam yang med do //
translated: Since it is free from the faults of things, it is also free from the faults of thought.

original: bsam pa'i skyon med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don du gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i tshig de'i don nyid sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsam pa'i skyon med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don du gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i tshig de'i don nyid sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of the absence of faults in his thought, the meaning of the words spoken by the Lord for the sake of others is stated: “in order to abandon all suffering.”

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //🔽tshig de bla na med pa yin //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro // tshig de bla na med pa yin //
translated: Because all the suffering of all sentient beings is completely pacified.🔽That word is unsurpassed.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig de nyid zla med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig de nyid zla med pa'o //
translated: That very word is without equal.

original: tshig gi tshoms te brgyad pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: tshig gi tshoms te brgyad pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the eighth chapter is completed.

original: // / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i tshoms gsum bstan pa las phal cher las kyi tshul gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i tshoms gsum bstan pa las phal cher las kyi tshul gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The three chapters on morality, etc., were taught for the most part to clarify the method of karma.

original: de'i 'og tu las kyi tshoms bstan to //🔽yang na bstan ma thag pa'i tshoms des ni bden pa la sogs pa'i tshig bstan pa yin la 'dis ni /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu las kyi tshoms bstan to // yang na bstan ma thag pa'i tshoms des ni bden pa la sogs pa'i tshig bstan pa yin la 'dis ni /
translated: Therefore, the chapter on karma is taught immediately after them.

original: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i tshig brjod @171a * //🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i tshig brjod @171a * //🔽pa yin no //
translated: Or, the immediately preceding chapter taught the words of truth, etc., and this chapter expresses the words of lying, etc.

original: yang na tshig las ches khyad par du gyur pa'i las nyid bstan pa'i phyir te gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i stobs kyis sems can rnams 'khor ba las 'don pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na tshig las ches khyad par du gyur pa'i las nyid bstan pa'i phyir te gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i stobs kyis sems can rnams 'khor ba las 'don pa yin la /
translated: Or else, it is taught in order to show that action is superior to words, because sentient beings are liberated from cyclic existence by the power of the Buddha's teaching.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni las ches khyad par du gyur pa yin pas de'i rnam par 'grel ba brtsam par 'dod nas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni las ches khyad par du gyur pa yin pas de'i rnam par 'grel ba brtsam par 'dod nas smras pa /
translated: Therefore, since this is a very special action, wishing to comment on it, he says:

original: chos gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: One dharma... and so on.

original: rgyal po'i khab kyi dka' thub 'byin pa'i kun dga' ra ba na tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan 'dzin gnas te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab kyi dka' thub 'byin pa'i kun dga' ra ba na tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan 'dzin gnas te /
translated: In the pleasure grove of the Rsipatana in Rajagriha, the venerable Rahula was staying.

original: de gdul pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das der gshegs so //
analyzed: de gdul pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das der gshegs so //
translated: The Blessed One went there for the purpose of taming him.

original: des kyang thag ring po nas bcom ldan 'das der gshegs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: des kyang thag ring po nas bcom ldan 'das der gshegs pa mthong ste /
translated: He saw the Blessed One coming from afar,

original: gdan bshams shing zhabs bkru ba dang zhabs rten yang phyogs gcig tu gzhag ste /
analyzed: gdan bshams shing zhabs bkru ba dang zhabs rten yang phyogs gcig tu gzhag ste /
translated: prepared a seat, washed his feet, and placed a footstool.

original: mdun bsu nas chos gos dang lhung bzed khyer ro //
analyzed: mdun bsu nas chos gos dang lhung bzed khyer ro //
translated: He met him and took his robes and bowl.

original: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis zhabs bsil te chu snod kyi nang du chu cung zad lhag pa gzhag nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis zhabs bsil te chu snod kyi nang du chu cung zad lhag pa gzhag nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One himself washed his feet, and left a little water in the water vessel.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan 'dzin la chu cung zad tsam 'di ma thong ngam zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan 'dzin la chu cung zad tsam 'di ma thong ngam zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: He said to the venerable Rāhula, Rāhula, is there a little water left in this?

original: bcun pa de bzhin no zhes gsol to //
analyzed: bcun pa de bzhin no zhes gsol to //
translated: He said, Yes, Venerable One, there is a little water left.

original: de ltar cung zad tsam de bzhin du ngas sgra gcan 'dzin khyod la skyes bu gti mug can gyi dge sbyong gi chos smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar cung zad tsam de bzhin du ngas sgra gcan 'dzin khyod la skyes bu gti mug can gyi dge sbyong gi chos smra bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I will tell you, Rāhula, that a foolish person's qualities of a monk are discarded.

original: gang la la zhig shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / 'dzem pa med pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa de yang bor ba nas de bzhin du 'di la g-yon can dge sbyong gi chos so zhes nga smra'o zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: gang la la zhig shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / 'dzem pa med pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa de yang bor ba nas de bzhin du 'di la g-yon can dge sbyong gi chos so zhes nga smra'o zhes bya ba dang /
translated: One who knowingly speaks falsely, who is shameless, who is irreproachable, and who has no remorse, I say that such a person's qualities of a monk are discarded. In the same way, I say that a deceitful person's qualities of a monk are discarded.

original: ha sti shu na da tya ga'i dper brjod pas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: ha sti shu na da tya ga'i dper brjod pas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: And he gave the example of Hastīśūnya, and spoke two verses.

original: chos gcig ni gtso bor gyur pa'i don te /
analyzed: chos gcig ni gtso bor gyur pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of one quality is the foremost.

original: gcig gi sgra ni mchog gi tsheg yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi sgra ni mchog gi tsheg yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “one” is the supreme particle.

original: chos kyi sgra ni yang don gyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos kyi sgra ni yang don gyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term “dharma” is a synonym for “object.”

original: grong 'di na ni rgyal gyi grogs po gnas so zhes gtso bor shes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: grong 'di na ni rgyal gyi grogs po gnas so zhes gtso bor shes pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, when it is said, “The king’s friend lives in this village,” the king is understood to be the principal one.

original: des na bden pa'i tshig ni 'dir chos so //
analyzed: des na bden pa'i tshig ni 'dir chos so //
translated: Thus, the word “truth” is used here in the sense of “dharma.”

original: 'dzin par byed pa yin pas chen po'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa yin pas chen po'o //
translated: It is “great” because it is the cause of grasping.

original: gcig kyang yin la chos kyang yin pas chos gcig ces bsdu ba byas so //
analyzed: gcig kyang yin la chos kyang yin pas chos gcig ces bsdu ba byas so //
translated: It is “one” because it is one, and it is “dharma” because it is a dharma.🔽The compound is resolved as “one dharma.”

original: de las 'das pa ni thal ba ste /
analyzed: de las 'das pa ni thal ba ste /
translated: “To transgress” means to go beyond.

original: bden pa zhes bya ba bor ba dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba bor ba dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'o //
translated: “Truth” means a person who is endowed with the abandonment of lying.

original: 'di ji lta bu yin zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ji lta bu yin zhe na smras pa /
translated: What is that like? It is said:

original: brdzun du smra ba'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Lying” means to speak falsely.

original: brdzun pa ni phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: brdzun pa ni phyin ci log ste /
translated: False means inverted.

original: @171b smra ba ni tshig go //
analyzed: @171b smra ba ni tshig go //
translated: To speak means to utter words.

original: gang zhig rtag tu brdzun smra ba de nyid ni skye bo dam pas ma bsngags pa bden pa'i chos las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig rtag tu brdzun smra ba de nyid ni skye bo dam pas ma bsngags pa bden pa'i chos las 'das pa ste /
translated: One who always speaks falsely is not praised by holy people. He transgresses the dharma of truth.

original: dper na dug ha la ha la nye bar longs spyod pa des srog 'phrog par byed pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na dug ha la ha la nye bar longs spyod pa des srog 'phrog par byed pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as one who partakes of the poison halahala loses his life.

original: lus can ni sems can no //
analyzed: lus can ni sems can no //
translated: Those who have bodies are sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten pha rol bcom ba zhes pa ni bde 'gro yongs su spangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol bcom ba zhes pa ni bde 'gro yongs su spangs pa ste /
translated: Those who have destroyed the next world are those who have completely abandoned the happy migratory states.

original: 'dir pha rol gyi sgra ni bsngags par byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol gyi sgra ni bsngags par byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Here, the word next is used in the sense of praise,

original: song nas bde ba sbyin pa ni chos so zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: song nas bde ba sbyin pa ni chos so zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: because the word dharma means that which supports one by going there and giving happiness.

original: de spangs pas ni de'i 'bras bu spong ba'o //
analyzed: de spangs pas ni de'i 'bras bu spong ba'o //
translated: By abandoning that, one abandons its result.

original: sdig pa mi bya ci yang med //
analyzed: sdig pa mi bya ci yang med //
translated: There is nothing at all that is not to be done by the sinful.

original: ces bya ba ni des bden pa spangs shing brdzun du smra ba yongs su gzung bas sdig pa bsags te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni des bden pa spangs shing brdzun du smra ba yongs su gzung bas sdig pa bsags te /
translated: Thus, by abandoning the truth and embracing lying, one accumulates sin.

original: rim gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rgyun gcod par byed pa de ni sngar bshad pa'i sems can gyis ni mi bya ba dang / ngan par spyod pa mi byed pa ci yang med pa'o //
analyzed: rim gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rgyun gcod par byed pa de ni sngar bshad pa'i sems can gyis ni mi bya ba dang / ngan par spyod pa mi byed pa ci yang med pa'o //
translated: In due course, one severs the roots of virtue. For such a person, there is nothing at all that is not to be done, nothing that is not evil conduct.

original: des na yang de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: des na yang de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: lcags gong zos pa ches bla yi //
analyzed: lcags gong zos pa ches bla yi //
translated: it is better to eat a red-hot iron ball,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: lcags kyi gang bu'am lcags kyi gong po mid pa ni rung ngo zhes ba'o //
analyzed: lcags kyi gang bu'am lcags kyi gong po mid pa ni rung ngo zhes ba'o //
translated: It is proper to swallow a red-hot iron ball or a lump of iron.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: bsreg pa ste mes bsregs pa'o //
analyzed: bsreg pa ste mes bsregs pa'o //
translated: It is burning, since it is burned by fire.

original: me lce 'bar 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni me 'bar ba dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: me lce 'bar 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni me 'bar ba dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is like a blazing flame, since it is similar to a blazing fire.

original: mes sreg cing 'bar ba dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mes sreg cing 'bar ba dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: It is equal to being burned by fire.

original: bzar mi rung zhes bya ba ni gang zhig zos shing mid pa'o //
analyzed: bzar mi rung zhes bya ba ni gang zhig zos shing mid pa'o //
translated: It is not proper to eat, since it is eaten and swallowed.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is the point.

original: gang yang lcags kyi thu lum bsregs shing me lce 'bar ba lta bu za ba dang / gang yang tshul khrims 'chal pa yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms za bar byed pa 'di gnyis las ni lcags kyi thu lum za ba de ni bla'i /
analyzed: gang yang lcags kyi thu lum bsregs shing me lce 'bar ba lta bu za ba dang / gang yang tshul khrims 'chal pa yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms za bar byed pa 'di gnyis las ni lcags kyi thu lum za ba de ni bla'i /
translated: It is better to eat a red-hot iron ball and a lump of iron, since it is like a blazing flame, than to eat the alms of a country that a degenerate person eats.

original: cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: The latter is not.🔽As it is said in the Vyakhyayukti:

original: ji skad du rnam par smra bar byed pa las dmigs pa ni chos mchog yin gyi /
analyzed: ji skad du rnam par smra bar byed pa las dmigs pa ni chos mchog yin gyi /
translated: The object is the supreme Dharma,

original: gang yang mi dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang mi dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the case that anything that is not an object is not.

original: chos thams cad la bdag med pa'i rnam pa la gang dmigs pa dang / gang yang mi dmigs pa de gnyis las dmigs pa nyid ches mchog yin no zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la bdag med pa'i rnam pa la gang dmigs pa dang / gang yang mi dmigs pa de gnyis las dmigs pa nyid ches mchog yin no zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that the object of the aspect of selflessness of all things is superior to the non-apprehension of anything.

original: de bzhin du bstan pa 'di yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan pa 'di yang shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way as the above explanation.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims nyams pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims nyams pa ste /
translated: Morally degenerate means one who has violated morality,

original: brdzun smra ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brdzun smra ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of one who tells lies, etc.

original: yul 'khor bsod snyoms zhes bya ba ni grong la sogs pa las rnyed pa'i bsod snyoms te /🔽gus pa sngon du btang bas dge slong la byin pa'i @172a * //
analyzed: yul 'khor bsod snyoms zhes bya ba ni grong la sogs pa las rnyed pa'i bsod snyoms te / gus pa sngon du btang bas dge slong la byin pa'i @172a * //
translated: The alms of the country means the alms obtained from the village, etc.

original: zas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is food given to a monk with respect.

original: mi sdom pas zhes bya ba ni dbang po sdom pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi sdom pas zhes bya ba ni dbang po sdom pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of lack of restraint, because of not possessing restraint of the sense faculties,

original: gang tshul khrims dang ldan yang dbang po ma dul ba des bsod snyoms nye bar longs spyod pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang tshul khrims dang ldan yang dbang po ma dul ba des bsod snyoms nye bar longs spyod pa mi rigs so //
translated: it is not right for one who is morally disciplined but has undisciplined faculties to enjoy alms.

original: yang na dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par mi brtson pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par mi brtson pa ste /
translated: Or else, he does not strive for the side of virtue.

original: le lo can gyis nye bar blangs pa'i 'tsho ba ni bu lon du spyod pa yin no zhes lung las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: le lo can gyis nye bar blangs pa'i 'tsho ba ni bu lon du spyod pa yin no zhes lung las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The life that is taken up by the lazy is like a debt, as is stated in the scriptures.

original: 'di ni shin tu bsdams pa yin no zhes de la dad pas bsod snyoms la sogs pa 'bul bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu bsdams pa yin no zhes de la dad pas bsod snyoms la sogs pa 'bul bar 'gyur te /
translated: This one is very restrained, and so, with faith in him, one offers alms-food, etc.

original: de ni nang na shin tu ma rungs pa yin na de thams cad ni bu lon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni nang na shin tu ma rungs pa yin na de thams cad ni bu lon du 'gyur ro //
translated: But he is the most wicked of all, and all of that becomes a debt.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i nyes dmigs bstod pas de las bzlog pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i nyes dmigs bstod pas de las bzlog pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: The disadvantages of lying are stated in order to turn one away from it.

original: sdig pas 'jigs pa rnams la 'di lta bu'i sdig pa mi bya'o zhes 'dir bstan pa'i phyir khyod ni sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sdig pas 'jigs pa rnams la 'di lta bu'i sdig pa mi bya'o zhes 'dir bstan pa'i phyir khyod ni sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to show that one should not commit such evil deeds out of fear of evil, he says, “You are afraid of suffering,” etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci ra ba tya zhes bya ba'i chu klung rgyu zhing gshegs pa las nye ba rgan po zhig gis nya rgyas nya mang po bzung zhing phyung ba gzigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci ra ba tya zhes bya ba'i chu klung rgyu zhing gshegs pa las nye ba rgan po zhig gis nya rgyas nya mang po bzung zhing phyung ba gzigs te /
translated: The Blessed One was traveling along the river Nairañjanā and saw an old man catching many fish with a net.

original: ci rigs kyi bu khyod gang la las 'jigs pa yod ces bka' stsal pa dang / kye goo ta ma sdug bsngal las 'jigs pa mchis so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: ci rigs kyi bu khyod gang la las 'jigs pa yod ces bka' stsal pa dang / kye goo ta ma sdug bsngal las 'jigs pa mchis so zhes gsol to //
translated: He asked, “Son of a good family, what are you afraid of?” He replied, “Gautama, I am afraid of suffering.”

original: de lta na gzhan dag la sdug bsngal ma bskyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na gzhan dag la sdug bsngal ma bskyed cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Well then, don’t cause suffering to others. Why is that?🔽There is no one who, when suffering is done to them, will become happy.”

original: gang gis sdug bsngal byas na bde bar 'gyur ba ni med do zhes pa nas ji srid du tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis sdug bsngal byas na bde bar 'gyur ba ni med do zhes pa nas ji srid du tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Then, two verses were spoken.

original: gzhan dag ni sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa kun du rgyu zhig gis 'di skad ces /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa kun du rgyu zhig gis 'di skad ces /
translated: Another man, who was wandering about afraid of suffering, said this:

original: kye goo ta ma bdag 'dir sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs par gyur na /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma bdag 'dir sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs par gyur na /
translated: “Gautama, I am afraid of suffering here.

original: de thabs gang gis bdag gi sdug bsngal med par 'gyur zhes gsol pa dang // de nyid kyi phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de thabs gang gis bdag gi sdug bsngal med par 'gyur zhes gsol pa dang // de nyid kyi phyir 'di gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is for this very reason that this is stated.

original: khyod ni zhes bya ba ni gal te'o //
analyzed: khyod ni zhes bya ba ni gal te'o //
translated: If you, means if you are.

original: 'jigs pa ni skrag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni skrag pa'o //
translated: Fear means terror.

original: sdug bsngal gyis zhes bya ba ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal las zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis zhes bya ba ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal las zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
translated: Suffering is a remainder of the phrase from the suffering of the lower realms.

original: gsum pa'i gnas su lnga pa gzhag pas na sdug bsngal las zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽khyod la zhes bya ba ni gal te khyod la sdug bsngal mi sdug pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa'i gnas su lnga pa gzhag pas na sdug bsngal las zhes bya ba'i don to // khyod la zhes bya ba ni gal te khyod la sdug bsngal mi sdug pa ste /
translated: By placing the fifth in the third place, it means from suffering.

original: bde 'gro'i sdug bsngal lam 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal mi 'dod pa yin na ste /
analyzed: bde 'gro'i sdug bsngal lam 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal mi 'dod pa yin na ste /
translated: If you do not desire suffering, means if you do not desire the suffering of the higher realms or the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: ngan song gi sdug bsngal ni sngar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song gi sdug bsngal ni sngar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The suffering of the lower realms was explained earlier.

original: gang gi phyir yang @172b des nye bar gdung ba yin pa'i phyir mngon par mi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang @172b des nye bar gdung ba yin pa'i phyir mngon par mi 'dod pa ste /
translated: Because it is also tormenting, it is not desired.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal las 'jigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal las 'jigs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, after that, one is afraid of suffering because of being directed toward birth.

original: bdag sdug bsngal bar nam yang ma gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag sdug bsngal bar nam yang ma gyur cig pa'o //
translated: One should think, May I never become suffering!

original: der ltung ba yongs su spang ba'i sman bsten pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: der ltung ba yongs su spang ba'i sman bsten pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the method of applying the medicine of avoiding falling into that, it is said:

original: me bya zhes pa ste nam yang ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: me bya zhes pa ste nam yang ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: One should never do what is to be done by fire.

original: sdig pa can gyi las zhes bya ba ni ngan par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi las zhes bya ba ni ngan par spyod pa'o //
translated: The so-called sinful action is bad conduct.

original: mngon sum ni skye bo thams cad kyis mngon sum du gsal bar ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni skye bo thams cad kyis mngon sum du gsal bar ro //
translated: In public means in the presence of all people.

original: lkog tu'ang rung zhes bya ba ni yang na skye bos dben pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: lkog tu'ang rung zhes bya ba ni yang na skye bos dben pa'i phyogs te /
translated: Also in private means in a place devoid of people.

original: phag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means in secret.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ma mthong lkog tu'ang mi bya ste //🔽las de 'phags pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma mthong lkog tu'ang mi bya ste // las de 'phags pas mi bya'o //
translated: One should not do it even in secret.

original: zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The noble one does not do that action.

original: gal te sdig pa'i las byas sam //
analyzed: gal te sdig pa'i las byas sam //
translated: If one has done a sinful action,

original: byed kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gal te yang khyod mi shes pas /
analyzed: byed kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gal te yang khyod mi shes pas /
translated: or if one is doing it,

original: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs nyes par spyod dam nga nyid da ltar 'dug bzhin du mdun du khyod kyis byas na des na khyod ni /
analyzed: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs nyes par spyod dam nga nyid da ltar 'dug bzhin du mdun du khyod kyis byas na des na khyod ni /
translated: If you commit them in my presence,

original: sdug bsngal las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: you will not be liberated from suffering.

original: lus dang sems gdung pa las so //
analyzed: lus dang sems gdung pa las so //
translated: Suffering is the torment of body and mind.

original: thar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: thar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Liberation is the escape from that.

original: ci zhig byas na thar par mi 'gyur zhe na /🔽smras pa / kog ces langs te bros byas kyang //
analyzed: ci zhig byas na thar par mi 'gyur zhe na / smras pa / kog ces langs te bros byas kyang //
translated: What is done that does not lead to liberation?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said:🔽Even if you flee and escape,🔽you will not be liberated from suffering.

original: rang gi yul lam rgya mtsho la sogs pa las rgal zhing 'das par byas pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi yul lam rgya mtsho la sogs pa las rgal zhing 'das par byas pa'am /
translated: Even if you flee and escape to your own country or the ocean and so on,🔽or go a very long distance,

original: yul thag shin tu ring bor song bar gyur kyang ste ji skad du /
analyzed: yul thag shin tu ring bor song bar gyur kyang ste ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: sdig can bdag nyid gar 'gro ba //
analyzed: sdig can bdag nyid gar 'gro ba //
translated: Wherever the sinful go,

original: sdug bsngal nyid ni der 'gro ste //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid ni der 'gro ste //
translated: suffering goes there too.

original: gang dang gang du me gnas pa //
analyzed: gang dang gang du me gnas pa //
translated: Wherever fire abides,

original: de nyid na ni bsreg par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid na ni bsreg par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there it burns.

original: bar snang la sogs par bros na de las thar par 'gyur ro zhes bden par smra ba gcad pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bar snang la sogs par bros na de las thar par 'gyur ro zhes bden par smra ba gcad pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to cut off the claim that one can escape death by fleeing to the sky, etc., it is said:

original: gang du gnas na 'chi bas mi tshugs pa //
analyzed: gang du gnas na 'chi bas mi tshugs pa //
translated: Where can one stay that will not be overcome by death?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: etc.

original: 'dir gleng gzhi dang 'brel pa ni mi rtag pa'i tshoms su bshad de /
analyzed: 'dir gleng gzhi dang 'brel pa ni mi rtag pa'i tshoms su bshad de /
translated: Here, the connection with the nidana is explained in the Anityarata:

original: 'chi ba'i gnas su las nyi tshe brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnas su las nyi tshe brjod pa yin no //
translated: The place of death is said to be limited by karma.

original: las kyis zil gyis non par byed pas de bya bar mi rung ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: las kyis zil gyis non par byed pas de bya bar mi rung ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Since one is overwhelmed by karma, it is said that it is not suitable to act:

original: pha rol po la brtags nas gang //
analyzed: pha rol po la brtags nas gang //
translated: Having examined the other,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: etc.

original: rgyal po ma skyes dgras k'ara sh'a pa na'i bzhi cha brkus pa tsam dang / gzhan gyis bsgyur ba tsam gyis kyang gsod bar @173a * //
analyzed: rgyal po ma skyes dgras k'ara sh'a pa na'i bzhi cha brkus pa tsam dang / gzhan gyis bsgyur ba tsam gyis kyang gsod bar @173a * //
translated: King Ajatashatru killed just for stealing a quarter of a karashapana, and just for being a spy for another.

original: byed do // de re zhig cig na rkun ma dang byi bo byed pa dang / zhal che la g-yo byed pa mang po dag gsad pa'i phyir gshed ma pa'i lag tu gtad de /
analyzed: byed do // de re zhig cig na rkun ma dang byi bo byed pa dang / zhal che la g-yo byed pa mang po dag gsad pa'i phyir gshed ma pa'i lag tu gtad de /
translated: At one time, he handed over many thieves and adulterers and those who lied in court to the executioners in order to kill them.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: With reference to that, this is stated:

original: gang zhes bya ba dang / sdig pa can gyi las zhes bya ba 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba dang / sdig pa can gyi las zhes bya ba 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, “that” and “evil action” should be connected.

original: pha rol po la zhes bya ba ni rkun po dang byi po byed pa la sogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: pha rol po la zhes bya ba ni rkun po dang byi po byed pa la sogs pa dag la'o //
translated: “The other” refers to thieves, adulterers, and so on.

original: brtags nas zhes bya ba ni nye bar brtags pa dang / yongs su btsal ba ste /
analyzed: brtags nas zhes bya ba ni nye bar brtags pa dang / yongs su btsal ba ste /
translated: “Having examined” means having investigated and sought.

original: skyes bu gang gis sdig pa byas //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gis sdig pa byas //
translated: “The person who has done evil”

original: zhes so // sdig pa can zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad do //
analyzed: zhes so // sdig pa can zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad do //
translated: “Evil” will be explained below.

original: mthong ba ni 'jig rten nges par byas pa'o ;
analyzed: mthong ba ni 'jig rten nges par byas pa'o ;
translated: “Seeing” is the worldly certainty.

original: / sdig pa can zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis smad pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: / sdig pa can zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis smad pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: “Evil” is the result that is despised and unwanted by holy beings.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis so //
translated: “By me” means by myself.

original: de dag mi bya zhes bya ba ni sdig pa can gyi las mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag mi bya zhes bya ba ni sdig pa can gyi las mi bya ba'o //
translated: “Those should not be done” means evil actions should not be done.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because:

original: 'di ltar / sdig byas las ni rjes su 'brang //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar / sdig byas las ni rjes su 'brang //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Evil action is followed.

original: sdig pa byed pa yin no zhes skye bo rnams smod cing sdig pa can gyi skye bo ni tha ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa yin no zhes skye bo rnams smod cing sdig pa can gyi skye bo ni tha ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir /
translated: People will say, He is a sinner, and the sinful person is called the lowest.

original: rang gis byas pa'i sdig pa'i las de ni 'di dang pha rol tu rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i sdig pa'i las de ni 'di dang pha rol tu rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: That sinful action done by oneself follows one here and in the next world,

original: ji ltar bdag gis mig gis thams cad mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis mig gis thams cad mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: just as the eyes see everything.

original: sdig pa'i las kyi skyon bstan pas de 'gag pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las kyi skyon bstan pas de 'gag pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was said in order to show the fault of sinful action and to stop it.

original: gang yang las kyi zhags pas bcings par gyur na ni g-yang sar ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang las kyi zhags pas bcings par gyur na ni g-yang sar ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: And in order to show that one who is bound by the noose of action will fall into an abyss, he said:

original: las gang shin tu mi bzad dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las gang shin tu mi bzad dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Whatever action is extremely terrible... and so on.

original: de nas srang la g-yo byed pa'i tshong dpon zhig dang / 'thab mos 'tsho ba'i grong dpon zhig la bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas srang la g-yo byed pa'i tshong dpon zhig dang / 'thab mos 'tsho ba'i grong dpon zhig la bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to a merchant who was cheating on the scales and to a village chief who made his living by fighting:

original: 'di la zol byed pas gzhal blugs gcig tu 'tshos pa dang / log pa'i 'tsho bas 'tsho bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la zol byed pas gzhal blugs gcig tu 'tshos pa dang / log pa'i 'tsho bas 'tsho bar byed pa ste /
translated: Here, cheating means to cheat with a scale or a measure. Living by a wrong means of livelihood means to live by a wrong means of livelihood.

original: 'di lta ste khar ba'i srang la zol byed pa dang / gzhal blugs lag cig tu zol byed pa dang mchog tu gtum zhing mi bzad pa lag pa khrag gis spags pa ni ji srid du dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste khar ba'i srang la zol byed pa dang / gzhal blugs lag cig tu zol byed pa dang mchog tu gtum zhing mi bzad pa lag pa khrag gis spags pa ni ji srid du dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: For example, cheating with a scale or a measure, or with the hand, and with the most violent and unbearable hand smeared with blood. For as long as one is born in the hells - two verses are spoken from here.

original: gang zhes bya ba dang / mi'i zhes bya bar sbyar te sems can no //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba dang / mi'i zhes bya bar sbyar te sems can no //
translated: One should connect who with human and so on, and sentient being.

original: zol byed gzhal blugs 'chos pa dang // zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa'i @173b bre la sogs pa 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: zol byed gzhal blugs 'chos pa dang // zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa'i @173b bre la sogs pa 'chos pa'o //
translated: Cheating with a scale or a measure means to make a new measure such as a bre and so on.

original: 'dis 'jal ba yin pas gzhal blugs te /
analyzed: 'dis 'jal ba yin pas gzhal blugs te /
translated: Because this measures, it is a measure.

original: de yang bcos ma de'i sbyor ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bcos ma de'i sbyor ba byas pa'o //
translated: And that is the application of that fabrication.

original: de las gab ba las gzhan la 'tshe ba'i thabs bstan nas bsal bar smras pa /
analyzed: de las gab ba las gzhan la 'tshe ba'i thabs bstan nas bsal bar smras pa /
translated: Having shown the means of harming others other than that, it is said to be removed.

original: las gang shin tu mi bzad pa //
analyzed: las gang shin tu mi bzad pa //
translated: What karma is extremely unbearable?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam par smad pa'i spyod pa de'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam par smad pa'i spyod pa de'o //
translated: The conduct of killing and so on is reprehensible.

original: mi la 'tshe bar byed pa dang // zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan la nye bar gdung bar byed pa yin no //🔽gzhan la byed du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan byed par 'jud pa'am /
analyzed: mi la 'tshe bar byed pa dang // zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan la nye bar gdung bar byed pa yin no // gzhan la byed du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan byed par 'jud pa'am /
translated: Causing harm to others means tormenting other sentient beings.

original: gzhan gyi lag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Causing others to do it means making others do it, or it means by the hand of another.

original: de yis g-yang sar ltung bar byed //
analyzed: de yis g-yang sar ltung bar byed //
translated: That causes one to fall into an abyss.

original: ces bya ba ni rab tu 'gro ba dang 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rab tu 'gro ba dang 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it causes one to go and enter.

original: g-yang sa ni ngan song ngo //
analyzed: g-yang sa ni ngan song ngo //
translated: An abyss is a miserable condition.

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni 'tshe ba byed pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni 'tshe ba byed pa la sogs pas so //
translated: That means by causing harm and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / las de mi yi rjes 'brang bas //
analyzed: smras pa / las de mi yi rjes 'brang bas //
translated: That karma follows a human being.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir sems can de sdig pa ngan song gi 'bras bu'i las nag po'i zhags pa nyid kyis bcings pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can de sdig pa ngan song gi 'bras bu'i las nag po'i zhags pa nyid kyis bcings pa ste /
translated: Because that sentient being is bound by the noose of black karma, the result of which is a miserable condition.

original: gzhan gyis dbang du byas pa yin pas de bas na mi 'dod kyang ngan song du 'gro ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dbang du byas pa yin pas de bas na mi 'dod kyang ngan song du 'gro ba nyid do //
translated: Since it is controlled by another, one goes to the lower realms even though one does not want to.

original: 'o na lus kyis las byas pa ni lus nyams pas 'jigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na lus kyis las byas pa ni lus nyams pas 'jigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Now, if the body is the agent of action, then the body would be destroyed by the destruction of the body.

original: gang gi phyir gnas nyams na gnas pa nyams par snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas nyams na gnas pa nyams par snang ngo zhe na /
translated: For, when the basis is destroyed, the one who is based on it is destroyed.🔽We say:

original: smras pa / mi yis gang dang gang byas pa'i //
analyzed: smras pa / mi yis gang dang gang byas pa'i //
translated: Whatever a man does

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the second chapter, the chapter on the benefits of bodhicitta.

original: gang cung zad kun nas nyon mongs pa sems can 'di spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang cung zad kun nas nyon mongs pa sems can 'di spyod pa'o //
translated: Whatever is the slightest bit of activity of this afflicted sentient being.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?🔽We say:

original: smras pa / dge ba 'am ni sdig pa yi //
analyzed: smras pa / dge ba 'am ni sdig pa yi //
translated: Virtuous or nonvirtuous

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.🔽

original: mi dge ba'i las sam dge ba'i las so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las sam dge ba'i las so //
translated: Nonvirtuous action or virtuous action.

analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa lnga gsungs so //

analyzed: gzhan dag ni sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu gnyis mnar med par song ba na lha sbyin gyi lus dpag tshad du ma can mthong ba na smras pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyod la nad med dam zhes kyang gsungs so //

analyzed: des kyang mthong nas shin tu du bar gyur nas de'i phyir gsungs so zhes zer ro ;

analyzed: / dgod bzhin zhes bya ba ni bzhin 'dzum pa dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: sdig pa'i las byas pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i bya ba kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The phrase “having done evil deeds” refers to the performance of actions that will have undesirable results.

original: gang yin zhe na /🔽bdag nyid bde ba 'dod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang yin zhe na / bdag nyid bde ba 'dod pa'i phyir //

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

original: de dang 'brel ba ni bdag nyid kyi lus la bde ba tshol ba'i byis pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba ni bdag nyid kyi lus la bde ba tshol ba'i byis pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The phrase “because they desire happiness for themselves” means that they are foolish people who seek happiness for their own bodies.

original: gzhan dag ni de ltar bde ba mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de ltar bde ba mi 'dod do //

analyzed: du bzhin rnam smin dag ces bya ba smos te / bdag nyid bde ba 'dod pa'i phyir //

analyzed: byas pa'i sdig pa'i las des ngan song du skyes te /
translated: Because they desire happiness for themselves, they are reborn in the lower realms as a result of the evil deeds that they have done.

original: ngu bzhin du mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong ba yin te /
analyzed: ngu bzhin du mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyams su myong ba yin te /
translated: They experience undesirable results while crying out in lamentation.

original: rnam par smin pa de ni gdung @176b ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa de ni gdung @176b ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: sdig las zhes bya ba ni bsags pas na sdig pa ste /
analyzed: sdig las zhes bya ba ni bsags pas na sdig pa ste /
translated: The phrase “evil deeds” means that they are evil because they have been accumulated.

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu de yang nye bar bsags pa'am spyod pa'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni de nyid de /

analyzed: gang gi phyir sdig pa nye bar bsags pa des ni nges par de'i 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: ji skad du gang gis bsams bzhin du las byas shing bsags pas ni rnam par smin pa yang dag par myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, “I do not say that one who has done and accumulated an action with deliberation will not experience its ripening.”

original: bsams bzhin du sdig pa bsags pa dang / mthar phyin par byas pa gnyis dang 'gyod pa med pa'i nyes dmigs yin no //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du sdig pa bsags pa dang / mthar phyin par byas pa gnyis dang 'gyod pa med pa'i nyes dmigs yin no //

analyzed: ji ltar de sdig pa'i las dgod bzhin du byed pa yin zhe na smras pa /

analyzed: 'di ltar nges par sdig las zhes bya ba ste /

original: rgyal byed kyi tshal na yi dags skom pas nyam thag pa zhig las brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal byed kyi tshal na yi dags skom pas nyam thag pa zhig las brtsams pa yin no //

original: nges par zhes bya ba ni gcig tu sdig pa can gyi las so //
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba ni gcig tu sdig pa can gyi las so //
translated: “Certain” means that the action is definitely evil.

analyzed: 'phral du zhes bya ba ni dus de nyid du myur du 'gyur zhing rnam par mi 'gyur te /
translated: “Immediately” means that it will quickly become manifest in that very life, and not change.

analyzed: byas pa'i dus de nyid du mi smin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not ripen at the very time it is done.

original: las thams cad kyi mthong ba'i chos nyid la myong ba'i mi snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽mthun pa'i chos kyi dpe bstan pa /

original: 'o ma lta bur zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'o ma lta bur zhes bya ba yin te /

analyzed: dper na 'o ma ni dus de nyid du zhor mi 'gyur te 'on kyang dus phyi ma zhig na zhor 'gyur ba de bzhin no //
translated: for example, milk does not become curd at that very time, but later it becomes curd.🔽Or, the example of the discordant is:🔽Like the satyaya grass,

original: yang na chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni 'phral du zhes bya ba ni sad tya zhes bya ba'i rtsva'i rigs yod de 'o ma la des btab na bcug pa tsam nyid du zhor 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni 'phral du zhes bya ba ni sad tya zhes bya ba'i rtsva'i rigs yod de 'o ma la des btab na bcug pa tsam nyid du zhor 'gyur te /
translated: if milk is sprinkled with that, it becomes curd just by being sprinkled.

original: sdig pa'i las ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: But sinful karma is not like that.

original: des ni byis pa sreg par byed //
analyzed: des ni byis pa sreg par byed //
translated: It burns the childish.

original: ces bya ba ni sdig pa'i las smin par 'gyur ba'i dus na shin tu gnod par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sdig pa'i las smin par 'gyur ba'i dus na shin tu gnod par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: When the time comes for sinful karma to ripen, it causes great harm,

analyzed: sdig pa byed pa'i skye bo'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it follows the person who commits the sin.

original: thal bas g-yogs pa'i me lta bur //
analyzed: thal bas g-yogs pa'i me lta bur //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thal bas g-yogs pa'i me la dper na byis pa'i gom pa bag rkyong ste 'gro ba sreg par byed pa de bzhin no //
translated: Just as a fire covered by ashes burns a child who stretches out his hand to it, so also does evil karma.

analyzed: 'di nyid kyi dngos po rnam pa gzhan gyis ston pa yin te /
translated: This is the same thing expressed in another way.

original: sdig las 'phral du nges par ni //
analyzed: sdig las 'phral du nges par ni //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //

original: gcod pas ni gcod cing dum bur byed pa ste /
analyzed: gcod pas ni gcod cing dum bur byed pa ste /

original: zad par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zad par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: it means destroying.

original: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu yin zhe na /

analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe mtshon bzhin du zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: It is shown by the example of a dissimilar thing.

analyzed: dper na mtshon shin tu rnon pos ni reg pa tsam gyis gcod par byed @177a * //

original: do ; / sdig pa'i las ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: do ; / sdig pa'i las ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: Evil karma is not like that.
