analyzed: gal te 'phral du mi gcod na phyis kyang de bzhin du yin nam zhe na / pha rol du ni mngon par 'gyur //
translated: If it does not cut immediately, is it the same later on?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It becomes manifest in the next world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol du ni gang gis sdig pa byas pas skye ba gang du skye ba der skyes pa na shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol du ni gang gis sdig pa byas pas skye ba gang du skye ba der skyes pa na shes par 'gyur te /
translated: In the next world, by whatever sin one has been born in a certain rebirth, one will know it when one is born there.

original: sdig pa byas bas sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa byas bas sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Because of the sin, there is suffering.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pha rol der ni 'dir byas pa'i sdig pa'i 'bras bu shin tu tsha ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing yid du mi 'ong ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pha rol der ni 'dir byas pa'i sdig pa'i 'bras bu shin tu tsha ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur zhing yid du mi 'ong ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the sin committed, one will experience the extremely painful result of the sin committed here in the next world, and there will be the arising of unpleasant suffering—this is the meaning.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus las bskyed pa'i sdig pa yin na yang me bzhin du rang gi gnas 'jig par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus las bskyed pa'i sdig pa yin na yang me bzhin du rang gi gnas 'jig par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Even though the sin is generated from one’s own body, it destroys one’s own abode like fire. In order to teach this, it is said:

original: lcags las g-ya' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lcags las g-ya' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Rust from iron” and so on.

original: rgyal byed kyi tshal na gnas brtan rgyal dang / aa kro sha ka dang / ro sha ka dang / pa ri bha sha ka la bstan pa'i phyir gsungs so zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: rgyal byed kyi tshal na gnas brtan rgyal dang / aa kro sha ka dang / ro sha ka dang / pa ri bha sha ka la bstan pa'i phyir gsungs so zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say that this was spoken in order to teach the elder Jyotiska, Akroshaka, Roshaka, and Paribhashaka who were staying in Jetavana.

original: lcags ni lcags nyid de 'di ltar g-ya' ni dri ma'o //
analyzed: lcags ni lcags nyid de 'di ltar g-ya' ni dri ma'o //
translated: Iron is iron itself. Thus, rust is a stain.

original: langs par gyur pa ni yang dag par byung ba'o //
analyzed: langs par gyur pa ni yang dag par byung ba'o //
translated: Arisen means arisen.

original: ji ltar lcags las dri ma byung zhing gnas pa'i dri ma de ni de las byung ba'i dang de las skyes pa yin zhing de las langs pa yin yang rang gi gnam lcags sam mtshon de nyid za bar byed cing zad pa dang 'jig par byed ces bya
analyzed: ji ltar lcags las dri ma byung zhing gnas pa'i dri ma de ni de las byung ba'i dang de las skyes pa yin zhing de las langs pa yin yang rang gi gnam lcags sam mtshon de nyid za bar byed cing zad pa dang 'jig par byed ces bya
translated: Just as a stain arises from iron and abides as a stain, it arises from that, is born from that, and arises from that, and yet it eats its own iron or weapon, and causes it to be consumed and destroyed.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ltar na /🔽de bzhin ma brtags byas pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar na / de bzhin ma brtags byas pa yi //
translated: Thus,🔽Likewise, the one who acts without examination

original: zhes bya ba ni yongs su ma brtags par byed pa'i byis pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yongs su ma brtags par byed pa'i byis pa'o //
translated: The one who acts without examination is a fool.

original: rang gi las kyi zhes bya ba ni rang gis byas pa'i nyes par spyad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi zhes bya ba ni rang gis byas pa'i nyes par spyad pa'o //
translated: One's own karma means the misdeeds one has done oneself.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro zhes bya ba ni ngan song du skye ba thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro zhes bya ba ni ngan song du skye ba thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One goes to a bad rebirth means one obtains birth in a bad realm.

original: de bas na ngan par spyod pas 'jigs par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ngan par spyod pas 'jigs par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, this was said in order to teach that one should be afraid of bad conduct.

original: las kyi tshoms kyi rnam par 'grel pa ste dgu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: las kyi tshoms kyi rnam par 'grel pa ste dgu pa rdzogs so /
translated: The ninth chapter of the Karmavarga is completed.

original: // / ji skad du bshad pa'i sdig pa'i las zad pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu dad pa'i tshoms bstan te /
analyzed: // / ji skad du bshad pa'i sdig pa'i las zad pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu dad pa'i tshoms bstan te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the means of eliminating the previously explained sinful karma, the chapter on faith is taught.

original: gang gi phyir de la brten pas ni ma skyes dgra la sogs pa'i sdig pa zad par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la brten pas ni ma skyes dgra la sogs pa'i sdig pa zad par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by relying on it, the sins of Ajatashatru and others were eliminated.

original: 'di'i 'grel pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i 'grel pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Now, the commentary on this should be composed.

original: dad dang ngo tsha zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dad dang ngo tsha zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It begins with faith, shame, etc.

original: mnyan yod na tshang dpon gyi bu grogs po bzhi zhig yod de /
analyzed: mnyan yod na tshang dpon gyi bu grogs po bzhi zhig yod de /
translated: In Shravasti, there were four friends, sons of carpenters.

original: gcig ni dad pa med cing ci la yang yid ches pa med do //
analyzed: gcig ni dad pa med cing ci la yang yid ches pa med do //
translated: One had no faith and trusted nothing.

original: gnyis pa @177b ni ngo tsha med do //
analyzed: gnyis pa @177b ni ngo tsha med do //
translated: The second had no shame.

original: gsum pa ni sdig pa la spyod do //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sdig pa la spyod do //
translated: The third engaged in sinful conduct.

original: bzhi pa ni ser sna che ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni ser sna che ba'o //
translated: The fourth was very stingy.

original: de rnams kyang rtag tu bsam ba 'di lta bu skyes te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rtag tu bsam ba 'di lta bu skyes te /
translated: They constantly gave rise to this thought:

original: nam zhig na bdag cag mtho ris kyi lam bsgrubs te /
analyzed: nam zhig na bdag cag mtho ris kyi lam bsgrubs te /
translated: When will we accomplish the path to the higher realms?

original: gang gis mtho ris su song nas de'i phun sum tshogs pa yang myong bar bya'o zhes bsams so //
analyzed: gang gis mtho ris su song nas de'i phun sum tshogs pa yang myong bar bya'o zhes bsams so //
translated: Having gone to the higher realms, I will experience their excellence.

original: de dag kyang ma tshang ba med pa la sogs pa thob pas yongs su dga' zhing de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin pa dang / de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang ma tshang ba med pa la sogs pa thob pas yongs su dga' zhing de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin pa dang / de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: They were delighted to have attained the complete and so forth. When they arrived in the presence of the Blessed One, this was spoken with reference to them.

original: dad pa ni sems kyi rab tu dang ba ste /
analyzed: dad pa ni sems kyi rab tu dang ba ste /
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind.

original: mngon par yid ches pa dang / don du gnyer ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mngon par yid ches pa dang / don du gnyer ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: It is twofold, distinguished by the characteristics of clear belief and aspiration.

original: gang mngon par yid ches pa skyes pa de ni kha cig don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang mngon par yid ches pa skyes pa de ni kha cig don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who has generated clear belief may or may not aspire.

original: gang la mngon par yid ches pa zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa dang dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gang la mngon par yid ches pa zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa dang dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Clear belief is in the connection between action and result, the Three Jewels, and so forth.

original: mngon par 'dod pas sprul pa'i dngos po la don du gnyer ba yang yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pas sprul pa'i dngos po la don du gnyer ba yang yin te /
translated: Aspiring is desiring the emanated thing.

original: des na 'di ni yon tan thams cad skyed pa yang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'di ni yon tan thams cad skyed pa yang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is also the generator of all good qualities.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: dad pa dge ba skyed byed ma lta bu //🔽skye bo dge yid dang po de la 'jug / dad bral byang chub phyogs dang dam chos kyi //
analyzed: dad pa dge ba skyed byed ma lta bu // skye bo dge yid dang po de la 'jug / dad bral byang chub phyogs dang dam chos kyi //
translated: Faith is like a mother, generating virtue.🔽The first virtuous thought of a person🔽cannot hold the jewel collection of the factors of enlightenment and the true Dharma

original: rin chen tshogs 'dzin nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rin chen tshogs 'dzin nus pa ma yin no //
translated: without faith.

original: zhes pas so// re re la yang mtho ris kyi lam du bstan pa'i phyir dang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: zhes pas so// re re la yang mtho ris kyi lam du bstan pa'i phyir dang gi sgra'o //
translated: Each of these is stated to be the path to the higher realms.

original: ngo tsha ba ni gang gis sdig pa las 'dzem zhing zhum par byed la /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba ni gang gis sdig pa las 'dzem zhing zhum par byed la /
translated: Shame is that which causes one to avoid evil and feel abashed.

original: yon tan dang yon tan can dag la gus par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang yon tan can dag la gus par byed pa'o //
translated: It is respect for good qualities and those who have good qualities.

original: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims 'chal pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims 'chal pa spangs pa ste /
translated: Morality is the abandonment of immorality.

original: ji skad du sngar bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bshad pa nyid do //
translated: It is just as previously explained.

original: sbyin pa ni yongs su gtong ba ste /🔽'di la gcig tu sbyin pa ni sbyin pa po yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni yongs su gtong ba ste / 'di la gcig tu sbyin pa ni sbyin pa po yin te /
translated: Generosity is complete giving.🔽Here, the Abhidharmakośa explains that the giver is the one who gives alone.

original: 'dis sbyin bas sbyin pa'o zhes sgrub pa'i mtha' las bshad de /
analyzed: 'dis sbyin bas sbyin pa'o zhes sgrub pa'i mtha' las bshad de /
translated: It is giving because one gives through this.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge ba'i sems kyis nor dag ni //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyis nor dag ni //
translated: The mind of virtue is the wealth

original: gang tshe bdag gis la ma byin //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag gis la ma byin //
translated: when I give to others.

original: skad cig de la dge ba'i tshogs //
analyzed: skad cig de la dge ba'i tshogs //
translated: At that moment, the collection of virtue

original: sbyin pa zhes ni brjod pa yin //
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes ni brjod pa yin //
translated: is called “giving.”

original: zhes so // chos 'di rnams ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i khyad par gyi yon tan 'di dag ni zhes bya ba'i don te chen po nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes so // chos 'di rnams ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i khyad par gyi yon tan 'di dag ni zhes bya ba'i don te chen po nyid du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of “these dharmas” is “these special qualities of things,” because they make them great.

original: chos ni yon tan dang dge ba byed pa po yin no zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: chos ni yon tan dang dge ba byed pa po yin no zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The word “dharma” means a quality and a virtuous agent.

original: des na de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: des na de nyid smras pa /
translated: Therefore, he says just that:

original: skyes bu dam pas bsngags zhes bya ba ste @178a * //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pas bsngags zhes bya ba ste @178a * //
translated: “Praised by holy beings.”

original: sangs rgyas dang de'i nyan thos kyis bsngags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang de'i nyan thos kyis bsngags pa yin gyi /
translated: It is praised by the Buddha and his disciples.

original: skyon dang ldan pa ni bsngags pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: skyon dang ldan pa ni bsngags pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not praised by those who have faults.

original: 'di dag ji ltar bsngags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar bsngags pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it praised?

original: bde ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bde ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the path to happiness.

original: de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid smras pa /
translated: He says just that:

original: lam 'di nyid kyis lha yul 'gro bar gsungs //
analyzed: lam 'di nyid kyis lha yul 'gro bar gsungs //
translated: “This very path is said to go to the realm of the gods.”

original: zhes bya ba 'di ltar rnam pa bzhi'i khyad par gyis ni mtho ris su 'gro ba'i thabs su mkhas par bstan pa yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ltar rnam pa bzhi'i khyad par gyis ni mtho ris su 'gro ba'i thabs su mkhas par bstan pa yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Thus, by the distinction of these four aspects, the means of going to heaven is taught as skill in means. Why is that?

original: de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid smras pa /
translated: He says just that:

original: 'di yis zhes bya ba ni de bzhi las ma 'das te /
analyzed: 'di yis zhes bya ba ni de bzhi las ma 'das te /
translated: By this, one does not go beyond those four.

original: me dang chur 'jug pa dang bral ba'i las mchod pa sogs bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: me dang chur 'jug pa dang bral ba'i las mchod pa sogs bsam pa yin no //
translated: The action of worship, etc. is free from entering fire and water.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: One goes is one who goes.

original: lha'i 'jig rten ni lha dang skal ba mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i 'jig rten ni lha dang skal ba mnyam pa'o //
translated: The divine world is the same fortune as the gods.

original: de la dad pa ni dge ba'i bya ba thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir dang por ston to //
analyzed: de la dad pa ni dge ba'i bya ba thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir dang por ston to //
translated: There, faith is taught first, because it is the forerunner of all virtuous actions.

original: dang po yod pa la ni ngo tsha dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po yod pa la ni ngo tsha dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is the first, one becomes endowed with shame.

original: ngo tsha dang ldan pa la ni tshul khrims dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha dang ldan pa la ni tshul khrims dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is endowed with shame, one's ethics become pure.

original: tshul khrims dag pa la ni sbyin pa rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dag pa la ni sbyin pa rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: When one's ethics are pure, one's generosity becomes pure.

original: go rims de lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: go rims de lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: This is the order.

original: ngo tsha dang dad pa gnyis kyis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha dang dad pa gnyis kyis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The two, shame and faith, are the perfection of thought.

original: tshul khrims dang sbyin pa gnyis kyis ni spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang sbyin pa gnyis kyis ni spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The two, morality and giving, are the perfection of practice.

original: lhag mas ni de'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lhag mas ni de'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: The remaining verses teach the benefits of that.

original: de yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: And that is stated for the purpose of encouraging one to take it up.

original: 'dir sbyin pa ni thams cad kyi mthar bkod cing ches dman pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mtho ris kyi lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir sbyin pa ni thams cad kyi mthar bkod cing ches dman pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mtho ris kyi lam yin zhe na /
translated: Here, since giving is placed at the end of all and is the least, how is it the path to heaven?

original: 'jungs rnams lha yi 'jig rten mi 'gro zhing //
analyzed: 'jungs rnams lha yi 'jig rten mi 'gro zhing //
translated: The miserly do not go to the world of the gods.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And so on.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas stong shing shi ri ka las byas pa'i gzhal med khang na lha'i bu zhig gnas pa /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas stong shing shi ri ka las byas pa'i gzhal med khang na lha'i bu zhig gnas pa /
translated: In the empty abode of the Thirty-three, in a palace made of shirisha wood, a son of the gods was dwelling.

original: gnas brtan pa lang bdag gis mthong nas grogs po khyod 'di nas sngon yun ring por yang gnas pa mthong zhes smras pa dang de ci 'di ma gsan tam /
analyzed: gnas brtan pa lang bdag gis mthong nas grogs po khyod 'di nas sngon yun ring por yang gnas pa mthong zhes smras pa dang de ci 'di ma gsan tam /
translated: The elder Pūrṇa saw him and said, “Friend, I see that you have dwelt here for a long time.” He said, “Have you not heard this?

original: 'thon par 'byung yang srid ces bya ba rgyal rigs su 'gyur ba de ni bdag yin te /🔽der chad par smra bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'thon par 'byung yang srid ces bya ba rgyal rigs su 'gyur ba de ni bdag yin te / der chad par smra bar 'gyur na /
translated: The one who will be born as a king, that is me.🔽If I were to say that I was the one who was converted by the Venerable Arya Kaulita, etc.,

original: bdag btsun pa 'phags pa gzhon nur 'od srungs kyis btul ba'i skye ba la sogs pa zhes smras pa bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i rna ba'i mngon shes kyis gsan te /
analyzed: bdag btsun pa 'phags pa gzhon nur 'od srungs kyis btul ba'i skye ba la sogs pa zhes smras pa bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i rna ba'i mngon shes kyis gsan te /
translated: the Blessed One would hear it with his divine ear.

original: ci tsam na tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ci tsam na tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then he would say this verse:

original: @178b 'jungs rnams lha yi 'jig rten mi 'gro zhing //
analyzed: @178b 'jungs rnams lha yi 'jig rten mi 'gro zhing //
translated: The miserly do not go to the world of the gods,

original: zhes bya ba ser sna can nyid ni mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du 'gro ba'i las med pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ser sna can nyid ni mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du 'gro ba'i las med pa nyid do //
translated: The miserly do not have the karma to go to the world of the gods.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽 Because of the word childish.

original: de yis byis pa zhes bya ba yin te gang gi phyir gang dag 'jungs shing rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: de yis byis pa zhes bya ba yin te gang gi phyir gang dag 'jungs shing rmongs pa ste /
translated: They are childish because they are miserly and ignorant,

original: las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba ci lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽des na smras pa /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba ci lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro // des na smras pa /
translated: not understanding the connection between karma and its results.

original: sbyin pa'i bsngags mi brjod ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsngags mi brjod ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he said, I will not praise giving.

original: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa mi brjod par ma zad de rmongs pa rnams ni smod pa yang yin pa ji skad du /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa mi brjod par ma zad de rmongs pa rnams ni smod pa yang yin pa ji skad du /
translated: As it is explained:

original: 'khor gsum rgyu yi khyad par nor yin pas //🔽de nyams ches na gang gis ma nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor gsum rgyu yi khyad par nor yin pas // de nyams ches na gang gis ma nyams 'gyur //
translated: Wealth is the special cause of the three spheres.

original: zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes 'chad do //
translated: If it is destroyed, how can it be destroyed?

original: brtan rnams zhes bya ba ni gang yang mkhas pa rnams te /🔽de ni sbyin la rjes su yi rang ba //
analyzed: brtan rnams zhes bya ba ni gang yang mkhas pa rnams te / de ni sbyin la rjes su yi rang ba //
translated: The steadfast are the wise ones.🔽They rejoice in generosity.

original: zhes nor gtong ba'i phan yon yang dag par bsngags par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes nor gtong ba'i phan yon yang dag par bsngags par byed pa'o //
translated: This praises the benefits of giving wealth.

original: gang gi phyir sbyin pa'i snga rol du ni yid bde ba yin la /🔽sbyin pa sbyin pa'i tshe na sems dang ba yin zhing ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyin pa'i snga rol du ni yid bde ba yin la / sbyin pa sbyin pa'i tshe na sems dang ba yin zhing ;
translated: Because before giving, there is mental satisfaction.🔽When giving a gift, there is mental clarity.

original: byin nas kyang yid mgu ba yin te 'gyod pa med pa yin no zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: byin nas kyang yid mgu ba yin te 'gyod pa med pa yin no zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: And after giving, there is mental joy, which is the absence of regret.🔽This is the meaning of the verse.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la rjes su yi rang ba'i rgyus so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la rjes su yi rang ba'i rgyus so //
translated: By that means, by the cause of rejoicing in generosity,

original: de dag ces bya ba ni rjes su yi rang bar byed pa yang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni rjes su yi rang bar byed pa yang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Those who rejoice in the giving also experience happiness.

analyzed: de mtho ris su skyes te brtan pa rnams bde 'gror skyes nas /

analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gzhan no //

original: ces gzhan dag tu brjod do //
analyzed: ces gzhan dag tu brjod do //

analyzed: de'i don dang 'brel pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /

analyzed: de'i phyir ma dad pa'i rtags ni 'jungs pa'i rtags kyis te ;

original: du ba'i rtags kyis me shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: du ba'i rtags kyis me shes pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: sbyin pa la rjes su yi rang ba'i phyir na dad pa nyid do //

analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs bar dris pa'i lan 'di brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dad pa'i dbang gis brtan pa rnams sbyin pas sems yang dag par tshim @179a * // zhing rgyas par gyur la /

original: pha rol tu bde bar gyur pa'i phyir smras pa /

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: lha zhig gis /
analyzed: lha zhig gis /

analyzed: 'di na skyes bu'i nor mchog gang zhig lags //

original: legs spyod gang gis bde ba thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: legs spyod gang gis bde ba thob par 'gyur //

original: ro yi nang na ro yi mchog ni gang //
analyzed: ro yi nang na ro yi mchog ni gang //

original: tshong pa'i nang na tshong mchog gang lags gsungs //
analyzed: tshong pa'i nang na tshong mchog gang lags gsungs //

original: zhes gsol pa dang / de'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsol pa dang / de'i phyir 'di gsungs so //

analyzed: dad pa'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //

original: 'di na skyes bu'i nor mchog ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di na skyes bu'i nor mchog ces bya ba la /

original: 'dis bde ba myong bas na nor ro //
analyzed: 'dis bde ba myong bas na nor ro //

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nor gyi mchog ni 'jig rten na blo dang ldan pa'i nor te /
translated: The best wealth of sentient beings is the wealth of the wise in the world.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nor 'di dag ni cung zad tsam yin te /
analyzed: nor 'di dag ni cung zad tsam yin te /

original: dper na dbyig la sogs pa'i nor rnams kyi nang na ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dper na dbyig la sogs pa'i nor rnams kyi nang na ni 'di lta ste /
translated: For example, among the wealth of gold and so on,🔽the best wealth is the wealth of faith.

original: dad pa'i nor mchog yin no zhes bshad pa dang / phyi rol gyi nor mchog rnams ni gdung bar byed pa'i phyir mchog ma yin te ji skad du /
analyzed: dad pa'i nor mchog yin no zhes bshad pa dang / phyi rol gyi nor mchog rnams ni gdung bar byed pa'i phyir mchog ma yin te ji skad du /
translated: The best of external wealth is not the best because it causes torment. As it is said:

original: stsogs pas nyon mongs mi dga' la //
analyzed: stsogs pas nyon mongs mi dga' la //
translated: The wealth of the afflictions is not pleasant.

original: gang tshe srung las 'jigs pa byung //
analyzed: gang tshe srung las 'jigs pa byung //

original: 'jigs na mya ngan 'ba' zhig ste //
analyzed: 'jigs na mya ngan 'ba' zhig ste //

original: 'di la su zhig dga' bar byed //🔽ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la su zhig dga' bar byed // ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

original: chos ni sbyin pa'i bdag nyid kyi legs par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni sbyin pa'i bdag nyid kyi legs par spyod pa ste /

original: tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid la sogs pa ni 'og nas brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bdag nyid la sogs pa ni 'og nas brjod pa'i phyir ro //

original: legs spyod ces bya ba ni tshul bzhin du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: legs spyod ces bya ba ni tshul bzhin du spyod pa ste /

original: ji skad du skyes bu dam pa'i sbyin pa lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du skyes bu dam pa'i sbyin pa lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, “The five gifts of the holy man” and so on.

original: bde ba 'thob ces bya ba ni phan 'dogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba 'thob ces bya ba ni phan 'dogs par byed pa ste /
translated: “Attains happiness” means that it is helpful.

original: 'khor ba yongs su 'khyams pa na //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su 'khyams pa na //
translated: As it is said, “Wandering through cyclic existence,

analyzed: sbyin pa ma gtogs gnyen med do // zhes bya bas shes bar bya'o //
translated: there is no friend like generosity.”

analyzed: bden pa kho na ro bro rnams kyi phul zhes bya ba ni bden pa mchog tu gzung ba ni tshul khrims yin te 'dis ni tshul khrims bstan to //
translated: “Truth is the best of flavors” means that morality is considered the highest truth. This teaches morality.

original: bden pa'i tshig nyid ni mngon par 'dod par bya ba yin pas lha dang mi rnams kyi zas gya nom pa thams cad pas kyang shin tu bsod pa yin te /
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig nyid ni mngon par 'dod par bya ba yin pas lha dang mi rnams kyi zas gya nom pa thams cad pas kyang shin tu bsod pa yin te /
translated: The word of truth is the most desirable thing, and so it is the most delicious of all the fine foods of gods and humans.

original: lha dang mi rnams mgu bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams mgu bar byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: kho na ni nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: kho na ni nges par gzung ba yin no //

original: shes rab kyis 'tsho ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab kyis 'tsho ba zhes bya ba la /

original: shes rab ni de bzhin nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni de bzhin nyid shes pa ste /

analyzed: nges 'tsho ba ni 'tsho ba bzhin du gang la yod pa de'o //

analyzed: yang na shes rab kyis @179b 'tsho ba'i tshul 'di la yod pa ste /

original: brtags nas byed pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: brtags nas byed pa zhes bya ba'i don te /

analyzed: 'dis ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bstan to //

original: 'tsho ba'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'tsho bar byed pa de rnams kyi nang nas nges par gzung ba ste drug pa'o //
translated: it is the sixth, that which is definitely selected from among those that make a living.🔽The word “supreme” is the same as “excellent” which will be explained later.

original: mchog tu ces gsungs zhes bya ba ni dam pa zhes 'di nyid kyi nang du 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mchog tu ces gsungs zhes bya ba ni dam pa zhes 'di nyid kyi nang du 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: The verse says:

analyzed: stsogs dang zad pa ma mthong ba //
translated: “Those who see the end of the aggregates,

original: lo brgyar gson pa gang yin pas //
analyzed: lo brgyar gson pa gang yin pas //
translated: even if they live a hundred years,🔽are not equal to those who see the end of the aggregates

original: zhes bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag yin no //
translated: for even a finger snap.”

analyzed: de la 'dis ni dad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po bstan to ;
translated: Here, this shows the merit that arises from generosity, morality, and meditation preceded by faith.

analyzed: / dad pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag 'ba' zhig gi sngon du 'gro ba ma yin gyi /

analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi yang sngon du 'gro ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: mya ngan 'das par 'gro ba yi //
translated: The one who goes to nirvana

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.🔽In the Questions of the Devaputra Susthitamati

original: lha zhig gis zhus pa /
analyzed: lha zhig gis zhus pa /
translated: it is said:

original: 'jig rten skyes bu ji lta bus //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyes bu ji lta bus //
translated: “What kind of person in the world🔽will attain the discerning wisdom that brings about

analyzed: nges par byed pa'i shes rab dag /'thob 'gyur yang dag lta ba ni //
translated: the right view?

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la gsungs //
translated: May the Blessed One teach me this.”

original: zhes pa dang / des na 'di gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / des na 'di gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: dad pa bskyed de zhes bya ba ni yid ches par bya ba ste /

analyzed: gang 'di la rigs pa dang lung dag gis yid ches par bya'o ;

original: dgra bcom chos la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom chos la zhes bya ba ste /

original: sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i lam mo //

original: mya ngan las 'das 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das 'gro ba yi //
translated: One who is going to nirvana

original: zhes bya ba ni thar pa thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thar pa thob par byed pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir bstan pa dang sgrub pa'i chos la brten pas 'bras bu'i chos 'thob pa'o //

analyzed: de la dad pa bskyed de de'i don la mngon par rtsom pa yod par gyur na ni nges par 'thob pa yin no //

analyzed: 'o na ye shes nyid thar pa'i lam la sogs pa thob par byed pa yin na /

original: de ji ltar 'dir brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'dir brjod ce na /

analyzed: gang 'di ltar dad nor yod pa des ni shes rab 'thob par 'gyur te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir dad pa yang nyan par 'dod pa nyid skyed pa yin no //

analyzed: shes rab de ga las 'thob ce na /

original: smras pa / de dang de yi zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / de dang de yi zhes bya ba yin te /

analyzed: @180a * // bden pa dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa la nges par 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that one definitely attains the truths, the aggregates, the elements, the sense bases, and so forth.

original: mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: “The wise” means the realized ones.

original: rigs pas thob pa'i ye shes kyi sbyor ba las so //
analyzed: rigs pas thob pa'i ye shes kyi sbyor ba las so //

original: de la brten nas ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dad pa'i stobs kyis ni shes rab la sogs pa thob pa gcig pur ma zad kyi nyes pa rnams kyang spong ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: bag can gyis ni rgya mtsho dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: lha zhig gis gsol pa /
analyzed: lha zhig gis gsol pa /

analyzed: rang gi chu bo gang gis rgal //

analyzed: gang gis rgya mtsho rgal bar 'gyur //

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal gang gis spong /
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal gang gis spong /
translated: By what does one abandon one’s own suffering?

original: gang gis yongs su dag par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis yongs su dag par 'gyur //
translated: By what does one become completely pure?”

original: zhes pa dang 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa dang 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is what he said.

original: dad pa rgyur 'gyur bas sgrol ba ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa rgyur 'gyur bas sgrol ba ni 'das pa'o //

original: chu bo ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: chu bo ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: it has the nature of the afflictions.

original: dad pa'i gzings la brten nas chu bo thams cad las brgal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa'i gzings la brten nas chu bo thams cad las brgal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One crosses all the rivers by relying on the raft of faith.

original: bas zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi don te /
analyzed: bas zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi don te /

analyzed: dad pa nyid kyis 'phags pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Faith itself is the abandonment of all the afflictions of the path of the noble ones.

original: 'dir dad pa ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'dir dad pa ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //

analyzed: bag yod pa'i stobs kyis ngan song gsum gyi rgya mtsho las brgal ba yin te /

original: 'dir bag yod pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'dir bag yod pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: Here, heedfulness is the path of seeing.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni sdug bsngal spong //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni sdug bsngal spong //

original: zhes bya ba brtson 'grus kyi sbyor ba rtul phong pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba brtson 'grus kyi sbyor ba rtul phong pa ste /

analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal spong ba yin no //
translated: The path of cultivation abandons the suffering of the three realms.

original: shes rab kyis ni yongs su dag 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni yongs su dag 'gyur //
translated: By wisdom, one becomes completely pure.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam bstan te /

original: de yod na ni rgyud la dri ma med par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de yod na ni rgyud la dri ma med par 'gyur bas so //
translated: For when one has that, one’s stream becomes stainless.

original: yang na dad pas ni khyim gyi gnas kyi chu bo las brgal ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na dad pas ni khyim gyi gnas kyi chu bo las brgal ba yin te /
translated: Or else, one crosses over the river of the household life through faith,

original: rab tu 'byung ba la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one relies on going forth.

original: bag yod pas ni 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i rgya mtsho las brgal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag yod pas ni 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i rgya mtsho las brgal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One crosses over the ocean of the conceptual thoughts of desire, etc. through heedfulness.

original: brtson 'grus kyis sdug bsngal sbong ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal dang bcas pa 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis sdug bsngal sbong ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal dang bcas pa 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One abandons suffering through effort, because one cuts off the suffering of the desire realm.

original: shes rab kyis ni yongs dag 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni yongs dag 'gyur //
translated: One becomes purified through wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa gong ma dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa gong ma dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one becomes free from attachment to the higher realms.

original: dad pas zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gsum gyi @180b spyir bstan to zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: dad pas zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gsum gyi @180b spyir bstan to zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say that faith is the general teaching for the three enlightenments of the disciples, the solitary realizers, and the Buddhas.

original: bag yod pa'i sgras ni 'dir 'phags pa'i lam gdul bya rnams la mtshon cing bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bag yod pa'i sgras ni 'dir 'phags pa'i lam gdul bya rnams la mtshon cing bstan pa yin te /
translated: The word “conscientiousness” here indicates the noble path to the disciples.

original: de'i phyir bag yod pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang rmongs pas ma rungs par byas pa'i gdul bya mtha' dag la dad pa la sogs pa'i man ngag gi gnyen po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bag yod pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang rmongs pas ma rungs par byas pa'i gdul bya mtha' dag la dad pa la sogs pa'i man ngag gi gnyen po bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the antidote of the instruction of faith, etc. is taught to all disciples who are made unfit by faithlessness, laziness, and delusion.

original: dad pa la brten pas ni 'ching ba thams cad gcod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dad pa la brten pas ni 'ching ba thams cad gcod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one who is based on faith cuts all the bonds, it is said:

original: dge slong dad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The monk who has faith . . . ” and so on.

original: lha zhig gis gsol ba /🔽'di ltar grogs ni gang zhig lags //
analyzed: lha zhig gis gsol ba / 'di ltar grogs ni gang zhig lags //
translated: A god asked:🔽What is the friend?

original: gdams pa yang ni gang zhig gang //
analyzed: gdams pa yang ni gang zhig gang //
translated: What is the instruction?

original: dge slong gang la dga' ba yis //
analyzed: dge slong gang la dga' ba yis //
translated: By what monk is there

original: bcings pa thams cad gcod par 'gyur //
analyzed: bcings pa thams cad gcod par 'gyur //
translated: the cutting of all bonds?

original: zhes pa dang / 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / 'di gsungs so //
translated: and he said this:

original: dad pa'i grogs ni gnyis pa gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i grogs ni gnyis pa gang la yod pa'o //
translated: The friend is faith.

original: dad pa la brtan nas so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa'i khyad par thob par 'gyur te de med na ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa la brtan nas so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa'i khyad par thob par 'gyur te de med na ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having stabilized faith, one obtains the special vows of individual liberation and so on, because without that, one does not have them.🔽And filled with wisdom,

original: shes rab kyis ni gtams pa dang // zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi blos dge slong 'di la ji lta ba bzhin du gtams pa dang / ston pa ste 'dis ni rtag pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni gtams pa dang // zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi blos dge slong 'di la ji lta ba bzhin du gtams pa dang / ston pa ste 'dis ni rtag pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: means that the monk is filled with and taught by the mind that has the nature of knowledge. This shows their permanence.

original: mya ngan 'das la mngon dga' bas //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das la mngon dga' bas //
translated: Delighting in nirvana,

original: zhes bya ba ni thar pa nyid la yang dag par dga' ba skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thar pa nyid la yang dag par dga' ba skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: means that the arising of delight in liberation itself.

original: 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs par byas pa dang // mya ngan las 'das pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs par byas pa dang // mya ngan las 'das pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /
translated: Having turned away from samsara and become skilled in nirvana,

original: des na de thob par byed pa'i lam la goms par byed pa'i dge slong gis 'ching ba thams cad de nyon mongs pa'i zhags pa thams cad gcod par byed do //
analyzed: des na de thob par byed pa'i lam la goms par byed pa'i dge slong gis 'ching ba thams cad de nyon mongs pa'i zhags pa thams cad gcod par byed do //
translated: the monk who cultivates the path that leads to that cuts all bonds, all the fetters of afflictions.

original: de la dad pa dang shes rab kyis ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //🔽mya ngan 'das la mngon dga' bas //
analyzed: de la dad pa dang shes rab kyis ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to // mya ngan 'das la mngon dga' bas //
translated: Faith and wisdom are taught as the perfection of application.🔽The perfection of aspiration is taught by the verse:

original: zhes bya bas ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: “He delights in nirvana.🔽”

original: lhag mas ni de'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: lhag mas ni de'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: The rest of the verse teaches the benefits of faith, etc.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas ni legs pa zhes brjod pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas ni legs pa zhes brjod pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: One who possesses faith, etc. is called “virtuous” and obtains the praise of the Blessed One.

original: gang gis dad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang gis dad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is stated by the verse beginning with “By whom is faith . . . ”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ni legs pa'i ngang tshul can la brjod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ni legs pa'i ngang tshul can la brjod de /
translated: The Blessed One calls a monk “virtuous. ”

original: ji tsam gyis legs pa'i ngang tshul can du brjod ce na zhes bya ba nas 'di gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis legs pa'i ngang tshul can du brjod ce na zhes bya ba nas 'di gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By what is he called virtuous?

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni sems can gang la la zhig gis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni sems can gang la la zhig gis so //
translated: “By whom” refers to any sentient being.

original: dad dang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin @181a * //
analyzed: dad dang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin @181a * //
translated: “Faith” and so on are as before.🔽In order to teach the causes of being called virtuous, both individually and collectively,

original: no ; /'di dag ni re re dang mtha' dag la legs pa zhes brjod pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: no ; /'di dag ni re re dang mtha' dag la legs pa zhes brjod pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says:

original: dang gi sgra gsum smos so //
analyzed: dang gi sgra gsum smos so //
translated: The three terms “and” indicate the three perfections.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word “just” is a restrictive particle.

original: rim ba gzhan du sbyar ba'i phyir da nyid legs pa'i ngang tshul can zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rim ba gzhan du sbyar ba'i phyir da nyid legs pa'i ngang tshul can zhes brjod do //
translated: The phrase “just the one of good character” is a rearrangement of the words.

original: legs bsgoms shing zhes bya ba ni legs par bsten pa'i phyir bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: legs bsgoms shing zhes bya ba ni legs par bsten pa'i phyir bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The phrase “well cultivated” means “well attended to.”

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir skyon rnams spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir skyon rnams spangs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “having abandoned faults” means “having abandoned all afflictions.”

original: spangs pa ni bsal ba ste /
analyzed: spangs pa ni bsal ba ste /
translated: “Abandonment” means “removal.”

original: gang gis bag la nyal spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis bag la nyal spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the latent forms of the afflictions.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir mnyam par gzhag pa la dgongs te /
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir mnyam par gzhag pa la dgongs te /
translated: The word “wise” here refers to one who is concentrated.🔽The phrase “from the mind that is concentrated” means “from the mind that is in equipoise.”

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems las ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin no zhes pa'i tshig gis te rgyu las 'bras bu btags pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems las ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin no zhes pa'i tshig gis te rgyu las 'bras bu btags pa'o //
translated: The phrase “in accordance with reality” means “in accordance with fact.”

original: des na yang dad pa 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: des na yang dad pa 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “the one who has entered into faith” means “the one who has entered into the result of stream-entry.”

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi phung po ni de la rag las pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi phung po ni de la rag las pa yin te /
translated: The aggregates of morality, meditative absorption, and wisdom are dependent on that.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa gang la yod pa de'o ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa gang la yod pa de'o ;
translated: He who has abandoned the afflictions.

original: / legs pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / legs pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba la /
translated: He who has a good nature,

original: legs pa'i ngang tshul dang ngo bo gang la yod pa ste skye bo dam pa'i rang bzhin skye bo dam pas bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: legs pa'i ngang tshul dang ngo bo gang la yod pa ste skye bo dam pa'i rang bzhin skye bo dam pas bsngags pa'o //
translated: he who has a good nature and essence, the nature of a holy person, praised by holy persons.

original: brjod pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The expression is the explanation.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa ni thams cad du yang mchod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa ni thams cad du yang mchod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //
translated: Since it is taught that he who has faith is to be worshipped in every way, it is said:

original: dad dang tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dad dang tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Faith and morality, etc.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu 'khor dang bcas pa gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang der rgyal po dang rgyal po'i blon po rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byas te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu 'khor dang bcas pa gang dang gang du 'gro ba de dang der rgyal po dang rgyal po'i blon po rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byas te /
translated: Wherever the Venerable Sariputra and Maudgalyayana with their retinues go, there the kings and royal ministers honor them.

original: skabs 'di lta bu gsan nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: skabs 'di lta bu gsan nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: Having heard this topic, he spoke thus.

original: dad pa gang la yod pa de ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa gang la yod pa de ni dad pa'o //
translated: He who has faith is faithful.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa kho nas tshul khrims dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshul khrims phun sum tshogs zhes smos te /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa kho nas tshul khrims dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshul khrims phun sum tshogs zhes smos te /
translated: Since only those who have faith will have morality, he says, “perfect morality.”

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang phrad pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang phrad pa'o //
translated: This refers to the attainment of the vows of individual liberation.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa las ni gtong ba phun sum tshogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa las ni gtong ba phun sum tshogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Since those who have morality will have perfect generosity, he says,

original: gtong ldan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gtong ldan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “generous.”

original: yongs su gzung ba thams cad yongs su btang ba'i phyir dang / rmongs pas yo byad gzhan yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba thams cad yongs su btang ba'i phyir dang / rmongs pas yo byad gzhan yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: This means that they give up all possessions and do not grasp other things out of delusion.
